title: A Bit Commercialized, But Worth The Experience
review: We came here during an evening walk on the riverside promenade and, although it is a very orchestrated, structured Aarti, it still lends itself to being a very spiritual experience. Leave your shoes with the security (a tip is expected), enter the fenced in area (there is also an unfenced area where you don't need to remove your shoes, but has no seating) take a few pictures, and then you are ushered to carpeted, cement steps amongst the many, many people who have come here to pray at this lovely site on the Ganga. Drummers and bell ringers, all dressed exactly the same, step up onto raised platforms in a synchronized manner, and then devotees who have either brought or purchased their offerings of oil lamps and flowers on leaf boats can place them in the holy waters. Please note that, in the plaza at Triveni Ghat, there are a large number of people who ask for food and money. I have been told that people in the area always donate to them because it is blessing to help someone in need. It is your choice, though. You can also visit the evening market/shops that are right next to the ghat and where you will find local folks looking for the same bargains as you are.

title: Unique spiritual experience
review: Arti started at 6.30 pm (pls check timings prior as we are told it varies depending on season). Good to arrive 30 min earlier. Prior to the visit here, we were concerned the place might be have a commercial tone (with suggestions for doing a puja or make an offering similar to some other religious places we had visited before)- here it was nothing of the sort. If you so wish, you can part sponsor the aarti but no pressure on that from anyone. Take your seat (on the footsteps to the Ghat) and enjoy the glorious aarati. The songs are melodious, sung live at the aarti place and not just a recording. Arti is for about 30 min, songs continue for another 30 min. It is a great spiritual experience. It is very blissful to witness the sun go down, aarti being lit, a few odd diyas the majestic Ganga river as it flows by.  It is something one must experience if in Rishikesh. There is no set dress code but good to be conservatively dressed to blend with the crowd and the mood. Take off your shoes at the shoe stand at the Arti place itself. We visited Triveni Ghat and not Parmarth Niketan based on suggestions from local friends that Triveni Ghat is more devout -ideally we would have liked to see both but very happy with the experience at Triveni Ghat.

review: A must do if you are visiting Rishikesh.  The Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is one of the better and cleaner ghats to visit. It is also not as packed as the one in Haridwar. U can also dip your feet in the water however be careful as the flow is quite powerful.

title: Amazing Ghat on the Ganges.
review: The Aarti here is very special.  During the monsoon season it’s not as crowded so you have a much better experience of the Ghat from not being crowded.    The river is very nasty right now though.

title: Great Experience
review: Amazing place at night with the Ganga Arti ceremony.  Fantastic atmosphere.  It is worth the trip to go to Rishikesh  just for this let alone seeing the Ganga

title: Best place in the evening
review: A wonderful place to be visited after the fall of sun.The landscape of mountain and river is mesmerising.You can even converse with the Sadhus if you have blissful intentions.To medidate and levitate.

title: A mesmerising experience
review: One must visit Triveni Ghat during the sunset, evening view here is awesome and the evening Aarti is worth watching.

title: Amazing experience
review: Attended evening aarti at Triveni ghat...Neat and clean.. Fantastic atmosphere and most beautiful music next to the strong flowing Ganga.. Excellent start to our trip into the Himalayas.. Thank you for a surreal experience!

title: Sitting among locals made the ceremony more respectful.
review: We attended 2 aarti. First time in Parmath Niketan, near Ram Jhula. Full of foreigners dancing. Felt so weird.

title: Surreal
review: Watching the Aarti or Maha Aarti performed at Triveni Ghat is one of the "must dos" of Rishikesh. The Ghat itself holds great importance as it is the confluence of 3 rivers i.e. Ganga, Yamuna and  Saraswati and it is here that they merge and form the Ganga, which goes on to flow into the IndoGangentic Planes.

title: Do not miss
review: This is a fantastic sundown ritual where people travel on pilgrimage - fire ceremony, music and chanting. Quite elaborate. Highly recommend. Similar Ceremonies in other local locations on the Ganges.

title: Perfect Puja
review: Incredible experience to feel the energy of this worship, such devotion.  Even if I didn't understand the words, I understood the mood.  Purely blissful mixed with chanting over a loud PA system and fire offerings.  A unique and wonderful experience.

title: Pure bliss
review: Best time to visit is sunset time (just google local sunset time). On 8/July/2018, Aarti started at about 7.30pm.

title: One of the main Aartis in Rishikesh
review: This is one of the most (if not the most) important Aarti that happens in Rishikesh. Bring your beliefs and be blessed by this traditional ceremony by the banks of the Ganga River. It usually starts around 6PM, but the schedule may vary depending on the season. Arrive earlier to get an excellent spot to enjoy the music and the ceremony.

title: Ananding
review: I have witnessed Ganga Aarti at Har ki Pauri, Haridwar many a time, but Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat, Rishikesh is quite different, enjoyable and amazing.  The post aarti bhajan recital by a local group is truly lovely and dance by people and foreigners a treat to watch.  If you are in Rishikesh must watch this.  Also, the area is more clean probably because of less footfalls.

title: Beautiful View at Triveni Ghat
review: Triveni Ghat is one of the most famous Ghat & the view of Maa Ganga River is really beautiful with hills. This is really a amazing Ghat to view natural beautiful.

title: Simply Mersmerizing !!!
review: If there's one place you must visit after the other popular attractions of Rishikesh, its the mermerizing evening Ganga Aarti @ Triveni Ghat. Occupy your seat atleast 30 minutes in advance, to enjoy the approx 30 mins spiritual journey.

title: Simply Amazing. Better than Har Ki Pauri
review: The arathi is a must see. The arathi is so peaceful but powerful visual. 16 priests do the arathi according to the devotional songs played. A large tent is setup for the devotees to sit and watch the amazing performance. Not sure if its a daily performance, but when we were there, we had the opportunity to listen to a live concert and dance performance. The whole performance lasts for about an hour.

title: One of the cleanest Ghats of Holy Ganga
review: Went to witness grand Ganga Aarti, which was truly mesmerising.

title: nothing like ganga aarti in haridwar
review: don't expect a grand aarti like Ganga aarti in Haridwar, this is a mini version of it, though the priest lined up holding these huge diyas in hand make a good sight and also the advantage of this place is you can just hang around if you wanna chill

title: Good for peace and religious people
review: If you are  religious, then its a wonderful place at the time of The Gange Arti. Other wise I don't suggest you to go there

title: amaging Aarti
review: we went to rishikesh 2 months back and enjoyed the aarti of Triveni ghat. amaging, one should attend it

title: Memorable experience
review: We were keen to go for the ganga Aarthi while in Rishikesh, were so glad that our guide recommended the Aarthi at Triveni ghatt which happens at 7.00pm

title: Ganga Aarti in serenity!
review: Triveni ghat sets the stage for one of the most serene Ganga Aarti I have witnessed [others being Varanasi, Haridwar & Parmarth Niketan]. The glow of the lamps dancing to the synchronised actions of 16 pandits dressed identically - including 5 younger trainees is sight, at the magical twilight hour!

title: Not so maintained
review: we had been here but not so clean compared to  Swaminarayan Ghat..Its ok..They should maintain cleanliness ,otherwise spiritual level is great. Gangamaiya  flow is  awesome. God bless all.

title: Peace
review: Very nice Aarti in evening of river Ganges .place is bit congested but as you reach there view is wide and beautiful

title: A must place to visit in Rishikesh .
review: Paid 300 Rs, which is minimum for doing an aarti over here and got inside the mandap or the closed place .After paying they provide you a slip which has to be shown to the pujari over there who allots you the table for the puja /aarti purpose . They provide you everything there ,still you can bring your own stuff for the rituals if you want to . The aarti lasts for some 15 mins or so . Do visit in the evenings as the grand aarti takes place round about 7 pm or so before which your stuff should finish . My advice is , reach here at approx 6 pm so that after completion of your aarti you can have the grand view of the main aarti . Its a holy experience and a sight to behold . Wonderful thing watching them performing those rituals .You can see it from outside the closed area also but I will advice that you should pay and go in .

title: Its a spectacular view attending the Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
review: When u visit reishikesh, one must attend the Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat, its a must and the aura at the place at the time of aarti is very good .

title: Mesmerizing Aarti
review: Mother Ganga has been flowing since ages, emperors have come and emperors have gone, thousands of years this river flows through and its water is really nectar. Arti at Parmarth Ashram is just hypnotic and casts a spell on those present. A tribute to the environmental friendly culture which worships rivers as mothers.

title: Spiritual Experience
review: The Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is a must visit, it reminds you of the aarti that happens at Banaras. Unlike at other places, aarti is sung and performed live. 3 rivers - Bhagirathi, Alaknanda and Mandakini combine here to form River Ganges.

title: Best Ganga Aarti
review: I have visited Ganga Aarti in Haridwar and the other one in Rishikesh itself. This was the best one. Organized and clean . Loved the whole show

title: Very good
review: Must go during your visit to rishikesh can pay 300 inr n part of aarati good management n you can only Ganga flowing

title: Really Spiritual Place
review: Nice place, feel a tranquility at the shore of river Ganges. Safe place to bathe. There are dress changing rooms for ladies. There are several huge banyan trees. Two of them are twin trees- one more tree on one banyan tree. There are several street vendors to sell fancy items.

title: Beautiful
review: The aarti of maa ganga was the best thing to see here at tiveni ghat ... There is some construction going on so be careful with the kids.. even the flow of ganga river is very high so don't take any risk while taking bath....

title: biggest ghat in rishikesh
review: crowded but a major point ...reaching here can be a task due to heavy traffic and crowds but its worth it to reach here by 6 pm for aarti

title: A different experience
review: We visited the Triveni Ghat Ganga Aarti recently. The experience itself was quite unique. The chants with the Ganges flowing is quite different from anything you may have experienced.

title: Enjoyed aarti
review: Great setups of aarti ..nice ganga ghat. Crowd but enjoyed my aarti sessions. Big areas if ghaat for bath ...

title: Being Spiritual
review: Yes we should be spiritual ... but once you reach here you will be automatically realize that we should be.

title: morning visit
review: I was not able to visit the place during aarti, but in morning also this place looks beautiful. You must take bath in it. It is confluence of ganga,yamuna and saraswati. Very near to market. You can go there by walking.

title: Awesome
review: I specifically went for Arti in evening and that was really devine ,just loved it .so much of peace comes to mind and soul . beautiful view of ganges

title: VERY SERENE VERY TRANQUIL
review: The feeling of serenity and tranquilness prevails at evening Aarti. Zero commercialisation.The best part is that your vehicle can reach at a walking distance to the ghat.

title: MUST MUST MUST ATTEND
review: If you haven't attended the arti, you've not visited rishikesh! It's beautiful, divine, all positive vibes kindof a place! The ganga looks so so beautiful and mesmerizing!

title: Har har Gange Namami Gange
review: We have been to Triveni Ghat in the month of May2018. Being from Metros we only orally say that the nature is our mother.  But here we can see that not Gangaji is worshipped as our mother. We get goose gumps when the Arti starts .

title: Jai Ma Ganga
review: Triveni Ghat at Rishikesh, is one of the bigger Ghats on the River Ganga at Rishikesh. The Ghat is popular for bathing and a dip in the Holy Ganga. Water near the Ghat is around 2-3 feet in Summer, not very contaminated and relatively slow flowing. The Ganga Aarti conducted here, at 7 pm daily by the Ganga, is a must see, if staying near by. Well organized with the chanting of stotras and devotional music, played live, it is a sublime experience to first hand experience the devotion and spiritual sentiments for Ganga Ma. Try to arrive by 6.00 pm to get good seating. The aarti is a must see and must photograph event here.

title: Ganga Arati at Rishikesh
review: Arati at Triveni Ghat on Bank of river ganga is a must see ! It is a spelbound feeling in the evening. Ganga Devi temple is another major attraction in this ghat.

title: Divine, pure ceremony...not to be missed when in Rishikesh.
review: We are in Rishikesh and went to attend the Triveni Ghat evening aarti yesterday. Triveni Ghat is a little far from Tapovan (by Rishikesh's standards :) ) however it was worth all the trouble after being stuck in the gruelling traffic.

title: Wonderful experience
review: A wonderful ritual to witness and be part of. There was place to sit and room to breathe.. just.. highly recommended

title: Jai Ma Gangga
review: This is the best aarti in Rishikesh, I came from a little far alley which is Sai Mandir, and then I found that the walking area by the river is really really nice place to spend time and relaxe for a sunset. The fire burning on the aarti is just amazing.

title: Aarti on ghat
review: A good enriching experience attending an aarti on ganges ghat

title: Mesmerizing vibes
review: Evening Aarti is a mesmerizing sight. It's good to soak in the vibes and energy before the actual Aarti begins.

title: Nice sight
review: Even if you are not religious, this is something to watch. Done on the banks of the Ganga, late evening, the aarti performance by the disciples does evoke emotions and is a pleasing sight. A must see in Rishikesh.

title: Evening Aarti Delight
review: If you are interested to see the evening Aarti then visit in the evening time only. During day time can be visit for holy bath. Maintenance is not satisfactory. Area is full with beggars. Sad to see it was mentioned in boards not to wash clothes but devotees were seen washing clothes in the river.

title: Wow what a place
review: The Ganga Aarti in the evening makes this place come alive. I went and sat on the riverbank at 5.15 p.m. and the Aarti commenced at 5.30 p.m.

title: ganga aarti
review: The aarti performed at Triveni ghat was mesmerizing. There was huge crowd but all were sitting silently. The prayer performed was excellent .I liked it very much.

title: A place where serenity and divinity unites.
review: The serene and devine evening aarti at Triveni Ghat will certainly give you a lifetime experience. The sight is so devine and beautiful, that it will make you full of reverence. Its a must watch from my side.

title: Best place for meditation
review: Cool n calm place to do meditation in late evening.

title: Excellent experience
review: A very uplifting experience on the banks of the river with ancient chants and rituals.

title: Triveni Ghat is must visit especially if you are not visiting Haridwar
review: We took the opportunity to participate in spectacular evening Aarti ( Evening prayers) on the ghat. It was a great spiritual experience.

title: ONCE IN A LIFETIME EXPERINCE
review: Amazing , beautiful and serene . The energy of the puja is mesmerizing .! Just hope there was a way to do it without the pollution and litter

title: Divine word is less to describe
review: This place is within 7-8 Kms from main mkt

title: Enjoyed Aarti
review: Crowed place.. Very close to river. Enjoyed Ganga Aarti in the evening by lots of pandit ji.. Attractive Aarti season

title: Mesmerizing
review: I ain't religious but was mesmerized witnessing the spiritual synergy created during the ganga aarti.

title: Aarti was nice.
review: The Aarti was nice . But the cleanliness was really sad. Everywhere you see waste of food and garbage lying around . It was stinking . The whole Aarti went for a toss . I personally felt Aarti at brabhat ghat was much better.

title: Mesmerizing Aarti
review: We attended the Ganga aarti here one evening. Very well organized. U can take d coupon of personally performing d aarti for as less as 500/- during non season time. The aarti was so spiritual, blissful and mesmerizing. It's been more than 2months and yet the rythm is in our minds. Please don't miss d Triveni Ghat aarti if u r in Rishikesh. This ghat is a little away from main Rishikesh,but it's worth ur time. U won't forget this for years to come

title: Sonorously spiritual
review: Its a very spiritual and moving experience to witness the Ganga aarti at Triveni ghat. The live bhajan singing starts from before dusk and continues into the Aarti. The Pandits and their apprentices in full colourful regalia, line up at the ghat at  sundown. The lamps are lit and the aarti begins. One is caught up in the melodious waves and the hypnotic movements of the blazing lamps. The chants and the lights, all add up to a very spiritual and pure experience. A not to be missed one.

title: Religious activity
review: I am not a religious person but went there to experience the feel of the Arti, it is crowded but manageable, nice feel of the whole arti event, the way they perform is not spectacular but nice to see, experience it

title: Couldn't see anything
review: Couldn't see d aarti. But a must visit . Attending d aarti may not be useful as one can't see anything due to d rush

title: there's nothing like this
review: For ages, Ganga has been a source of inspiration to saints, sages, poets, authors, scientists, leaders, and many who have gathered at Her banks.  Ganga is not only the lifeline of nearly 500 million people who live along Her banks and the ecosystems She supports, but She is truly the cultural and spiritual heritage of India.  “If Ganga lives, India lives.  If Ganga dies, India dies.

title: Wonderful Experience
review: We attended Ganga Aarati on the Triveni Ghat and I must say that it was a wonderful experience. It begins at around sunset and is well organized. Good sight for the photographers as well. Don't miss if you are in Rishikesh

title: Awesome
review: A 2 km walk along the marine drive from our hotel.

title: Beautiful view and experience
review: Visited Triveni Ghat in the evening to view Ganga Puja. It was interesting to see people there from different walks of life and faith. It's a must see experience.

title: Serene experience
review: We visited Triveni Ghat to witness Ganga Aarti on 30th of March in our way back to Delhi from Auli.

title: Swim, bathe and heal your battered soul
review: The Triveni Ghat in Rishikesh is a special place. Whether you prefer to immerse yourself into the great Ganga there at night or quietly in the morning is up to you.

title: Aarti was divine
review: The triveni ghat was a stone's throw from our hotel. The walk leading upto it was brilliant. The ganga aarti was a divine experience. The mountains added to the magic. It was great. Just hope the river Ganga is kept clean and people are not allowed to float things in it. It can get very crowded during peak season. Hold onto ur kids hands.

title: Triveni Ghat - A blessing to visit and stay
review: Heart of town. Superb Aarti experience and  view of Ganga.Charismatic Aarti morning and evening. Nearby local markets. Must visit for Rishikesh. Try to stay nearby for enhancing ur experience to wake up to a eternally pleasing view of Ganga from your window. A fantastic Hotel is Ganga Paradise in vicinity but need to pre book to prioritise Ganga view rooms in advance and worth paying the prices.

title: Triveni Ghat: Personalized Ganga Devi Ma Puja and Aarti
review: Very comfortable ghat to reach and enjoy Ganga Ma Aarti in the evening where the staff and Pandits are very cooperative and descent with doing the personalized Puja and Aarti for any person who makes a donation of minimum Rs 300/=. Place is serene and comfortable. One can get accommodated easily to even watch the Ganga Ma Aarti at this Ghat. It has parking place also and no one will force you to dish out any money.

title: you will the love the flow
review: It has very less crowded compared to Haridwar's Aarti. You can enjoy the Aarti. It is beautiful and can see how beautiful they do in synchronization.

title: Divine Experience
review: Triveni Ghat in Rishikesh is a spiritual bathing ghat with many accreditation. The best attraction at the ghat is "Maa Ganga Aarti" organised by Ganga Sabha every evening. The aarti is a way to offer the prayers to goddess ganga!

title: Blessed Soul
review: It’s very peaceful compare to other places in India compare to the rush of people.

title: Very good experience of Ganga Aarti
review: Amazing Aarti. The puja before the Aarti was a blessed experience. It's a must if you are here seeking peace and grounding.

title: Divine
review: Must watch this beautiful aarti to Ganga. Beautiful, divine and mesmerising. Triveni Ghat is a clean, well maintained Ghat as well. Must visit.

title: Holiday
review: Awesome

title: Mesmerizing
review: The Ganga Aarti here is mesmerizing.  Excellent Bhajan support enhances the experience.  It is completely different from the Ganga Aarti we saw previous night at Har-ki-Pauri in Haridwar.  It is a must watch during the Rishikesh visit.

title: Amazing Aarti
review: Visited the Ghat BT the Recommendation of Mr Deep working at Ganga Kinare. I must say it was the best decision.

title: Arati
review: I stayed not far fro here, evening Arti is very nicely performed. People come here from a far to bath.

title: Divine experience of Ganga Aarti
review: Attended Ganga maa Aarti on 24th April alongwith wife, it was a devine experience, we were spent almost 90 minutes there, 16 pandit's started Aarti with enchanted mantras & bhajans. Beyond imagination experience. Must attend while in Rishikesh

title: Soothing peaceful place
review: This bank on river Ganga is situated below Ram jhoola on the city side ( Rishikesh) Great place to sit and enjoy the views of Ganga waves in a tranquil breeze . One can watch Ganga Aarti as well at 7 pm .

title: OK
review: it was a hot crowded evening when i visited this ghat for ganga aarti. personally i moved ahead to Shatrughan Ghat at Ram Jhulla and enjoyed the experience there rather than triveni ghat.

title: Mr and mrs
review: Great place to stay.the hotel is clean and set in a nice environment. The views of Ganges are beautiful

title: Soulful experience
review: The most calming and rejuvinating experience in rishikesh is to witness the Ganga Arti on Triveni Ghat. Mesmerising to see so many poojaris holding the lamps and going in sync in performing the daily ritual.

title: Spiritual
review: The Aarti is beautiful choreographed... Good views of the Ganges at sunset.. Easily reachable by shared Vikram rickshaw.. Very peaceful and serene environment.. Must do in rishikesh

title: SPIRITUAL AND HOLY
review: We were there for our kauri pass trek .. we did got some time on our stay at rishikesh .

title: Divine experience
review: The Arti at triveni ghat starts at 6 30.. Be there on time..  There will be pandits doing  the Arti. If you want to do Arti for your family, you have to register at the counter...  It's a bliss to experience the Arti accompanied by live music. Small Arti thalis are circulated among all the devotees and everybody will get chance to do it...  After Arti there will be Bhajan for half an hour...  Must visit

title: Ganga arthi
review: worth a visit. homa was performed , after that the Ganga arthi was performed with nice chanting/back round music to set the tone.one gets a nice view of the river while the arthi is being performed

title: Best Arti happening place to be in evening.
review: Pure vibes at the time of Pooja and Arti the place becomes a Ritualistic bliss and the Ganges flow remains calm and eternal.

title: Amazing Aarti.
review: We got here early and well worth it. The Aarti is breathtaking to watch. As the sun goes down and the cermony begins you get a close up experience of what the Aarti is all about. fantastic. Again worth the visit.

title: Evening arty
review: A great place to watch the evening arty(prayer to mother Ganga) takes place about 7pm close to the main bazaar and many restaurants

title: Ganga not at its best be, but aarti is must see
review: The arti is must see, photogenic due to many pandit standing in a row in same attire.... But the Ganga isn't at its best here

title: Spiritual visit
review: Ganga Arathi is amazing and blissful songs and kirtans.  A scenic walk along Ganga river, perfect place to make offerings, partake in prayers and take holy dip....

title: Invokes spiritualism and camls ones mind
review: TImings vary depending on the season. Wasnt much crowded as we visited in march which is off season. Entire aarti completes in less than 30 mins. Mesmerizing to watch priests with huge lamps performing in coordination. If you miss this one make sure you either catch the one at parmarth ashram or in Haridwar at har ki Pauri.

title: Must attend
review: If you visit Rishikesh you should attend Triveni Ghar Arti and if you pay 300 rs. you can also do it.

title: Rishikesh trip
review: Best place for Ganga Aarti. Very well organised for visitors. Will surely like to visit again. Must reach max by 6 pm for comfortable seating.

title: Most peaceful Aarti
review: If i have to compare between Haridwar or RIshikesh Aarti, i think i ll be biased towards Rishikesh as its far more peaceful to experience the aarti there, less crowded and beautifully representated and every person is involved in the Aarti which is what makes you part of the aarti vs a viewer. Enjoyed our experience there.

title: I could feel immense sprituality at time of arti
review: Witnessing the sight of Ganga Arti is itself a divine feeling. It can not be replaced by anything. The sprituality, purety of the arti along with the amazing view of the Ganges would leave you mesmerized. This is the best part of visiting Rishikesh.

title: A wonderful, spiritual location ....
review: Having experienced the AARTI in Haridwar, the day before, this morning was perfect for absorbing all the cultural movement in the Triveni Ghat area.  This may be one of the best places in Rishikesh to relax along side of the holy, River Ganges, and reflect on where life is taking you.  (Does that sound too heavy).  Life is short .... enjoy it while you can.  Safe travels.

title: Triveni Ghat
review: If you want a relaxing atmosphere, then its best to head to triveni ghat at 6.30 pm to not only enjoy beautiful sunset but also see Pujaris performing evening aarti in sync.

title: peaceful place
review: just sit there and feel the positive waves of maa ganga. evening aarti is excellent. you can feel energy .

title: Ganga Aarti feeling amazing.
review: Triveni Ghat Rishikesh is beautiful evening Ganga Aarti feeling amazing and peaceful Triveni Ghat - A confluence of three holy important Rivers the Ganges, the Yamuna and the Saraswathy,

title: Life time's experience...
review: If you want to immersed in the rituals of Ganga Aarti performed every day at the bank of Ganga near Ram Jhula at Muni Ki Reti, you must be there before sun set if you are in Rishikesh. Very less crowd unlike in Har Ki Paudi in Haridwar.  Words cannot express the feelings.  You can feel the serene atmosphere by going through the attached photographs.  Highly recommended.

title: A must visit place at Rishikesh
review: We have to walk down from the main road, through steps and slopes to reach this ghat on the bank of river Ganga. You can not miss this place if you want to see the spectacular Ganga Aarthi, which is conducted here every evening at 6 p.m. If we go early we can walk around the ghat to see the temple there and also beautiful statues and images of God and the fountains neatly organised. There is a free counter for keeping the Shoes.  As you come out of the Ghat you will find a big market road before you reach the main road.

title: An overwhelming experience
review: Unlike the daily Aarti routine, this was some different experience. The atmosphere was filled with holy sounds.

title: Ganga Arti
review: I would say this was the best part of my trip to Rishikesh.

title: Amazing ritual
review: We weren’t sure what to expect and were blown away by the ritual!  Buy a small flower basket -10-20 rupees - on the way in so you can make an offering and participate. Seeing the devotion people have to Mother Ganga and knowing that people travel from afar - we met a couple from south Africa who travelled to this sacred place to offer their thanks and afk for s blessing - is pretty amazing. We’re told that this happens every day at sundown, all year. We attended here and in other cities in the area. Each was different and beautiful in its own way. Not to be missed.

title: Most wonderful Aarti in Rishikesh
review: This is one of the wonderful Aartis I think we have attended in India.  It's on a little smaller scale but the audience is involved passing the lamps at the end.   It was a beautiful setting and atmosphere!

title: Magically choreographed Sacred Ritual Aarti to Mother Ganges.
review: The sacred Ganga river is said to be the physical manifestation of the Akasha Ganga, the stars of the Heavenly Milky Way. Aarti is an ancient ritual where fire symbolizing the great mystery of consciousness and life is offered to the Mystery at the power points of the day, sunrise and sunset. The priests at Triveni ghat do a beautifully choreographed mystical ritual. They are focused and sincere...this is the real deal.

title: Nice
review: Beautifully done. Can book own arti when you reach venue. Water flow wasn't much on this side. Compact venue with limited people. Easy to reach.

title: Uplifting ceremony
review: Wonderful experience that transcends social, cultural, and language barriers. The energy is palpable during this ceremony.

title: Good experience and nice atmosphere.
review: Triveni Ghat is very close to the market place at Rishikesh. One of the best Ganga Artis in the town. The ghat is clean and quite long. You could reach early and spend some time in solace with the view of the sun setting. The arti starts at 6.30pm, and is quite a spectacle. Not too crowded on weekdays.

title: A Beautiful Ceremony
review: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is an amazing experience.  Not only so you see sevaks wield multi-tiered diyas in a mesmerizing rhythm, the musicans chant slokas to the Divine Mother Ganga. When I was there recently, I was moved in a way that I can't describe.  It's also a community experience; viewers dance and chant, and you might be surprised by a local worshiper breaking out in the most amazing dance, lost in a Spiritual trance.  You can't help but be swept up in the magic!

title: Really Nice. Very popular
review: A lot of Indians but also Tourists. Very big, but the same as those smaller ceremonies. Good for photos..

title: Divine!
review: Went with family for Triveni aarti. Best is to reach early around 5.30 pm an hour before the Aarti. Even better is to take part in Aarti by greeting a receipt at the counter at the entrance of the ghat. That way a poojari will perform a Ganga poojan on your families behalf and you can get a view of the Aarti from the first line itself. All in all a very divine experience.

title: Fantastic experience
review: The Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat takes place every evening around 6pm and is not to be missed when visiting Rishikesh.  It is an incredible experience.  Highly recommended.

title: Spiritual
review: The Ganga Aarti lifts you to another place altogether. Felt calm watching it. A must see for all visiting Rishikesh.

title: Blessings
review: Ganga Aarti at triveni that is a must visit.

title: Great Experience
review: The ever energetic and pure Ganga river changing its colors at sunset in the midst of chants and mantras with people worshipping it with fire and flowers is a soul touching experience. Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is a must for anyone visiting Rishikesh.

title: Heavenly Experience!
review: On the banks of river Goddess Ganga, the holy Ganga Aarti in evening at @Triveni Ghat is truly a heavenly experience. In background awesome Bhajan's (Hindu Devotional Music), Sunset, Beautiful green Ganga water, peacful Religious chants and finally the priests holding the Aarti deepaks and praying Goddess Ganga to keep Showering her blessing on billions. Believe me it's an experience of life time. If you are near Rishikesh don't miss this heavenly experience

title: A moving experience
review: Unlike other aarthi celebrations in the ultra-holy cities of Haridwar and Varanasi, this one is relatively informal. It's no less holy of course, being performed on the banks of the Ganges, but it's smaller and the audience seems more involved in the ceremony. This is particularly noticeable towards the end of the ceremony, when a flame is passed from hand to hand, not only by the priests but by those gathered here too.

title: Powerful aarti, must attend atleast once...
review: The Ganga aarti conducted here is done as it is done at Varanasi. It is very co-ordinated and wonderful to watch. Much more than the co-ordinated aarti, what needs to be mentioned is the power one can experience during the aarti.

title: Best Ganga Aarthi at Rishikesh, not to be missed.
review: We visited ganga aarthi after participating in the Ganga Aarthi at haridwar, the previous day. Both the Aarthis are great in their own way, but I liked the one at Triveni ghat( marginally) because it was well organised and the same time, less crowded when compared to Haridwar and most of us were able to participate in the Aarthi. it is also very spectacular.

title: A unique experience
review: There is nothing beautiful about it but the experience is worth a visit - its unique in that every evening tens of thousands of people gather here to offer prayers to river Ganges - the most sacred river in India (after perhaps the now non-existent Saraswati river). Its breathtaking to watch thousands of lanterns / candles in the evening during the prayer ceremony.

title: Really worth watching
review: Beautiful celebration and thanksgiving to Ganga (the river Ganges). Beauty, devotion, simplicity, vibrant. Definitely worth watching!

title: Must
review: This is very large arti in rishikesh at 6 pm . must watch once in your life time . in large amount of people are there. Very religious.

title: Beautiful experience
review: This was a treat to the eyes. The aarti scenes gave goosebumps. It is so perfectly and beautifully executed by the pandits at Ganga ghat.

title: Worth the experience
review: Definitely worth a visit even for those who are not religious(As the duration is only 20 25 mins) . One can simply observe and enjoy the evening.

title: AAHA
review: Just few minutes away Triveni Ghat

title: Dont miss the Ganga Aarti
review: The Ganga Aarti at Triveni ghat was a truly moving experience. It lasts longer than the one at Har ki Pauri - and a different experience altogether. Dont miss it

title: x
review: wonderful.nice atmosphere.very clean and comfortable.enough place to see arati by sitting and standing.

title: Excellent
review: What a view from Triveni ghat. But its now good business option for Pujaris. They costs heavily to public for pooja at ghat.

title: An amazing experience
review: I immediately felt included, and the spiritual atmosphere felt amazing. It felt authentic, and it was a very beautiful experience. We were at another arti on the other side of Ganges closer to Laxman Jhula, and there was nowhere near the same atmosphere of openness, authenticity and spirituality as there was here. Beautiful.

title: Magical ceremony
review: The Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is a powerful experience, I really loved it!  Such an uplifting energy, beautiful chants and fire rituals. It was so beautiful to see all the people so engaged with the ceremony! One of my favorite places to visit in Rishikesh!

title: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat Rishikesh was a wonderful experience. Priests conduct a pooja for you and family.
review: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat Rishikesh was a wonderful experience. Priests conduct a pooja for you and family. Very sprititual experience. A Prasad is given after pooja.

title: Just amazing
review: This place is highly recommended, I also went to the Aarti at Haridwar and whilst that was also amazing, there are many people hassling you especially the ‘priests’

title: A little confusing initally
review: We were a little confused to exactly what the Aarti consisted of initially, and a couple of times we were tempted to leave - as we felt like we were intruding on the Hindu ceremony, however we were glad we stayed. A really exciting (& loud) experience, which is a must do when in Rishikesh.

title: Good place but there are better
review: Here all the pooja is so good but the river is very lean as it is small branch of the main river. So better to go to Paramarth Niketan where you do pooja for the actual Ganga ji.

title: A surreal ceremony along the Ganga
review: Really cool experience. I enjoyed that we could participate by offering flowers to the river. If you're staying near Laxman Jhula or Ram Jhula, be sure to get a shared tuk-tuk to Trifeni Ghat....I shared with 6 others and we each paid only Rs20. Definitely recommend attending Ganga Aarti!

title: Fantastic Experience
review: This is a must for anyone visiting Rishikesh. The experience unlike at Ram Jhula is mind blowing. The dedication of the boys doing this must be applauded

title: Divine experience
review: All the students/pujaris perform aarti in sync n professional approach.

title: Commercial
review: Experienced ganga arati over here, for the same reason dropped plan to visit nilkantheswar temple. Which turned out to be wrong decision as this place felt like a commercial place.

title: Divine
review: We reached at triveni ghat before 5 pm to get front seats once we got there the atmosphere was already divine u can feel the positive vibes once u get there.

title: BEAUTIFUL VIEW
review: very nice and holy place to visit at Triveni Ghat for Ganga arti at evening. you can feel the silent activities in this moment.

title: Holy scene of Ganga River Aarti
review: In the evening the Aarti of Ganga river is done on the bank of Har Ki Podi.  The Scene is very spititual and meditating.  It is very beautiful place.  Huge rush is find during the Aarti time

title: Amazong experience
review: Must attend aarti to make your soul more beautiful... Beautiful sounds of bells to make ur Heart pure.

title: Purity
review: One of the oldest place of Ganga Arti . Very wide view of holy Ganges . You can take a dip in Ganges and Arti is very traditional and peaceful . Must visit place if you are in Rishikesh

title: A holy silent peaceful place
review: This ghat of rishikesh is a sacred and holy place to spend your evenings. You can see and dip into evening arti.

title: divine
review: went all the way from rishikesh to haridwar to see the Aarti..amazing view and the aarti made it worth it

title: Once in a lifetime
review: To experience the ceremony

title: Best
review: Best best best vibe I ever feel in my life when I was near the Ganges while Aarti song was chanting.

title: Ganga aarti
review: Still in this modern era worship of nature is well practiced in this area.  Aarti is the ceremony of worshipping God with lught

title: A holy sight to behold
review: We reached the Triveni ghat by 4.30pm as the aarti starts by 5.30pm. We jumped right to the front however, that place is reserved for the people who have the aartis for the day. The amount is not fixed and is left to the patrons. We also took up an aarti and as the clock struck 5.30pm, the chanting started. As the sun went down, the ghat came alive with the chants and the big lamps. We were taken to one of the 15 Puja sections and a pundit made us go through the rituals. It got over a little over 6.15pm. The various statues were lit and bright. Do visit the 2 adjoining temples.

title: A MUST DO WHEN IN RISHIKESH
review: plan the evening well in advance... the lanes are narrow to reach there... walking gets u there faster. Reach half hour before sunset - so plan accordingly from ur respective hotels. Take Sunglasses/Hats/Caps as the sun sets right opposite where you will be seated.

title: ganga aarti
review: it was great experience of ganga aarti with huge crowd coming and watching the ganga aarti

title: beautiful
review: very good ambiance..majestic..much better than benaras..did a private aarti..it was lovely..sitting by the ganges there was a transcendent experience.

title: Touching
review: A wonderful experience watching the Aarti at the river Ganges. Such a special spiritual place and event.

title: Blissful experience
review: The Ganga aarti is one of the best attaractions at Rishikesh. Zostel Rishikesh organised our trip to this place and the experince was just beautiful and mesmerising

title: Good Vibes
review: Want good vibes surrounding you, head to triveni ghat. Going there is a little cluttered because you need to go past a crowded market but its worth your effort.

title: Very Peaceful Place
review: Triveni Ghat is very peaceful place. Thousand of people are available here aarti time. I enjoyed the time spent there.

title: The best aarti in the area.
review: Most beautiful aarti, well organized and not a chaos like in Haridwar.  Amazing experience.  We were able to enjoy sitting comfortably.  Did not have to beat the crowds.

title: Beautiful ritual and spiritual experience
review: Triveni Ghaat Aarti of the Ganges was really a beautiful experience...the procession of the whole event is so organized...I am grateful for this wonderful blessing!

title: Stunning Cultural Experience
review: This is the BEST spot for Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh. The Aarti is serene and calm and very authentic like the Varanasi Aarti. It makes you feel connected with the powerful river. The bhatjis pass around one plate so that the spectators can pray as well.

title: Ganga Aarti in Haridwar.
review: This was my first time visiting Haridwar with the family. I wasn't very sure if I wanted to go watch aarti of any kind, but was pleasantly surprised by how beautiful it looked in the evening with the Ganges as a backdrop. Everything was very well organized and the aarti started right on time.

title: Bliss
review: It's pure bliss attending Gangs Aati here. You will feel so calm after that . There is something in the air which makes the whole environment so spiritual. It happens around 6 pm so be there on time. It's quite near to Ram Jhula .

title: Absolutely breathtaking and awe-inspiring
review: Loved the experience.  Will definitely come back.

title: Food for Soul
review: Thanks to Mr.Khanna from divine resort for suggesting this. It was mesmerizing a true treat for the soul. No words to describe this, It needs to be experienced.

title: Beautiful Ceremony
review: Lovely welcoming and inclusive spiritual ceremony with very enjoyable singing, a visual treat, highly recommended

title: Nice aarti
review: A number of pandits do arti parallely on different tables. People can also join. Different experience to watch the arti being done by a number of pandits in natural surroundings.

title: Nice ganga aarti
review: Nice ganga aarti we saw at tribeni ghat with class of puja ceremony.nice flow of river . peaceful place in corner of city

title: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
review: A spiritual place for all devotees. Triveni Ghat is famous for it's Ganga Aarti. If you are visiting Rishikesh and should go to Triveni Ghat also. It's just 15 mins away from Ram Jhula.

title: Amazing, welcoming and so so moving
review: Beautiful Aarti at the Ganges.. Everyone was very welcoming and its a wonderful way to feel the spirit of Rishikesh and join in honoring place and tradition.

title: Rishikesh Aarti
review: A must experience at sunset across the Ram Julha bridge on the ghats every night at sunset. The fire ceremony is magnificent. After purchase puja candle and flowers and send a prayer into The Ganges.

title: Mesmerizing
review: Don't miss it if you are in rishikesh. People might tell you that this Aarti is same as the one at parmarth Niketan but believe me this is 100 times better. There will be 16 priests doing the Ganga Aarti in sync. Post Aarti there will be some bhajans which will definitely not let you to leave the place. Triveni ghat is a little far from tapovan area or lakshman Jhula but sharing tuktuks are easily available at 20 Rs per person. Full tuktuk can be booked at 150 to 200 from tapovan. Must see this Aarti for a lifetime experience

title: Very nice
review: This was a great experience. We went in the evening and saw this for about 15 - 20 minutes. This is something I would strongly recommend for all  visitors to Rishikesh. Creates an amazing ambience.

title: Most spiritual experience
review: We loved the aarti ceremony. Enjoyed by tourists mainly as it is peaceful serene and well organised. Be there by 5pm and pertake in bhajans and priest coordinate the aarti's at the river in sequence ..about 10 to 20 priest clearly viewed by all. Beautiful experiance...river is calm and loved the fact that we were left to do our own exploring...less beggars and locals... loved walking and seeing the little temples  by walkway.

title: Breathtaking and THE BEST ARTI AT RISHIKESH
review: I have seen and experienced lot of Arti's at Rishikesh

title: Yes, a must see in Rishikesh
review: Be there an hour before sunset . Have a seat and watch how the prayers are conducted to give respect to the Ganges. Heavenly feeling . No rushing or pushing around .

title: Religious place
review: The ganga aarti experience is a must when you are in haridwar.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: The place is true bliss when the Aarti starts as the mantra chanted makes the air vibrant , the synchronised movements of pandas while performing Aarti is worth a watch. Will recommend to visit once in evening by 1700 hrs to get a good seat and watch Aarti.

title: Soul refining
review: Beautiful place with wonderfully organized Aarti. No hustle and tussle, u actually feel connected with entire event and eventually spiritual.

title: Stunning experience
review: I got a chance to attend Ganga Aarti in evening during sunset, the pandit with the Aarthi thal ready for aarti Ganga river, the crowd which includes me, feel very peaceful from inside of the heart.

title: Awesome and very spiritual.
review: Wonderful experience to see the aarthi performed right in front of your eyes with a live band performing soul searching songs. A mesmerizing time. Kudos to the organizers for allowing guests to participate in d arthi itself

title: peacefull place i ever seen
review: when i was little i go rishikesh.

title: Must visit
review: Its a spectacle with live music and an amazing aarti..The person singing bhajans is a real talent and is called local jagjit singh.

title: Worth enduring the crowd
review: Ganga Aarti is a beautiful ceremony at the Triveni Ghat in Rishikesh. Despite large amount of (mostly local) tourists, it feels rather authentic and definitely a good experience that provides for some colorful pics, if that's what you are after. Go early to get in among the first and secure a good seat.

title: Wonderful!
review: If you plan to visit Ganges, do wait for the Aarti. Very nice and beautiful and grab a seat as soon as you can , probably elm and chat with friends to pass time, but must wait to see the Aarti. I was mesmerised with the view and the feel it gives. It takes almost 2hours, but you will not regret, I am sure.

title: Nice ganga aarti.
review: Wonderful time at ganga aarti. Singing and music was very good. Just close your eyes and feel it. Surrounding views are also very good with mountains and forest. Also visit Bharat mandir 400 meter far from here.

title: Amazing spiritual experience
review: Must attend this aarti....a life time experience...the amazing environment that they create is soul touching

title: Peaceful Aarti
review: We had a nice time doing Puja and Aarti here!! Very peaceful place and must visit. Try and conduct do the Puja to get a first hand experience!

title: Such beautiful view!
review: I took a walk on a winter evening and the chilling wind was amazing. It displays big statues along with a fountain. It also has small chat stalls to curb your hunger.

title: Ganga arti at Triveni ghat
review: Mesmerised arti at Triveni Ghat in Rishikesh. Place was not over crowded, plenty of space to sit down.  Very well organised, loved every bit of it.  Would definitely recommend to visit this place if you are around

title: Nice and well managed
review: We reached a little before the arti began.

title: sunset and ganga aarathi
review: Awesome place to hangout in evening. Ganga aarathi makes a perfect ending for the day. The place provide option for anybody who wants to do ganga aarathi. The ganga aarathi is less crowded hence the view is clear and can be enjoyed fully.

title: Inclusive experience
review: Scores of people gathered for the aarti and there was plenty of space. The atmospere was quiet and meditative. Clearly there were people there who knew very little about what was happening and watched quietly as well as devotees who were worshipping. Very moving experience and well worth the time to stay and watch.

title: Perfect for shopping & eating also
review: You can reach here by Vikram (6-seater). Takes Rs 20 from Lakshman Jhula area & Rs 5 or max 10 from Ram Jhula area.

title: Highlight of Rishikesh
review: I have been there few times. Always a very nice setting.  A very spiritual event. I recommend crossing the crossing the Ram Jhula bridge to the other side, turn left and in few hundred meters after the market and join the Ganga Arti at Parmath Aarti Stahl.

title: A must visit
review: If you are visiting rishikesh then Ganga Aarti here in a MUST. It's a goose bum kinda thing which is worth feeling it within than words can describe here. You can also sponsor a Aarti where one of the diyas will be lit in your name..

title: Ganga Arti was nice but not as grand as what you see in Haridwar
review: See my review on Hotel Ganga Kinare for more details. The Aarti starts around 6.30-7. The Ghat is adjacent to the main market. Adequate arrangements for seating.

title: Great ritual and ceremony you can’t miss!
review: It’s one of best highlights in Rishikesh. It’s beautiful ceremony the shows the culture of ghats people and their respect for Lord. I went to there with guide from my ashram. I asked him why and what they were doing. He explained me everything. He also took flowers with candle for us so we can let them go on the river and respect the rituals. It was really beautiful. That’s what you can’t miss!

title: Uplifting and welcoming
review: We were the only westerners in attendance at a local Aarti. Beautiful ceremony and warm welcoming people.

title: Wonderful!
review: I absolutely loved the experience of Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat.  What a magical night spent with my fellow yoga retreaters!

title: Ms anjna poonia
review: Its a great spiritual place.

review: Ganga aarti is the most beautiful event organised at triveni ghat every evening which relaxes you soul and helps you to attain positivity.

title: Awesome
review: Awesome experience to join Ganga Aarti during evening. Area is fully surrounded by people and got actually will get goosebumps.

title: Great experience
review: The aarti at Triveni ghat is not to miss on your visit to Rishikesh. Great spectacle.

title: Superb to watch
review: Great ceremony to watch by the sides of the Ganges

title: Close to GOD
review: Visited Rishikesh many times almost 70-80 times , But one should attend the aarti at triveni ghat. One should try to reach triveni ghat at around 6:35 PM in Summers....

title: Superb
review: Nice aarti.. Great view of river... Crowd... Peace... Near to ganga... Great arranged by aarti...nicely...

review: It's a must-do in Rishikesh, watching the Aarti is a pleasure irrespective of religious inclinations

title: Serene  Aarti
review: Very beautiful and serene aarti in the evening,

title: Tranquil Experience
review: It was all a bliss to be there and see everyone chanting the same tune with devotion and affection...

title: Heavenly Evening
review: At the evening time, the bank of the river became full of crowd. Many monks stand side by side and star that Aarti. If you are viewing from opposite side, it becomes more attractive.

title: Sound, light and spirituality
review: I was moved to tears while joining this beautiful ceremony. The colors, the mantras, the devotion and devotees made this a beautiful experience. I wish I could go to Mother Ganga every time I need a spiritual cleansing

title: The best aarti!
review: This is a must see in Rishikesh.  The best Ganga Aarti that is still practiced in its fullest respect of the tradition.  Enjoy the singing and music afterwards.

title: Peaceful
review: The arti takes place every evening at Tera Manzil temple. The time may change based on the season. In Nov'2017, it took around 5:45pm by which it gets dark. There is a small pooja before the main aarti, and you can visit the place 15-20 mins early and participate in the pooja. They do make an announcement before the commencement of the aarti so you can keep your ears open if you are interested.

title: A highlight when visiting Rishikesh
review: This is almost like a must-do for visitors to Rishikesh. I have visited the Ganga Aarti several times each visit to Rishikesh. Set on the banks on the Ganga in front of the ashram, the aarti is held each day at sunset.

title: Mass prayer
review: Devotees assemble on this ghat of River Ganga to offer prayers to the mother Goddess. Aarti song is sung praising river Ganga. Flowers and Diyas are put in the waters.  The bhajans and music are so soothing. It's devotion in the air.

title: Beautiful feeling
review: Must visit..... If u are in rishikesh..... Less crowded.... Great feeling.... Good ambience....you have to be in time to get a good seat...

title: rishikesh trip
review: ganga aarti at this place was very soothing and we had good time at ghat.WE went there every eveniing and seen ,location is worth going.

title: Ganga Arti
review: One who visit there should not miss it, it is completely devotional, it happens twice a day one during sunrise and other during sunset

title: must attend
review: you will feel as har ki pauri when you will attend aarti. it is not much crowed as har ki pauri that is good. a must visit aarti in rishikesh

title: Divine !!
review: What an experience it was !! About 15 priests perform the aarti around sunset and seeing them performing the puja in such a synchronised way and with the spiritual envioronment uplifted with all the chants was a heavenly experience !!

title: A Must see for Visitors to Rishikesh
review: To enlighten your soul and rejuvenate your heart an evening Ganga Aarti at the Bank of Holy River is must. You'll feel yourself the most fortunate and calm.

title: Amazing
review: Ganga Aarti takes place everyday at triveni ghat around evening 6. Definitely must go during Aarti time.

title: Blissful
review: A place not to miss,just mesmerizing, every thing is just to good the feel and the atmosphere, ensure to be on time

title: lovely experience
review: we loved it , lot of people foreigners and locals .We took a boat to cross the river ,paid Rs 10 per head after parking our car .

title: Less crowd and majestic
review: the arathi starts around 5:30 to 6, and goes for 15-20 mins. The crowd is usually not much hence you get good view of the arathi process.

title: Its a magical experience
review: it made a non religious person like me also go into a state of trance. Its a surreal feeling when so many priests perform this aatri in a synchronised and well rehersed rythem. its a must see for anybody going to Rishikesh

title: Triveni Ghat Aarti.
review: Divine Experience. Must to attend if you are in Rishikesh. The only dampener is the parking facility at the spot. Completely inadequate.

title: A highlight of my trip to Rishikesh
review: This was a very spiritual and joyful experience. People seemed united. To sit on the edge of the Ganga and be part of the fantastic singing, music and crowd is a must for everyone

title: Excellent! Must experience!
review: Do not miss this daily event! Our yoga retreat group attended this Ganga Aarti- and I thought it was magical. We arrived early in order to get good seats- and we were not disappointed.

title: Festival of lights here comes every evening
review: We visited this place few weeks back. Hundeds of people of people gather here evryday just before sunset. Aarti starts as the sun sets. A large group of saffron clad sannyasi hail mother Ganga with sacred chanting and large size diyas. A wonderful treat to eyes. Live Ganga Vandan is performed through out . At thend of Aarti whoch lass for around 30 minuts , prasad is distributed to the visitors. Ganga here is rather thin but very clean. In spite of large number of people gathering every day ,the ghat as well as approach road to the ghat is spic and span. The respect shown the the river Ganga by all the visitors worth special mention. Though nobody prevents , every one was putting off their shoes before they dip their feet to the river or going near the place where Aarti was being performed.

title: Beautiful experience
review: The Aarti starts around sunset. Its best to reach in time if you want to click some good photographs. The aarti is similar to the one at Varanasi and very interesting to watch. There are easily around 200 people who attend the aarti each day and is a must-watch in Rishikesh.

title: Ganga aarti
review: Aarti begins post sunset. Unlike haridwar, aarti at rishikesh is less crowded. Also the scenic beauty makes it more memorable here...

title: A great place to visit in evning
review: Ganga Arti is a one of the best attraction to visit in evening in Rishikesh. This holy movement makes your day complete and you will fell Hindu Sanskrit

title: Worth a visit
review: We went on Chhat Pooja day therefore the place was super crowded, but still it's worth atleast one visit.

title: festival of lights
review: this is a great place to see the indian culture.to many people come to this river to pray for it.they also play music and sing and have place for dance after the ceremony.

title: great experience
review: went for the aarti couple of times, energetic and peaceful experience. go a bit early to secure a seating so you can enjoy the ceremony as it gets quite crowded.

title: great aarti
review: trivani ghat is same as har ki pauri but not much crowed as har ki pauri. very peaceful place and near good market. a must visit place in rishikesh

title: Mesmerising!
review: The best I’ve seen in years. It looked like a brilliantly choreographed ballet with divine grace. The darkening skies brilliantly illuminated and the reverence by those doing the Arti, was as close to ‘divine presence’ as one can hope to get.

title: Could be lots more organized
review: Generally people do not criticize religious places and I too will not say too much about it... Only that it could have been a lot cleaner and better organized and people definitely need to be guided to keep the river clean and not put any offerings directly into the river. Some kind of tank or kund could very easily be arranged to take care of this at time of Aarti....

title: Must see
review: Beautiful nightly ceremony, must see while in Rishikesh. Be prepared to buy flower offerings from the children to offer to the Ganges. Usually Rs20 each, hard to say No the the children.

title: Must Visit Here
review: Ganga J aarti at Triveni Ghat is a very very special one as almost 14 people aare performing aarti at one time with supreme coordination..

title: If Har Ki Pauri Haridwar then Triveni Ghat At Rishikesh
review: In Hindu Mythology we have a Belief that Those who Bathe in Ganga G will wash all his Sin..

title: Lives up to expectationa
review: It was very good to see this cultural experience. Definitely a must to learn more about the religion of this region. It was very full of people going to pray alongside those wanting to watch.

title: Not to be missed cultural bonanza !
review: As Indians revere their rivers, and rightly so the mother Ganges, the evening brings this colorful ceremony on the bank of Ganges in the down town Rishikesh. A dozen volunteers do Aarti with lamps and mantras making the atmosphere totally ecstatic !!

title: Excellent experience
review: i would suggest all to stand other side of the ganga and watch aarti than you can see beautiful aarti

title: Very nice ceremony - must see
review: At exactly the time that the day ends this ceremony of thanking the Ganga takes place.  It is very special and beautiful to see both the performers as well as the audience.

title: Worth checking out
review: This is interesting to see and definitely worth a visit to see them practising their rituals. It is a short ceremony, also worth arriving a little early to get a seat on the steps.

title: Not neat compared to Swargashram
review: At Rishikesh, Ganga Aarthi is performed at Triveni Ghat as well as Swargashram. We enjoyed at Swargashram and did not like at Triveni Ghat, reason- Triveni Ghat was fully crowded and the river was not that neat as compared to Swargashram. It was eaily accessible by using share auto. Bharath Mandir was nearer to Triveni Ghat.

title: A dip in the culture
review: The Ganges in Rishikesh is mesmerizing by itself. The Ganga Aarti adds the cultural experience jewel to the overall visit.

title: Aarti for local taste
review: We went to this Ghat as Parmath Aarti was full with tourists and not good at all. Here is much personal and real.

title: Peaceful aarti at Triveni ghat
review: It was a lovely aarti of ganga ji performed by preist of the parmarth niketan .

title: Truly divine experience
review: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is truly divine experience with the chanting of hymns in the background. This should be the first stop in the evening for anyone visiting Rishikesh.

title: If you are in Rishikesh make sure you attend the Aarati
review: The Aarti starts at 6 PM sharp. I would strongly recommend to be there. The crowd is generally reasonable and you can really enjoy the Aarti with complete peace of mind.

title: Daiviya Anoobhav
review: A beautiful and spiritual experience. It is a heavily crowded place because of such high holy regard associated with it. It depicts the rich cultural heritage of India. The whole experience is high on ecstatic feel. This place might not be suitable for old people, disables and with young kids. Dress modestly because of the religious norms and enjoy the divine power of the aarti.

title: Divine aarti
review: What an experience!  Words cannot explain the divine out of the world experience at the triveni Aarti on lakshman ghat

title: A good evening Treat
review: Ganga aarti at trivani is a healthy thing to end the day.Hymens in the background and Aarti (Ritual) in front of Ganga River is peaceful and relaxing.

title: Awsome
review: I think this is even better than the aarti at HAr Ki Pauri. Very systematic, rhythmic and less chaotic. One must visit this. Its excellent.

title: Light festival Ganges
review: Mesmerising feast for the spiritual self. A wonderful spiritual religious ritual perfectly carried out. This happens everyday at sunset on the banks of the banks of the Ganges. It’s not something you can miss even if you try. Spectacular

title: It is a divine experience witnessing the evening Ganges Arti  in Rishikesh
review: The evening Ganges arti is performed at Triveni Ghat walking distance from Ram Jhoola, apart from Parmanand Ashram/Ghat on the other side of the river .The religious hymns recited during a "Hawan" prior to Arti helped rejuvenating our our mind and soul. The actions of 5 youngmen dressed in saffrron coloured clothes holding and moving about  torches in their hands remind you of a similar Arti performed at Dasashwamedh Ghat in Varanasi in  the evening .

title: Hypnotizing
review: very easy and comfortable way to take part in the ceremony. Beutifully performed, best place for a foreign traveller to watch

title: Divine Experience
review: A very divine experience after attaining ganga arti at triveni ghat. Good arrangement for all public.

title: Fantastic ceremony
review: If you are in Haridwar then do not miss the Ganga Aarti ceremony. Whether you are Hindu or not it is such a moving experience that you will not find anywhere else.

title: Nice place to visit in evening
review: The Place gives a panoromic view of river Ganga and the beautiful ghats. But the prime attarction is evening Ganga Aarti and one should not miss it.

title: "all senses" experience on the Ganges
review: This nightly ceremony should not be missed if in the area.  I went to this Aarti and the one at Parmath Niketan as well.  Both are worth experiencing.  Note that the grounds at Parmath Niketan (as it is an ashram) is worth visiting on its own independent of the ceremony.

title: Getting in touch with India
review: Had lovely experience, sheer image of priests performing puja on chants is magical. Ganga as back drop makes it truly Indian experience.

title: Peaceful
review: Ganga aarti at Triveni Ghat is a must watch when in Rishikesh. It's really peaceful and serene. It's beautiful to watch the Aarti.

title: Peace.....
review: A divine experience. The aarti performed by lots of pandits and all performing the rituals like robot in the same sequence without watching the other one. The aarti stands by even seeing seems so heave and gets heated up while doing the aarti, but these things doesn't even bother them. If you reach early you can even book aarti in your name.

title: Amazing
review: Probably the biggest ghat in Rishikesh. The aarti here is performed in a much older way, the original format of aarti as people do say, and the place is less crowdy than the Har ki Pauri.

title: its fabulous!
review: loved the experience. its splendid.. the Arati is really good. the complete set-up, the ambience - is just divine.

title: Beautiful aarti overlooking the Ganges
review: A very special experience with a group of friends. Very easy to connect with the inquisitive local visitors

title: Amazing when it's less crowded. Worth seeing for sure
review: We visited on dusherra and it was very crowded but still very nice experience. It was amazing to see the 3 large Vijaydashmi statues at the background as visible in the pictures.

title: Experience of its kind! Enchanting!!!
review: Coming back from there was not an easy task...u totally get mesmerised with the experience of Maa Ganga aaarti. Wow!Wow!!Wow!!! Words just cant explain this experience...u must experience to feel it !

title: Unforgettable Ganga Aarti
review: Attending the ceremony at the Ganges River is an unforgettable experience. The Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat, also called the Maha Aarti, is an evening prayer performed on the banks of the River Ganga. It is a major highlight of the ghat, which attracts a large number of devotees and visitors.The aarti is accompanied with chanting of bhajans, beating drums and bells.The positive energy and vibes were so powerful. We were so happy to be able to attend such a ceremony.

title: Devotional Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
review: Experience Soul inspiring Devotional Ganga Aarti (chanting of devotional prayer offering to Mother Ganga) at Triveni Ghat, Rishikesh, Uttrakhand, India

title: Vibrant and interesting.
review: A very interesting experience, got to listen to hymns/chanting and watch cultural/religious practices. Its worth getting there early, to ensure you have a seat with a good view.

title: Amazing
review: I finally got an opportunity to witness the Ganga Aarti (River worshiping ritual on the banks of river Ganges in the evening) this year. I was so moved by the divine atmosphere which comprised of lights, colours, chants, bells, drums and the smell of various flowers, incense, camphor, herbal products. So much of devotion in the air. Young or old, everybody would just watch the priests performing the rituals or the lamps surrounded by floral garlands floating by the river Ganga.

title: Aarti
review: What an unbelievable experience. Over 90 minutes of chanting, then the Aarti. Beautiful setting to watch the sunset and amazing experience of the heart.

title: blessings of mother ganga..
review: you can never afford to miss the Ganga Arti at Triveni Ghat if you are visiting Rishikesh. Chants of holy prayers, numerous diyas and lamps glittering the river. Devotees offering the prayers is in itself a majestic view in itself.

title: Beautiful place !!!
review: One must visit this place atleast once, a place to find peace.

title: Beautiful!
review: The aarti done by 5 pandits at 6 pm should be on your itinerary if you are in Rishikesh! Very well synchronized and a good watch.

title: Amazing sunset ceremony along the Ganges
review: This is one of my most memorable evenings in my two week trek through the Himalaya region of India.  The ceremony along the river with the music, chanting, candelabras, and the offerings to the river.  A beautiful and peaceful moment shared amongst Hindus and foreigners.  We were treated so well and people were so happy to see us participate in the ceremony.

title: Just Amazing
review: I visited Rishikesh in October, 2016 at THDC Guest House. Ganga Aarti was amazing and Holi moment in the evening. Very Good and Not to miss for everyone.

title: Ma Ganga Aarti
review: Never disappointing, a wonderful experience shared with likeminded devotees happy to welcome you into the ritual

title: Serene experience
review: anga Aarti means prayer for River Ganga. Prayers are dedicated to gods and godesses. We had a serene time watching locals praying to the river. it was  a well organized event.

title: A must
review: the ceremonies take place every evening. they're so emotional and touching.  it's a must !!!! go and watch it and see   how prayers are held so different from  what I know or is familiar for me.

title: Divine
review: The evening aarti is just serene and rejuvenating. A must see event. Try to reach by 6pm to get seated close to the priests performing the aarti.

title: A heart touching Aarti
review: Marvelous scene of the aarti on the bank of the river. Unforgettable time and moment of this type of aarti.

title: biggest ghat in rishikesh
review: a must visit place in rishikesh. attend ganga aarti here. you will feel same as har ki pauri but not much crowed as har ki pauri. Devotional and Spiritual Feeling. road market near ghat also good.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: Rishikesh and Haridwar are known for the Aartis done on the river banks. One should  must attend these aartis to connect with spirituality. At Rishikesh, one may reach Triveni Ghat in the evening around 6 and witness the evening aarti.

title: Namah
review: If you have seen Ganga Aarti in Varanasi, then this place may not impress you. The spots across the Ghat offer the best views, and usually are provided to a tourist by  offering a "fees" to locals. Second best view is from the walking overbridge. The flow of water is quite fast, so be aware and cautious while bathing in the water.The whole affair is short and sweet, and is a coordinated effort. Worth an evening.

title: Great experience
review: Loved divine experience at Har ke paudi with our group. Administration at Har ke paudi tries level best to clear doubts of tourist and explain details on aarti. Aarti process starts around 6.15pm & completes by 7.15pm. They give donatio  receipts also.

title: Spiritual experience
review: Get there early, experience the peace and quiet of the river and then the beautiful puja that is performed at the Ghat to respect and honour the Ganges.

title: Good energy
review: Good energy when you participate in aarti all Hindu religious people come here for aarti ,tarpan ,mundan etc.ilike the front of ganga mountains..

title: Mesmerising
review: Very nice experience.Mr. Darshan from our resort Aranyam was our guide for this excursion of Rishikesh and we totally loved this first time experience of the Aarti at Rishikesh.

title: A good experience
review: The ceremony of light. It is very nice. Fire and flowers make it very visual. Seeing so many people gathering in a daily ritual is also quite impressive. It's a pity that we went during the moonson and it was raining cats and dogs... The fire was put off quickly with the rain. Still it was a great experience.

title: Ganga Aarthi
review: We had the privilege of witnessing the Ganga Arathi on 05th August 2017. The crowd was also less and we could see the aarthi without any hassles. The beauty is worth seeing which takes about 1hr and 30 minutes. Included some photographs taken from my mobile not great but something is better than nothing.

title: Worth the visit
review: I was totally mesmerised by the chanting and synchronisation during Ganga Aarti . The whole atmosphere changes at Triveni Ghat during Aarti.

title: Aarti at Rishikesh Parmarth Ashram
review: Aarti at Rishikesh Parmarth Ashram gate.. Magical n unforgettable.. But missed the lit up diyas n the elaborate Puja as is in Varanasi.. Which is pure heaven.. This is OK OK In comparison..

title: best aarati in Rishikesh
review: Its amazing and so synchornized, no noise, so calm and meditative. Not to be missed! No comparision with other aarati's at haridwar and Parmarth Niketan!

title: Party atmosphere/ must see religious ceremony
review: I went to the Ganga Aarti twice with the Shiv Shakti Hostel and loved it! You should definitely check it out, have a dip/ throw some flowers in the Ganga, swirl a candle around and then dance with some locals - to the band that plays for about 4 hours I think - once the ceremony is finished.

title: amazing
review: if you want to feel the spirituality of india than you must come here and experience this ganga aarti

title: Best part about our trip was this serene Aarti
review: This one is not worth missing! I assure you this is not something you have witnessed anywhere in the world.

title: Very powerful positive vibes!!
review: I must say having spent a month in India, this was the only time i felt like i was in India. The positive energy and vibes were so powerful. Everyone was dancing, a must see in Rishkesh!!

title: Devotional Feeling
review: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is simply awesome. You will feel the Spirituality and devotional. The Aarti Thali/Aarti Jyot is simply awesome to see when Pujari does the aarti.

title: Triveni Ghat
review: The place where you can take bath in Holy Ganga River and place where you can go for evening Aarti. Devotional and Spiritual Feeling

title: Devine Experience
review: Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh is a different one. No crowd here and you can have a erene and spiritual experience to your satisfaction.

title: Amazing Ganga Arti
review: Well, i was very fond of the Ganga Arti at Parmarth Niketan, but ever since i have attended an Arti at Triveni Ghat, i got mesmerized. They are doing it every evening at Triveni Ghat, which is very beutiful and neat n clean. They have recently done some renovation of the Ghats and the temples nearby. Its very at the heart of the Rishikesh, very well accessible.

title: Divine experience
review: The Ganga Arti at Triveni Ghat is really an experience  the songs,musics,arti,the awesome evening view of the Ganges,with the setting sun reflecting rays on the water.

title: Excellent, peaceful and well managed
review: The whole process is well managed and you'll get plenty of time to settle down and relax before you get started with the prayers. Check the timings before you go.

title: A tribute to Mother Ganga.
review: The evening aarti to Mother Ganga in evening at Sunset is sight to behold and cherish the memories forever.

title: Excellent Experience!
review: I reached Triveni Ghat at around 6:30 PM and found that the aarti would happen by 7:15 PM.....this gave me enough time to settle down and grab a great place for us....to my surprise, the aarti place was thoroughly clean and entire aarti program was quite mesmerizing....

title: Natural and spiritual way of life
review: An wonderful evening on bank of Maa Ganga which give me mental peace and help me in forgetting all stresses. Would like to say your journey of rishikesh will be incomplete without Ganga Aarti on Triveni Ghat .

title: an unusual experience
review: We walked 2 km along the Ganges at night to see the Ganga Aarti. There were not many tourists and it was interesting to share the ceremony , sitting among people of all ages ; although we could not understand the words, the rythm, sounds and atmosphere were compelling (with the rushing Ganga, the mist in the background and the torches blazing) ; we have never experienced anything like it before.

title: Memorable Experience
review: From Laxman Jhula, Triveni Ghat is 4 Kms.

title: Ganga Aarti Rishikesh
review: Ganga Aarti Rishikesh - Ganga Aarti Rishikesh Parmarth Niketan Ghat. Parmarth Niketan Ashram to witness the every day evening ceremony of Ganga Aarti Rishikesh. ... Ganga Aarti at Parmarth Niketan is organized and performed by ashram residents

title: The most popular and widest Ghaat in Rishikesh.
review: The Triveni Ghaat is the biggest, most popular Ghaat in Rishikesh and is said to be the confluence of Ganges,Yamuna and Saraswathi. The Ganga Aarathi here is one of the most popular at sunset everyday. It is studded with statues  of Ganges, shiva,Partha Arjuna etc.

title: Excellent views. Not so crowdy.
review: Equivalent to the Ganga Arti at Varanasi and Haridwar, Rishikesh offers excellent Ganga Arti at a relatively lesser crowded group of people. If you are lucky enough, you yourself may get a chance to show Arti .

title: Ganga Arti Rishikesh
review: Parmarth Niketan and Triveni Ghat are two most important places for Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh. Hundreds of devotees participate these holy Aarties daily at both.

title: Best experience in Rishikesh
review: I loved the evening aarti here and went many times. Small, intimate with beautiful views and the prayers were powerful and beautiful. If I could pick only one thing to do in Rishikesh, this would be it.

title: Worth a visit.
review: Its absolutely worth a visit, The Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is very sought after & a must do when in Rishikesh.

title: beautiful experience
