review: The feel of aarti performed at the ghat is a lovely experience. The chanting of aarti and the ringing bells altogether make it an experience not to be missed.

title: Most beautiful Aarthi
review: I witnessed the most beautiful Aarthi on Guru Poornima day in Rishikesh.

title: Ganga aarti
review: I visited this old place for aarti it was great atmosphere there and good energy.specially whenever you do puja front of ganga.

title: A divine and a magical experience
review: I have no words to describe the Ganga arti.

title: Holy Ganges
review: The place is not as crowded as Haridwar and one can take a Holy dip peacefulyy. But the currents are very strong and it may not be possible to cross the ankle deep water. Small mugs and buckets are available for sale. Buy one and take bath, Dont take the risk of venturing deeper. The water is pure and cold.

title: Mesmerizing and divine
review: Ganga Aarti at Triveni ghat starts at around 6.30 pm and ends up at around 7.30 pm. There is fairly good crowd to participate in this so if you want to have a good view be early to take your seat. A pious good one hour of chanting and Aarti which is likely to move any soul. If you are a Hindu  then definitely this is a must.

title: Serene and peaceful
review: I had attended this Aarati 2 times. Once in November and again on 3rd Aug. Both experience were different. Nov weather is cool and Aarati is for longe duration and you get immerse in to Aarati . in Aug due to rains Aarati is restricted to only small Area where the shed is built. It was for shorter duration.

title: "Good to feel"
review: This is a must to see place if you are traveling in North India. The views of the nature from this ghat is  really amazing. Well maintained and clean place.

title: Best experience in Rishikesh
review: You can actually participate in the ceremony. Try to get a spot in the front and hold a fire lamp. You will really enjoy and get deep into the mantras.

title: Second Best Ganga Aarti in Uttarakhand after Haridwar
review: When in Rishikesh and Don't see this Spiritual ceremony this means your tour is not Completed. I went to Rishikesh in June 2017 and Join this Spiritual Aarti. In Rishikesh It Says That in Triveni, Ganga Aarti is the most powerful and sacred worship.

title: Amazing Ghat(bank)
review: This is the amazing ghat(bank) for the Ganga Aarti, most of the people came here to watch the Ganga Aarti, Market and the view of Ganga and the Himalayas from this point

title: Must visit place if you are in Rishikesh
review: If you are visiting Rishikesh then must visit this place in the evening at the Aarti time of Ganga. It will be really an awesome divine experience.

title: Well Maintained
review: Refreshing morning view of River Ganga, speedy water, hygenic place, lesser crowdy and a must go once you are in Rishikesh.

title: Very clean ghat and beautiful aarti
review: This ghat compared to other ghats in haridwar is great to witness the evening aarti. Its clean, well maintained and less crowded. Although you get everything here for Rs 2-3 more than the printed MRP.

title: Pavan Place On the Bank of River Ganga
review: I along with my enjoyed this place in the evening.Sangam of three most beautiful rivers of India, triveni ghat is the most beautiful place in rishikesh, and We covered the place in the advanced the main side of ghat is quite busy on the arti time, end we enjoyed aarti from very near, when aarti done river was very slow and atmosphere made was totally faithful great place.

title: Clean and well maintained
review: Ghat is good and well organized with washroom facilities and  small shops. One can offer to do ganga aarti from their own side.

title: mesmerising aarti experience
review: A must do, when you visit haridwar and rishikesh. The environment is nice and very serene during the aarti.

title: Ganga Aarti Experiance at Rishikesh !
review: If you are around, it is place to witness and enjoy Divine Ganga Aarti. "Triveni Ghat" is comparatively small, clean, and well maintained Ghat. Is not so crowded normally. It is situated opposite to the "Jai Ram Ashram". I have noticed that, many local people too come to attend aarti event.

title: Memorable holy  Ganga aarti
review: It is a beautiful experience to see ganga aarti in triveni ghat.Evening around 6.30 during dusk all the tourist are gathering there  and arrangements were neatly made to watch the aarti.You can pay and do the aarti by yourself.flowers are selling there .you can buy  and light the lamp and float it in the ganges which is very divine.It takes place nearly thirty minutes.Very memorable.

title: Very good experience
review: My family and I visited Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat. We did take a dive in Ganga and it was chilly and nice for the soul.

title: WOW
review: I am not a very religious person but my mom insisted me to visit this place since we were going to Rishikesh. What an experience.

title: Well maintained clean ghat
review: Very nice feeling on reaching the ghat. Neat and clean. It is not huge, but is of descent size. You can reach to its parking(few meters away from river) through Car also. It is almost opposite to Jai Ram ashram.

title: Visit Rishikesh Just to see this
review: Cannot miss this.. Fantastic feel and experience;  The overall vibe is excellent and so happy that I was able to experience this

title: Not as expected
review: We saw the aarati from the oppsite end from treveni ghat. In case you have seen aarati at Har ki Paudi @ Haridwar, you can add this attraction as Optional.

title: Nice place
review: Very nice experience of visiting this place with Dinesh ji our yoga guru from Aranyam. We also enjoyed the evening arti.

title: SUPERB AARTI DONOT MISS IT
review: This is a must do in Rishikesh ,this experience you will remember for ever till your grand children grow and you become quite old. 15-20 pujaries perform aarti of ganga with 20-30 assistants  all well dressed uniform , beautiful music and later very rhythmic bhajans and sangeet by rishikesh's best singers, almost two hours programme daily. vey huge ghat in rishikesh. The cemented ghat is more than a kilometer long along ganga and can accomodate lacs of people together. After the aarti you can enjoy the bhajan music and dances by indian as well as foreigners.The is excellent aarti of ganga in both Hardwar and Rishikesh. Second number goes to parmarth niketan aarti  and third is har ki pauri Hardwar.So never miss this and enjoy it. Can have dinner in near by restaurants.

title: Spiritual experience
review: It was out of body experience. Chanting and aarti was simply out of this world. I will be visiting ganga aarti whenever I go to Rishikesh. A must go if you are in and around Rishikesh.

title: Beautiful sight
review: Witnessed Ganga Aarti on a pleasant evening with family in November 2016. Limited seating space and slots are available.

title: Spritual and Amazing
review: An emotional experience for me I totally loved sitting here for over an hour enjoying the aarti. Thank you Mr. Darshan from Aranyam River Retreat for accompanying us and showing us around.

title: Worth a visit
review: It was a lovely walk from the main road down a few steps on the concrete walkway along the fast flowing Ganges. The prayer was rousing and the crowd large but disciplined.

title: Divine
review: Live Aarti on the banks of River Ganga. Nice Bhajan with large Lamps in one line. Pure meditation. Must visit, when in Rishikesh. Aarti is performed before sun set. Reach little early and book Pooja(on payment). We can not have such great experience any where else.

title: Great feeling
review: One experiences a great feeling when are at the Triveni Ghat, one with the history of our culture and people.

title: That holy feeling
review: One should never miss this when you are in Rishikesh, abundance of people are seen here sinking in the feeling of Ganga Aarti.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: A must visit for all who visit Rishikesh. Truly a Divine Experience. We all had a great time and soaked in the wonderful energies out there.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: A well lit place to boost the spiritual experience.

title: Devine Experince .. !!!
review: A MUST attend. it was very divine experience though little bit difficult to concentrate as too many  people around.

title: Best place in Rishikesh for Aarti
review: Its  not busy as other places. But i will still suggest to go little early so that you can sit in the steps. You can get the coupon if you want to perform any rituals. I went there in the morning as well. Its very peaceful place and you can walk for around for about 1 KM.

title: Jai Gange Mata
review: Beside Haridwar,Gangaji ki Aarati is now performed at several ghats of Ganga all over India .

title: Scenic Aarti
review: Live aarti with comparatively less crowd is event you should not miss if you are at Rishikesh. Aarti starts at around 7 pm so you should make it sure to be there by 6.45 pm max. if you have a wish to have bath in chilled water of Ganga ji keep some extra 20 mins for your bath. You can also perform pooja of Ganga ji and be a part of Aarti.

title: A runaway from delhi pollution
review: Rishikesh is a place to fall in love it .. suits all ages .. with best combination of water .. and good weather .. good food ..we attended Ganga Arti too after rafting .. coordinated our time to reach the ghat after rafting right before Arti .. it was beautiful .. rightly religious .. and now being done with more glamour .. the Pandit's doing it looked professional .. we all bought diya .. it was just amazing .. would love to ho back again ..

title: Back to the Roots
review: Pure Ganges is something which touches your heart. Broughtup in Dehradun I have experienced Ganga Aarti many times. This time was the first time when we experienced it at Triveni Ghat. A fabolous aarti done by the learned men together. The way the Ganges is offered respect will touch your soul within.

title: Most mesmarizing event with lot of devotion towards Ganga Ji
review: one of my life time memory for my family where we had comfortableseating arranged by Triveni ghat team,(you should be there at least one hour before).Had performed Aarthi most delightful experience .bhajans and kirtanas about Ganga ji were so peaceful experience

title: Enchanting bhajans
review: This is where you would feel being connected to god..people love the lights and the way a devotee offers himself to maa ganga and the river promises his well being in return. peacefule place and lively atmosphere.

title: Clean ghat...lovely people....aweaome aarti to watch closely
review: Near fresh ganga flowing nearby aarti start just when its dark enough in evening mostly at 7 pm in summers.....its awesome to watch aarti ( same or i can say better than haridwar) with less crowd and u get spritual satisfaction

title: Neat and clean ghat
review: This ghat is about 10 km from Haridwar . It is believed to be configuration of holi river Ganga Jamuna and Saraswati.

title: Must attend
review: The Rushikesh tour is incomplete without visiting Triveni Ghat and Ganga Aarti. Usually it starts around 6:30 PM. The Ganga view from Ghat is very attractive. The forest near Triveni Ghat has elephants and can be seen sometimes during Aarti.

title: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
review: Try to avoid visitng Rishikesh during Jatra season (June-August) if you want calm atmosphere. The Aarti was nice though Ganga aarti at Varanashi is better than at Triveni Ghat (in my opinion). You have to take your place beforehand to avoid crowd blocking your view.

title: Most Divine Place Spend good time
review: Visited this place in the evening, Ganga is a place for solitude on evenings mostly. This place Gives a divine feeling and experience. The atmosphere here is extraordinarily spiritual.  Loved the place, loved the music Words spoken from saints and we also spoke aarti and mantra enjoyed great time of divine place.

title: Totally blow away
review: Pleasantly surprised by attending this. tears and joy and peace all at the same time. remain seated the whole time if you are on the steps. arrive a bit early so that you can sit on the steps.

title: To be with Lord Shiva and Ganga
review: Triveni Ghat is a well known bathing ghat of Rishikesh at the confluence of three sacred rivers - Ganga, Yamuna and Saraswathi. Pilgrims visit this place to take a holy dip to wash away all their sins and to purify their soul.

title: Evening Aarti
review: The Aarti starts at 630 and goes upto 7. We need to be there at 6 to get a good place. If you do the Aarti then you can directly pay Dakshina to the priest. All of us enjoyed the Aarti in front of Ganga. It gave us a good feeling.

title: Ganga ghat at triveni ghat
review: It is not as grand as ganga aarti at Har Ki Pauri or Varanasi. Little unorganized. You can very well escape it if you have attended the aarti at har ki pauri.

title: Must See!
review: Every evening after sunset without fail (even in the inevitable storms!) the offering of fire with lamps and singing. Beautiful sight but very crowded so make sure you get there about an hour early to get a seat in the middle (and get a tasty dosa beforehand from the shops in the market nearby!)

title: Blessed place
review: This was a serene, clean ghat and a great place to have a dip in the holy Ganga at Rishikesh. Glad we chose this place. The people who take care of the place were so simple, welcoming, cordial and committed to the Ganga and its surroundings. Kudos to them!

title: Great experience
review: This is a well organised Ganga aarti. The timing of the Aarti depends on the sunset. When we attended it on May 2017 it started post 7 pm. The seats get filled too soon and so if you could get there an hour before you can find the best seats to enjoy it. The entire Aarti goes on for an hour and the overall experience is really great.

title: Fascinating!
review: This was a wonderfully organized spiritually edifying event we were blessed to participate in. The air was so filled with devotion. It was so very moving!

title: Breathtaking Ganga Aarti experience
review: This is one of the best places to visit with family.One must reach 3-4 before the evening aarti to explore the nearby market, temples and Math.

title: The holy place with peace of mind
review: if you are going to rishikesh it is a must visit place to see.it will give you a peace of mind with your body and soul.

title: experience
review: its very good if you love ganga river and experience for public from other states dont miss it it takes 1 hour

title: Profound divinity in every ounce
review: I travelled with my friends to Rishikesh, we were staying near Lakshman Jhula. We took a share auto from the Rishikesh badrinath road which charged us Rs 15/- per person, though I heard for locals they charge Rs 10/- for triveni ghat.

title: Ganga Arthi
review: Good religous place. Holy city. The mighty Ganga harries down from the ridges of the Himalayas. Here the Ganga worshipped as holy mother in Haridwar and believed cleanser of all sins.From early morning to late night thousands people take holy tip, worship the sacred Ganga and perform Ganga arthi with reverence.

title: My favorite Aarti in Rishikesh
review: What an intimate and heartfelt practice where every one is welcome. So beautiful and authentic and participatory.

title: Beautifully co-ordinated aarti, you can spend your evening here witnessing Indian Traditional Aarti.
review: This arti is going on from several years, but recently there was a tremendous change since new committee took over about 6 months back.

title: Ganjes Aarti
review: Ganjes Aarti is the major attraction of holy city Rishkesh.Triveni Ghat  aarti is  place where one could see at other side of the town.

title: Unforgettable
review: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is unforgettable experience. Especially during the weekends.  There are proper placed earmarked for the visitors. You get chance to go through the experience without much hassles.

title: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat Rishikesh
review: Found Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat very captivating. Its a very good experience.  I like this aart for the colours and the chants

title: mesmerizing
review: i have no words to describe this experience, its pure magic.

title: Its best not to miss this sight!!
review: the ganga aarti that takes place at most temples around uttrakhand on the bank of the river ganga at a particular time in the evenings, when we were there the aarti happened at 6.30 pm. not sure if the timings change. the aarti here is bigger in Rishikesh but not as the world renowned aarti at har ki pauri in hairdwar. but if u r here then its view of the huge pyres in circular motion and the loud chants gives u a feeling of inner peace.

title: Arti at the Ganges in Rishikesh
review: Experience this theatrical Arti with music and fire. the fire ceremony can cleans your body and soul if you give it a chance

title: DIVINE
review: It has left us awestruck! A spiritual ambience pervades the valley. The ghat is so peaceful and clean. It's walking distance from Hotel Ellbee where we stayed.

title: Stunning Ceremony!
review: This was one of our favorite experiences during our time in India. It was by far the highlight of our time in Rishikesh. We stayed at the Ganga Kinare boutique hotel and they offered a guided spiritual walk to this ceremony along the Ganges.

title: Overcrowded but worth it
review: We went to see the ganga aarti in the month of Dec, however it was overcrowded on both sides of the ghats. Beware of the pandas/pandits on the ghats since they will lure you into giving aarti on the river for free but then they will charge you saying donate the pandit/brahmin people. Dont just fall into that trap.

title: Purity and inner happiness
review: you would feel the positivity and inner happiness .. its a beautiful prayer done by kids .

title: Divine place
review: Very good .awesome feeling .everyone should go and take a dubki in holy river Ganga and should attend the Ganga Aarti

title: Of the best Ganga aarti around
review: I have seen Ganga Aarti in Rishikesh, Haridware and Varanasi. While Haridwar is the oldest, and Varanasi is the biggest, Rishikesh is probably the best mix of less crowd,  elaborate, and no commercialization.

title: Better aarti view than Laxman Jhoola
review: Better aarti view than Laxman Jhoola. Surroundings too are much cleaner and less crowded than that near Laxman Jhoola

title: Mesmerizing experiance !
review: Divinity and prayers automatically start from your mouth at this place. Pure and vivacious place to visit. Must visit if you are in Rishikesh and attend this pooja/prayer

title: The definitive Ganga Aarti
review: We went to the ganga aarti in "Har Ki Pauri", "Parmarth Niketan"...lo and behold this one takes the cake...

title: Very nice and clean
review: Better aarti view than Laxman Jhoola. Surroundings too are much cleaner and less crowded than that near Laxman Jhoola

title: Auspicious!
review: No words to describe it at all will recommend everyone to visit and experience it and at triveni ghat it is very well organised than har ki podi. If u wish to book a arti which we couldn't as I was late ....plz book it 1 hr before the arti begins as after that it is full .

title: Highlight of Rishikesh
review: We witnessed Ganga Aarti in Har Ki Pairi, Parmarth Niketan and here. This is the one...Without any doubt the most organized aarti on a Ganga Ghaat.

title: Must try to do the Ganga arthi
review: If you are in Rishkesh you must miss the Ganga arthi which please your Mind Body and Soul ! Must try and witness the arthi. You might see lots of local and tourist too. Mind blowing words can't describe the flow of energy and lights !

title: A very Devine experience
review: I visited Triveni Ghat at around 6pm to take advantage of the arti. The purpose of the trip was to have Pooja at Har ki Pauri for my deceased father. We were able to sponsor the arti under his name for 300 Rs.  The priest had us perform some pre-arti rituals and we were invited to perform arti. The entire experience was Devine and very personal. It's completely different experience than the ganga arti at Har ki Pauri which takes place at a much bigger scale. However, it is more personal and you feel like you are part of it.....I highly recommend that you take advantage of this experience if you are in Rishikesh.

title: Holy experience
review: This place was recommended by a few people in the hotel and market, basically locals. This aarti happens in the evening around 6.30 pm and there is a proper ghat built and attracts a few people. The aarti is conducted by local priests, actually 8-10 priests dressed up in a traditional pooja attire with huge diyas in their hand chant the shlokas and recite the aarti, It is a holy experience, if you are religious should attend the attend else skip it.

title: Breathe in the aroma of the Aarti
review: This Aarti is performed every evening with the sparkling ganges in the foreground. A number of people throng to the place  and get involved in the Aarti.

title: The Triveni ghat,
review: A must visited place for religious journey/ But the ghat is not properly cleaned,,   for this situvation .visitors are also responsible. visitors throws plastic/paper bags,after using it..I will again visit in the Ist week of JUNE,2017

title: Mesmerizing place!
review: This was my first time visiting the Ghat and it was truly an enlightening experience. I rarely go to temples and identify myself as an atheist but after attending the aarti, I truly felt connected to a superior force. Loved it!

title: Ganga Aarti
review: Started on lines with kadi Ganga Aarti. It is on a lower scale and is open to all. While kasi has perfected the art. Rishikesh folks will take few more years to master it

title: Carefull with Rickshaw Guys
review: Do ask for the rate before taking a rick to Ganga Arti and other temples nearby. And be careful with your belongings.

title: Well organized and synchronized Ganga aarti
review: Had the opportunity of watching the mesmerizing Ganga Aarti at Triveni ghat after the rafting trip got over. The gathering is quite well organized and the melodious aarti and the movements of the priests doing the aarti are very well synchronized. Aarti is also of longer duration and more presentable than the Ganga Aarti at Har ki Pauri, Haridwar which I had just watched in the morning. It is just below the Chotiwala restaurant and 1 km walk by the river from the rafting end point near Ram Jhula.

title: Ganga Aarti at Triveni ghat & Parmarth Niketan
review: Both are great sites for experiencing Ganga Aarti...will however rate Parmarth Niketan a notch higher....

title: A must in Rishikesh
review: we pretty much enjoyed spending our time to watch the ceremony and talk to the friendly Indian people there.

title: Awesome place
review: I like this place, full of peace and scenic beauty, safe to have bath. Well maintained and clean. Evening Aarti is awesome and well managed.

title: Mast Mast and divine
review: Please do wait for it even if u r in a hurry.. It's totally divine... As is the weather here in the evening... Totally worth it..  Specially after the beautiful walkway around the river... All in all an immersion experience

title: get there early
review: its an amazing experience

title: Ganga Aarti was really worth watching
review: We reached there at around 6.15 PM on 4th May...

title: awesome
review: you will enjoy aarti same as har ki pauri in haridwar. but here not much crowd as har ki pauri. so come here with kids and show them.

title: spiritual experience
review: very mystical and spiritual experience, the people around are very helpful and welcome you to join them

title: Very Good
review: We saw Ganga Aarti here and at Parmath. I would say that at Triveni Ghat it is less busy, there is more to see as the ceremony is done using the fire lamps and to spiritual music. It is religious and fascinating to watch. As ever at both sides of the ganges be prepared to be bombarded with kids selling you their flowers to light and float at the end of the ceremony. It is worth visiting both ceremonies at Triveni Ghat and Parmath on separate nights if you have time.

title: A lifetime memory
review: One of the best things in Rishikesh is to attend the Ganga Aarti at Triveni ghat. Clean and well organised. Transported to a different world

title: Serene and unique
review: Nice to c this special Pooja on the banks of river ganga....synchronised beautiful and blissful...must when u visit rishikesh...good when u need to relax spiritually

title: Spiritual Aura
review: An experience Best seen than said. The aarti and contnious chants from fellow pilgrims transform u to another world.

title: Mind blowing
review: In rishikesh so many Maa Ganga Aarti ghat but Triveni Ghat Aarti is good & near to Rishikesh bus stand

title: Tradition
review: A must when visiting the area, join in and chant along and burn a candle into the river,every night at 5.30 .

title: Divine experience
review: A must for anyone visiting Rishikesh. Its a divine experience, Ganges no more appears as a river but a deity ... a living being ... who is worshiped and loved !

title: Great experience
review: Breathtaking experience!! I have never seen something like this!!  Must see in Rishikesh!!! Starts at 7pm but recommendation - to come at least 30 minutes in advance. There is usually "puja" before the ceremony as such additional new experience.

title: Auspicious and must see
review: The ganga art is a huge one. Lots of chimes and bells ringing everywhere.  Making us feel heavenly. Strikes our chord

title: Even more interesting than I thought it would be
review: Get there around 6.  Watch people and preparations before the ceremony.  You can get very close to the water and the  flaming pot wavers by going just outside the rope.  There are a plethora of wonderful cultural events in India, but this one was mesmerizing.

title: ganga aarti
review: in my opinion any one want to see ganga aarti this is also one of them to see ganga aarti in this ghat.

title: A bucket list item
review: Very serene experience. The arti is done by young students and they are in perfect harmony.  The ghat is very clean and well managed. Its a must visit for everyone who visit Rishikesh

title: Very clean and well managed
review: Very clean and well managed, we did the arti, which is a must attend of any one visiting Rishikesh.  Better than any other religions place

title: Nice Experience
review: My experience with ganga aarti at Triveni Ghat was awesome. The aarti was started  just before sunset. You can easily get a comfortable place to sit there especially on weekdays.

title: Bhuvnesh
review: A thrilling and charmful aarti held there, all Pandit in one row and readhmatic chanting slogans and readhmatic aarti bhajan. Flams of aarti up and down same times and all gathering do aarti all together.

title: Must do if you're in Rishikesh
review: This experience is better than the Har Ki Pauri Aarti. The aura and scenes created here are out of this world, and you'll want to experience it again and again. It's just mesmerizing.

title: Spiritual
review: Very beautiful experience and proud to be Hindu. Having such a strong and spiritual place you forget about all materialist world during Aarti. Om Namoh Shivaye.

title: Mesmerized,
review: It was simply amazing... the time, the place, the atmosphere everything is simply out of the world experience..  Jai Ganga Maiya.

title: Add this experience as part of your Hindu spiritual bucket list !!
review: Amazing experience,... feels great to partake in the prayer, light lamps and set flowers unto the River Ganga. This is such a holy place and if you are a devotee to Lord Shiva, this has to be on your bucket list on places to visit and experience.

title: very good place to see Ganga aarti in Rishikesh
review: There are 2 places in Rishikesh where you can see ganga aarti, one is treveni ghat & Parmarth Niketan.. Both the place is very good

title: Beautiful.
review: Amazing Experience.

title: Relaxing and Devotional Arti
review: A totally different type of Aarti which we never saw before. Pooja starts at 6 pm at the ghat, for which you can pay and get it done personally. The Aarti time is 7 pm - 7:20 pm. Around 15 priests perform the puja together at the ghat and the Aarti Deepak is passed on to the general public too.

title: Peaceful praying
review: The Aarti was conducted in an elegant manner and all devotees were made to sit in neat rows. No jostling or shoving. The Aarti thali was circulated among everyone for worshipping and then for accepting the  Blessings. Extremely peaceful.

title: VERY GOOD
review: In the evening we have attended this arti. good experience to watch. A group of students performed there arti and other bhajans.

title: Divine experience..
review: It was a great, one of a kind experience. We had reached early and got seats in the front with clear view of the Aarti.

title: divine
review: ganga aarti at the Haar ki Paudi ghat is divine and out of this world. Try and sit in the opposite side of the aarti to enjoy the spectacular view

title: Namaskar Ganga
review: Good ghats, well maintained but a little neglected. Lately some initiatives have stated taking place for cleanliness drives. Yet its the connection that you may get. Its a new ghat .

title: Amazing
review: It is an amazing place and you must must visit here to attend the aarti.  it is such a relaxing place and for inner peace.

title: the authentic aarti
review: There is a nice walkway along the Ganges and feels like you can walk forever. Nice spots to take a pause along the way. A great chai shop at the Ghat. And the most incredible experience is the Aarti - it is performed with such reverence, unlike at the other spots in Rishikesh where the singers were busy taking selfies with western tourists while in the midst of performing the aarti!

title: Must See
review: Don't leave Rishikesh without spending at least one evening watching this ancient ritual.  You will be besieged by children and women thrusting flower offerings into your hands which you are expected to pay for.  Keep your hands out of reach and be very, very firm about how many (if any) you wish to buy.  As soon as you reach in your pockets the kids start lighting them and pushing them into your hands. Despite the hassle, the kids are sweet natured and the ceremony is beautiful.

title: Slightly pricey but worth it
review: Located slightly far from the main Laxman/Ram Jhula area, but near Triveni Ghat which has its own Ganga arti. The hotel has their own shuttle to the main city area and back everyday. Plenty of activities to do at the hotel itself, they have a nice private ghat and some place to cycle and walk around right outside the hotel along the river. The room had a nice view of the Ganga, the staff was very helpful. Food was good.

title: Jai Maa Gange
review: The Moment of Aarti makes us feel spiritual. We are blessed by Maa Gange. I can't explain my feeling by words...

title: Very Neglected
review: I visited the Triveni Ghat and was very disappointed to find human faeces on the pathway and garbage just strewn across the floors.

title: Nice ceremony
review: I'd been to the Aati ceremony in varanasi earlier this year which I thought was average, so I was expecting the same here. However, I was pleasantly surprised. This was much more intimate and inclusive than the varanasi ceremony and we really enjoyed it. Try walking from tapovan along the ghats to get a good appreciation of local life

title: great energy
review: it's a holy city and if you want to experience true Indian believe and love toward goddess and dedication,you come to visit triveni ghat ganga aarti. I love it, the best aarti in rishiksh.

title: Evening ceremony
review: Interesting to watch. Looks a bit dangerous with all the fire. The best one to watch is up by the wedding cake ashram up at the top on the right.

title: Feels good to be here
review: one should definitely go to this ghaat for ganga aarti at around 6 pm. Its beautiful experience.

title: Worth doing
review: Amazing experience, very well done spiritual Aarti. Started at 7:00pm done by many young guys who were all well synchronized and doing it from heart.

title: Very nice place, no one should miss it.
review: A really place to visit specially those who believe on God and Devine mind. It is believed, if some one take bath at this place, not only all sin of life will be washed out but also, an infinite joy and happiness may come in life...!!

title: Amazing Ganga Aarti at Haridwar
review: Haridwar, I visited before but couldn't have the chance to participate evening Ganga Aarti at Hari-ki-Pauri. This time I had the chance and tried to express my Devine gratitude to Ma Ganga. It was excellent experience that I ever had.

title: Really nice Aarti.
review: I would have given it a 5 star review but some of the locals are still using plastic bowls to float down the river.  More education and care needs to be taken to let people know it's not okay to litter the Ganges with plastics and garbage.

title: Divine
review: Ganga aarti is something every traveller must see in Rishikesh.

title: Lovely experience
review: The best Arti I ever been to.. So nice and calming, amazing energy and feeling. Pity couldnt join more evenings.. :) shanti

title: Jai Ganga Mata
review: The Ganga Aarti is performed 7 PM daily at Triveni Ghat. Attending Ganga Aarti there is a meditative experience for me. I l look forward to be part of Ganga Ararti there whenever I pass through Rishikesh.  Now they don't allow vehicle movement to Triveni Ghat during Aarti time (I guess 5 to 8).

title: Good place to spent time.
review: Triveni Ghat is a very good place to spent your time.

title: mesmerizing
review: The evening prayer at sun set brings together whoever is around. It's the performance of the rituals by the pandits that lets the spectator feel amazed, emotional or transformed. A must visit when in Rishikesh.

title: Very well orchestrated
review: The whole ambience created for the evening Aarti is carefully orchestrated and executed.

title: Must attend Ganga ji Arti at Triveni Ghat - Rishikesh
review: I found this good because you will get to see people performing bhajans before and after the Arti in evening.

title: A must if you are in Rishikesh....
review: It's an out of the world experience to be on the Ganges riverfront at the time of sunset with all the Shloka chanting and Aarti ....It cannot be explained in words...Has to be a personal experience...

title: Can't be missed when in Rishikesh
review: Ganga Aarti is something not to be missed. It's a sort of magical & holy experience for travelers visiting Rishikesh. Ganges is a sacred river & Hindus worship Ganges & take dip in holy water to wash away their sins. Summer evenings is the best time to participate in Ganga Aarti plus can try to do little shopping in Ghat road.

title: Ganga arti
review: It was an excellent experience at triveni ghat to to do aarti in the evening by paying just RS 300 per family

title: Divine
review: The evening Aarti, chanting of the priests and tolling of hundred bells at Triveni Ghat transforms the evening into a divine, pure spiritual and timeless experience.

title: Hours of peace and happiness !
review: This is perhaps one of the best places in Rishikesh to relax by being with the holy, mighty Ganga by her side for hours together. There are cool, comfortable places to sit and watch   the river during anytime of the day. The Ghat is accessible by car ; there's a proper car parking. I went mid day in the month of March and it was so pleasant even then !  walk as farther as you can away from the car parking area on the walk ways of the Ghat and you will find the quieter places, very close to the river.  Hari Om !

title: Awe-inspiring
review: The Ganga aarti at Triveni Ghat is a must. Forget about Hardwar; the crowds will put you off. The Triveni ghat is a quieter place, fewer people, live music and a soul-stirring experience to watch the aarti as the sun sets over the hills. The fact that one faces the forest across the river adds to the charm and magic of the location.

title: Memorable
review: its one in a lifetime when you experience such subtle, calm and tranquil that only could be ghat....

title: Do it
review: It's mesmerizing and fun. You'll be incourage to get invloved as both locals and tourist alike. It's a really nice, spiritual thing to do. It will be dark when it finishes so keep this in mind girls.

title: must for religious person okay for other
review: if you are a Religious person, you will love each and every thing happens here. but if you came here with the peer pressure or for family pressure, you will be bored. so much crowd and be aware of cheaters who wants your money on the name of Gods. no cleanliness and dirt everywhere.

title: Arti
review: It was amazing to see aarti at Rishikesh. This is one of the hindu's holy place where we can sit in front of ganga ji.

title: Mesmerizing Experience
review: It was an amazing experience. Best time to visit is 7 pm onwards, i.e. the Arti time. It is beautiful to see the whole Arti.

title: spectacular ritual
review: We sat amonst others watching the beauty of flame torches lighting the evening sky. Chanting rose to a climax, honouring the Holy Ganga river.  Flower offerings from many people floated along in the pure-flowing river.  A beautiful sight and sound before a comfortable stroll back to our hotel.  Magical and completely free to all.

title: Triveni Ghat Aarti
review: Very nice spiritual experience. Well organized right on the river Ganga with good music and voice. Must visit.

title: Great experience
review: I would say this is the No. 1 thing one must do while visiting Rishikesh. The ceremony is interesting to watch and one can actually feel its energy.  Some may say its rather touristy but still its quite inspiring.

title: Aarti
review: This Aarti was amazing. The bhajan is sung in sublime fashion and you can get lost in the whole experience. Not very push on providing donations to do or watch aarti. An amazing event with my kids.

title: Must visit
review: One must experience this divine Arti once. It is a unique view. Offering some flowers is also a good idea.

title: En evening spectacle by the Ganga
review: Treveni Gath is very popular for evening Arti around six o'clock. Not just for foreign tourists, in fact most visitors/onlookers/spectators are Indian people enjoying their cultural activities.

title: Nice place to visit the daily rituals of Hinduism
review: Great place to visit the Ganga Aarti by the Ganga River.  Starts daily 6pm to 7pm.  If you do not want to pay to get in the barrier area,  you could just stay outside to watch the rituals.  A place to visit if you are 1st time in rishikesh..

title: Rejuvenate in Ganges
review: My husband and I went with our group at the Ganges to bathe then wait to took part or see the Aarti. Afterwards we did prayers. It was quite amazing to be there and see this and knowing that it happens every day, it's quite a treat! We felt bless to have this opportunity to be there.

title: Nice experience
review: Nice experience. Less crowded and less-dirty when compared to Aarti at other more renowned ghats (Haridwar,Varanasi etc).

title: Very serene!
review: We went to all three places in Rishikesh for the evening aarti and connected most with the Triveni Ghat aarti. The aarti is magical in so many ways and I felt a profound sense of peace and tranquility. If you are in Rishikesh, do not miss this aarti. We will be back!

title: Very very cold water
review: It's really very cold water.  We (me and my family )  visited Triveni Ghat may be 4-5 years ago when i was very young.

title: Divine Experience at Triveni Ghat AARTI Time
review: We had blissful experience of this ceremony ......One of the best aarti on the Ganga Banks.

title: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
review: nice and colorful. a lot of tourist and local people. it's worth to see specially the lights and flower over the gange

title: MUST VISIT
review: The Best Experience Is The Aarti In The Evening Just Before Dark... N Try To Note Aa The Aarti Is Going On It Gets Darker Only After Aarti...

title: WOW
review: Get there for 6:30pm to get a good seat and not miss a minute of the action! Beautiful ceremony and stylish dancing afterwards.

title: Nice Experience
review: The overall ambiance of the place was very soothing. It was good to see the priest performing the aarti in unison. I have seen the Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat in Varanasi, numnerous times, and it is huge in grandeur. Still, attending the aarti at Rishikesh has its own feel.

title: Awesome
review: Triveni Ghat is in the city center only.

title: not to be missed
review: most serene,solemn and divine thing one can eperience in life time.There is lots of  seating place.Other arti is at parmarth niketan footsteps.there is also one arti at shatrughan ghaat.

title: Trevini Ghat worth visiting!
review: We were lucky to be able to take part in the Aarti at Trevini Ghat while we were visiting Rishikesh in February. They invited us in to the enclosure and involved us in the ceremony and made us feel so welcome. Lovely and amazing people!

title: Soothing Place
review: 1) The Ghat is on river Ganges.

title: unique experience
review: The Aarti in Haridwar is different (as any other Aarti in Ganges, each one has its ways). Very interesting and full of people on both side of the Ganga

title: Blissful Experience
review: Wherever you are in the day but in evening you should be here. Sound of Bhajans, Floating flowers with lighten diyas in river, A divine place which brings a lot of peace and happiness. Love attending Aarti's there.

title: Nice place
review: Nice place specially in evening time, site seen are excellent.. location is also good,  best place for silent and cool mind.

title: BEst place to see the aarti of Ganga
review: Its very peaceful and harmony place. You can just sit bank of Ganga and see the water flowing and there is forest cross river, sometimes you can see the elephant drinking water.

title: "Experience a truely peaceful Ceremony"
review: We were so impressed with the early morning Aarti - peaceful, serene, personal & respectful!!

title: Feeling of Ancient Spirituality
review: I went there twice. the nightly ceremony by young monks with music and fire is irresistible. I launched my flower bowl onto the Ganges with a prayer and knowing Oneness.

title: Well maintained Ghat, Participate in Aarti and Experience rafting
review: A well maintained, neat and clean ghat on the bank of River Ganga in Rishikesh.  This ghat has two main attractions - Rafting and Ganga Aarti.  We went for rafting here.  It was very enjoyable.  Quite thrilling experience.  Evening we participated in the Ganga Aarti. The devotional environment was quite mesmerizing.

title: Mesmerized participate in the evening aarti
review: Every evening Ganga Aarti is organised at Triveni Ghat in Rishikesh. Thousands of   devotees congregate on the bank of River Ganga in Triveni Ghat to offer prayers to Mother Ganga. Aarti songs, offerings of flowers and floating of Lighted Diyas into the river water make this an altogether different worship experience.

title: Fantastic
review: Nice quite place, peaceful.

title: nice ceremony
review: nice ceremony. Great singing. Feels good to be apart of the experience. Drinking water not available nearby so be prepared.

title: Wonderful
review: A very nice ceremony a little more different that I was used to.

title: Blissful...Loved it...
review: This was truly the highlight of my 18 day trip in India..I was mesmerized...I cannot wait to return to experience this again...

title: Closure to nature and spectecular
review: The more amusing thing about "Triveni Ghat" is that unlike "Har ki Paudi" made by cement it is more close to nature. If you are nature lover believe me you will love to dip in the Ganga Maa in early morning period while you will have mesmerizing view of mountains, stones, tree and lovely sound of birds. I accidentally reached here as I was planning to go "Har Ki Paudi" as usual but took bus which lead me to Hrishikesh Bus Stop so we finalized to took a bath at this ghat which will be in my mind for it's natural structure.

title: One of the best Experience in Rishikesh
review: Being in Ganga Aarti at Triveni ghat is a divine Experience. The view of Ganga is mesmerizing and Aarti sound will make you feel so pure and holy.

title: Exhilarating
review: My girlfriend and I had a guide take us, and he helped us participate. What an exhilarating experience. We're so glad we did it. The sights and sounds will warm your heart and put a big smile on your face. I highly recommend participating. If not, at least go and watch.

title: Divine experience
review: A must to do wen in Rishikesh. An open air aarti on the banks of river Ganga that starts at approximately 6:30pm for a duration of about half an hr was truly very soothing for me n my wife.

title: Must attend at Rishikesh
review: Superb experience. Ghat and adjoining area is very clean and well organised. Please note that Aarti will start after the sunset but if you want to book your slot for the Aarti then you need to reach early.

title: Inner peace
review: Attended the Ganga Aarti in the evening where in several devotees have collected along the Ganga ghat and were singing aarti song praising Goddess Ganga. Diyas were lighted and used during aarti. Flowers and lighted diyas were also seen floated in the river water by devotees. Worshipping the Goddess through aarti went on for nearly an hour.

title: Feeling of esctasy
review: The Ganga aarti at Triveni Ghat involves a congregation of devotees singing hymns and bhajan praising River Ganga and floating flowers and lighted diya into the river water.  It's the way of worshipping the Mother Goddess and seeking her blessing. The aarti in Triveni Ghat is quite rejuvenating.

title: Triveni ghat
review: Triveni ghat is a very serene place,you really feel as if you are very near to the God.You feel like staying there forever.

title: Feels in divine company
review: Must have during your trip to Rishikesh. Evening crowd is huge - go early. The evening crowd on the river Ganga is great. The Aarti commences with a big group chanting aarti in a great rythm. Time flies at this spot. You can also see a portion of Lord Siva statue that was washed away during one of the massive floods during the last few years.

title: Ghat on River Ganga
review: This is a ghat on the bank of River Ganga in Rishikesh.  This is a well maintained ghat with all arrangements for worship, Ganga Aarti and bathing. Taking a bath in the holy water of River Ganga here is said to blissful.

title: Its delightful to see
review: The rituals are a treat to the eyes. One must arrive early to get a seating/standing ahead for clear view of the ritual(arti). Its grand and spectacular. Must see.

title: Very popular and spectacular
review: We liked the grand arti in the evening. And its importance to arrive early to get better views. We enjoyed the view of the skyline and the arti songs too. Its quite popular and full of tourists.

title: Pleasant Cultural Experience
review: A nice cultural experience with lots of loud devotional music and plenty of flower floating downriver which looks beautiful and might be of interest for avid photographers. The street kids selling flowers can be a bit pushy and desperate to sell flowers, but they are very sweet to talk to and if you take a moment to connect with them even a little their hearts really show. It can be quite crowded here with locals and Hindu devotees coming to visit the holy Ganga. There are lots of shops in the area, and there are a few flowers shops where you can literally buy kilograms of rose petals for one or two hundred rupees.

title: Internal Cleansing
review: The aarti on the Ganges makes one feel cleansed and refresh the energies within. Its also a great way to  understand Hindu Rituals.

title: Evening pooja is Surreal....
review: Visited the place during my visit to Rishikesh and felt that my trip was complete after visiting this place and attending Aarti...The aura this place, especially during Aarti is out of this world..!!!

title: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
review: Visual delight for Ganga Aarti, Chanting of aarti will make give you divine experiences and have some peaceful time at Ghat

title: An experience of divinity!
review: At 6.30 in the evening just after sunset you have this amazing Aarti performed by young boys.The view,the reciting of hyms and then the Ganga Aarti. It all just seems to deep in and stay even after it gets over.Leaves you with a blissful feeling wanting to come again the next day.

title: Nice Experience
review: This Arti was serene and personal. versus the chaos at Haridhwar. Great experience. Good to see that they are also trying to keep the river clean, Bhajans and songs after the arti was a nice small touch. great end to the evening.

title: Superb experience
review: The Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is just super and mesmerizing. Please make it a point to visit and it will be worth the trip!

title: Art
review: The arti is ok, and maybe it's not as much of an orchestrated performance as some of the others, but it is totally spoiled by the loudspeakers.

title: Divine Experience
review: One of the best and most relaxing moment of my Rishikesh trip. The Ganga Aarti here is So beautiful and calm. It touches one's soul.

title: Very good
review: If you are a religious then you definitely like it. It's very good to watch and I enjoyed being there. I got to click very good images.

title: Morning Aarti
review: The holy Ganga has always attracted me and Ganga Arti always tops.A must visit for all Hindus, in mornings it is better, you get the chance to do the Aarti yourself and float the diyas in the river.

title: Nothing great about it. A lot of people. Good sunset view over the ganga.
review: There is nothing great about Triveni Ghat. It gets crowded just before Aarti. It has a good sunset view over the Ganga so it's a photographer's delight.

title: A Divine experience
review: Attended the Ganga Aarti at the Triveni Ghat with my family.

title: Must attend
review: This is something that I will definitely recommend. It is less crowded than Haridwar so one has better participation.

title: A mersmerising view in the evening but make sure to take care of your belonging
review: Ganga Arti is the best part of Haridwar . You will remember for your whole life and will share your experience with others . A must watch .  Being done from many years in same way . Just beware of the fake pandits asking for money and if you can manage the mess of keeping the shoes and belongings with you , you will enjoy and will remember the arti process for life long

title: Excellent
review: it is just awesome experience attending aarti here.  you get flowers easily for pooja and it is very clean ghat.

title: Enchanting
review: A very local ceremony. Good music and a well performed religious event. Felt part of the ceremony. Dancing afterwards if you feel like it. Well worth a visit.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: Spiritual and enlightening. You have to be there for yourself. No review can do justice to what we felt and more so if you have someone there to guide you. We were fortunate to have our host, Mr. Khanna of Divine Resort & Spa there the whoke day with us on our spiritual discovery. Video record it all, you will appreciate it when you get home. Definitely 6 STARS.

title: DONT t miss
review: Donn't miss this ,worth seeing . the drive way on the banks of Ganges is worth and it is clean and for good long walk

title: Divine experience.
review: The aarti at the banks of Gangs,was really mesmerizing. The disciplined crowds surrounding the entire area, chanting the aarti was spell bounding. Only disgusting thing was the landed asking for donations.

title: Out of this world!!
review: A very well-practiced and beautiful Aarti very different from what is done at other Ghats...the Pandits are standing on stands in a line on the Ghat and people are not allowed to move and crowd the place..disciplined, very-well practised and designed Aarti...out of this world!!

title: Incredible Aarti
review: The Aarti performed at the Triveni Ghat is one of the top experiences to have in Rishikesh. The puja is absolutely beautiful and sight to see there are a number of priests performing the Puja with huge oil lamps! The chanting at this Aarti is incredibly powerful and joyous and it is one of those things you'll remember forever. Make sure you come to this Aarti as well as the one at Parmath Niketan.

title: Wonderfully peaceful time!
review: It was incredibly to get to experience such a beautiful ceremony and tradition along the beautiful banks of the Ganga!

title: Out of the world experience
review: The most divine place I have ever visited. The evening becomes most memorable when you let yourself flow through the divine chantings at Arti. Gangaji turns into mother of entire world.

title: Good place to be
review: Aarti sung at the banks of the holy river ganga. This asrti will definitely put you in a state of trance.

title: 3in1 Ghat
review: Yes, this is the most decorated ghaats in Rishikesh area with Ganga Yamuna & Saraswati meeting to form the Triveni.

title: Serene and spiritual
review: In stark contrast to the crowds and chaos at the Parmarth Ashram aarti, the Triveni Ghat ceremony is quietly classy.  It is also participative, with the trays carrying the lamp being passed from hand to hand amidst the sonorous chanting and the coordinated graceful movements of the priests performing Puja.  A must-not-miss element of the Rishikesh experience.

title: great aarti
review: the people there were friendly wonderfully organised aarthi felt like maa ganga was there even there were presence of her.Beautifully done,clean place,the river was kept clean as well

title: Its was a wonderful experience, parents loved it
review: It happens at a big spacious ghat at teeno sangam, it was averagely crowded. They also allow you hold small aartis individually and no cost for it. My parents loved it. Even my 4 year kid liked watching aarti done by many priests standing on platforms with big aartis.

title: Excellent Aarti  place
review: We did the ganga aarti at Triveni Ghat and it was divine. Its very organised and there is ample opportunities to participate in the aarti. The Venue is well maintained and clean

title: Eternal peace and great place for soulful experience....
review: Triveni ghat is very famous in rishikesh for its evening ganga aarti... It is recommended to leave early for this place for a good view of the aarti as the place becomes extremely crowded during the aarti time...

title: Triveni Ghat
review: Dont know much about the place or its history. Went there to witness the Ganga aarti. It is quite elaborate. It started at 17:30 and one must witness it when in Rishikesh. Other place where one can witness Ganga aarti is at Parmarth Niketan near Ram Jhula. Triveni Ghat is near the main city centre of rishikesh & half an hour drive away from the tourist/hotel hubs of Laxman Jhula & Ram jhula. Parking is available. Surrounding it is the market of rishikesh where one can buy all kinds of stuff. If you want to fill Ganga Jal better drive further up before Rishikesh starts.

title: Not to be missed
review: Serene and peaceful experience. Very well organised Ganga Arti at Triveni Ghat Rishikesh. Recommended for all.

title: Awesome feel
review: This is the most awaited experience in the lap of Gange maa. Jai Ganga mayia. I have been first time on this ghat.

title: Religious
review: Gives an authentic feel. Safe with kids. Scenically beautiful. A full visit would take 2 hours. Check YouTube video to get an idea.

title: Divine experience
review: The aarti may not be as beautiful as the one at Hardwar, but it is beautiful experience all the same. The live chants and the coordinated aarti of many priests transports you to a divine level. It is very well organised with lots of place for the spectators to sit comfortably and watch the aarti. It was a wonderful experience.

title: Excellent place to visit - calm quite hassle free
review: A must visit attraction at Rishikesh

title: Spiritual
review: outstanding experience that leaves you speechless. the arti at triveni ghat is a great experience and something that i had never witnessed before.

title: Definitely worth experiencing
review: The ganga aarthi is definitely worth exploring and it is an experience which will leave an impression on you. The mighty ganga flowing peacefully near the shores.

title: Great experience
review: The Aarti at Triveni Ghat is a great experience. Especially in the winters with the sun setting earlier. The diyas light up the entire ghat and it looks great. It is smaller than the other Rishikesh Ghats however, a great experience.

title: Disappointingly dirty and little water to bathe in. What a shame.
review: We had high expectations, given the excellent promenade, clean ashrams and nice hotels n Rishikesh. Ok, so the Aarti in the evening is nice, but during the day the area is grimy and seedy. With the river being so very low in 2016, all the faults here are apparent. These are all caused by humans: as the signs along the river say, "This is a holy place! Respect Ganga! Keep it clean!" Obviously, the locals do not agree........ this is a great pity, and has the potential to damage tourism in the area. Come on, Rishikesh Town Council...... sort it out: we love this town!

title: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
review: An Aarti to praise Gange Ma and thank her for her benevolence is held every evening at this Ghat at sunset. a little different from the one at Varanasi, this one is a very homely and participative ceremony and Thalis and Pushps (flowers) are distributed to the viewers so that they can also be a part of the prayer. You will see several members of the audience clapping, waving a pooja thaali or simply swaying to the chanting music. The seating is on the steps of the ghat, but they are covered with a carpet before the ceremony starts for comfort. It is a short affair, taking about 25 minutes from start to finish. The prayer is chanted by a live singer and accompaniment , and people are encouraged to remain after the pooja has ended and listen the bhajans and songs. A truly spiritual experience which makes you feel blessed.

title: Awesome
review: A nice Vibrant Arthi.

title: High Energy
review: Outstanding high energy experience. The arti at triveni ghat takes place just after the  sunset. It is an amazing spiritual  experience and a must visit.

title: Simply an amazing experience
review: Simply an amazing experience to see. If you find hotel locally you can attend daily. Go early and stay to the end to ensure the full experience. Take part and enjoy it even more.

title: Spiritual, clean and divine
review: the place is right on the banks of the holy Ganga. It's clean and tidy. The singers and devotees who perform the bhajans were great singers and seemed genuinely inclined towards spirituality. the ambiance is calming and soothing. Not loud. A lot of foreigners find comfort here. Reach here by 4:45 to find a better seat on the steps and enjoy the live bhajans.

title: Great experience, better than Haridwar
review: The Aarthi happens in Varanasi style and the Ganga ji trust is doing a good job here. There is a small stream of water diverted from Ganga ji and the worship happens there in a disciplined and methodical (synchronised) way. There is devotional music and lots of chorus bhajans during the event. Gives you a great experience.

title: BEAUTIFUL
review: Impressive religion ritual of Hindus in the evening, all the mantras singing, the monks thanks the ganges in the cleanest part of the river, simply amazing.

title: Triveni Ghat
review: It was great. relaxing and rejuvenating, just sitting besides on the triveni ghat and watching the ganga aarti along the banks.

title: A mesmerizing experience
review: A divine and peaceful experience on the ghats of Ganges. you will be mesmerized by the sheer beauty and grandness of the arty at Triveni ghat.

title: Mesmerising experience!
review: We were walking from Laxman jhula to ram jhula when we came across this aarti. It was an out of world experience. It gives you inner peace which cant be defined. All those lamps and diyas in ganga look so beautiful. Don't necessarily be there for whole Arti but do check it out for few minutes. Once in a lifetime experience!

title: peace to the soul
review: the aarti was very good. the bhajans were nice. it was a must have experience. it gives you an inner peace.

title: A captivating experience
review: I am sure Ganga aarti at Triveni ghat invokes devotion in any one who witnesses it, it is that wonderful. It is performed in the style followed at Varanasi and is quite grandiose.The aarti is performed at a small stream diverted from the main river, so Ganga may not appear to be as magnificient but the harmony of the aarti is worth watching. There is also an hour of devotional songs and meditation, so it is an all-in-all evening worth spending.

title: Mesmerizing aarti
review: The entire experience was quite mesmerizing.  My only suggestion would be not to play movie bhajans.  Otherwise the entire experience was unforgettable.

title: Divine place
review: Even people I referred told me that Rishikesh is the best place to watch the Ganga Aarthi. Make yourself be there comfortably before start of Aarth time. It is not an experience to share but to feel yourself

title: Peaceful place
review: This ghat is surrounding Holy Ganga river. One can experience wonderful view of Ganga coming out of the mountains. One can jog around the river in fresh air.

title: Best spiritual experience ever!
review: Wow!

title: A unforgettable experience
review: On the final leg of our Char Dham Yatra we got to spend quite a bit of time at Rishikesh.  The best part was the Evening Aarathi at around 6.00 PM that was organized for our group.  The Pooja went on for over 45 minutes with many chanting and recitals all along.  The Arathi takes places near Triveni Ghat and it is better to be seated at around 5.45 PM for this.  The pandits, facing the river, Ma Ganga pray to the river considering her as a form of the Divine. Seating is comfortable on steps that have been built for the purpose.  With as many as a dozen pandits standing on elevated platforms facing the river perform the pooja and the dusk sets it, it is an experience that cannot be explained in words.  The least I can say is that we become one in those moments of ecstasy.  There is no charge/entrance fee for the event and everyone can witness and get the blessings of the Divine.  We also had the opportunity to hold the Aarathi and sing the Ma Ganga sloka.  It is better to take a holy dip at the Triveni Ghat which is also well kept before sitting for the Aarathi.

title: Serene Ganges
review: A peaceful experience. How much ever time you spent there you will always want to come back to attend the Ganga Arati

title: Divine
review: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat in the evening is so soaking. You are totally lost during the aarti. It is performed in a very systematic manner with bhajan chantings. Young boys perform the aarti standing on stools with lamps lit and the river Ganga looks so pious in the backdrop.

title: Great View and Enjoyed the Ganga Aarati
review: Be there before 5.30 in the evening or morning to ensure you choose the best place offer. Overall great experience to witness Ganga Aarti.Do not miss if you are in Rishikesh.

title: A beautiful event held every night.
review: The evening aarti is a wonderful experience.  All at once it is peaceful, colorful, energetic, and a great for all senses.  The aarti at Trevini Ghat is special because of the live music.  A must-see.

title: Divine, peaceful, must experience when in Rishikesh !!!
review: The Ganga arti at Triveni ghat or even at Parmarth Niketan ghat in Rishikesh is a must experience ritual !!! The arti happens between 5 to 6 pm during winters. They have nice place to sit and soak in the holy chanting of Ganga arti and shlokas.

title: Wonderful Experience!
review: Our hostel (Shiv Shakti) took us on a tour to the Ganga Aarti and explained to us what was happening. It was a great experience to see the ceremony and how passionate they were about the ritual. Highly recommend this.

title: BEAUTIFUL CEREMONY
review: This is a really beautiful ceremony held in the evening.  I am very glad we went and I think it is a must do.  It was lovely to buy some flowers, send blessing to those that have left us and let the flowers drift into the river.

title: Pure Magic
review: Was transported to another world, just seeing the majesty of Ganga and the shimmer fire on the leave offerings is just magic to the eye

title: Awesome way to feel Zen within you
review: It was mesmerising to see how going back into few years of history and going away from NCR lifestyle can be so relaxing

title: a mesmerising time
review: we had to run to this event which happens every evening at 6pm, and we were glad we did, the place was packed but yet it was calm and nice and we even had some place to see the aarthi upclose. it was beautiful and nice

title: An absolute must!
review: My group did not know what to expect from the Aarti that was part of our itinerary. We were touched beyond measure by this experience. It felt like it opened us to what drew us to India in the first place. We also experienced the Rishikesh Aarti but I have to say I loved the Haridwar one better - if I had to choose just one.

title: Aarti at Treveni Ghat
review: Our hotel at Ganga Kinari offered us a complimentary guide to take us and bring us back.

title: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
review: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat worth to see. situated in Rishikesh, Uttarakhand. It is the biggest and most famous ghat in Rishikesh at the banks of Ganges.ou will love the view when lots of leafted-lamps were flown in ganga water in the evening,housand of people gather there and sing the aarti which is very nice. You will love this place and would like to visit again and again,ere at evening large number of people, Pandits and Yogachrya collected to do Ganga Aarti that moment you will feel like you are in Inderlok and seeing the Mata Ganga really a beautiful river and fresh water. the beauty of flowing water become twice at the Time of Ganga Aarti So whenever you come at Uttrakhand must take part in Ganga Aarti. At day time you can enjoy full shopping to the traditional goods of Uttrakhand and can enjoy the traditional foods also.

title: An absolute Energetic Experience
review: A definite positive experience being at the Ganga Aarti. A place with full of positive energy and lights :)

title: Peaceful and best thing to do in Rishikesh
review: The mantras mersmerise you. The sound of flowing ganga soothes your senses and tere us magic in the air at the Ganga ghat. Don't miss this.

title: An experience difficult to forget
review: Aarti at Ganga ghat is an experience difficult to forget. Relax besides the ghat, chant and be part of the Aarti. It's an amazing devotional feeling.

title: Ganga Aarti is a good time spent
review: The Ghat is very ill-kept and dirty...the Aarti is a time to be there, the water flow of Ganga is concentrated to a small stream, so the view is not very gorgeous.

title: Excellent religious ceremony conducted in very orderly and professional way
review: For family it was wonderful experience which was conducted in a very orderly and professional manner. With the result even crowd behaviour was unlike other Hindu public religious ceremonies. Organises provided carpet on stairs to sit comfortably. To be in short it was very enjoyable and satisfying experience. One must visit this place.

title: Better view than Haridwar
review: The Service commences at 5, with a sermon just before 6 followed by the fire ceremony.  It is very moving and less crowded than Haridwar.  Every one can join in singing Hari Krishna.

title: Another must see
review: So honoured I was able to attend and share this experience with so many others. Very crowded but peaceful at the same time...

title: Divine experience
review: Aarti happens on the ghat and amazing sight to see.. The ghat is absolutely clean... It happens at 6 to 6.30 in the evening...

title: Ganga Aarti
review: I'm coming since childhood. I like here everyday evening aarti. I enjoy here Aarti, chanting and bhajan etc.

title: Divine
review: Its a very divine experience. Also being less  crowded compared to haridwar you can have a good view of Aarti from nearby.

title: Pure and serene
review: Triveni Ghat is for all solace if you can spend some time. Ganga river here is pristine and mostly untouched unlike in Haridwar.

title: Holy lights of India
review: Holy river ganga attracts all men and women children gathered at ghat to see the arthi amazing moments watching and hear the song jay jegathisa hare

title: especial place
review: everyday, 18:00, pooja ceremony with great manifestation of fire, respect to the Mother Ganga and deep spiritual feelings coming from the participants.

title: Best place to experience divine aarti
review: Cleanest ghat we have come across.  Aarti  is organised very well and the bhajan singing group adds to this divine experience with their melodius voice

title: Mesmerizing Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghant
review: The Ganga Aarti at The Triveni Ghat was a one of its kind experience for me and my parents who were on a pilgrimage. The atmosphere was filled with melodious Bhajans (Live Music) . we occupied the first seat towards the Ganga River (best spot) as it gives a clear view of the Ganga and the Aarti. Also you may be lucky enough like us to be handed over a fully lit Diya for the Aarti. What followed was an amazing show of great synchronization by the ones holding the burning Diya towards the Ganga. The divine mix of Music and Light (aarti) is a memory that you will treasure forever! Highly recommended

title: Commercialized
review: When we first started visiting Rishikesh, the Arati was a homely affair. Now they have a separate structure where you get a (badly) synchronized Arati in the Varanasi style. It no longer has the warmth and inclusiveness it once had. Although it is not as bad as in Har ki Paudi in Haridwar (which is now a complete money-making venture) still it is sad to see that the real values disintegrate in the face of rising greed.

title: A deeply spiritual and beautiful experience
review: Aarti at the sacred Ganga is a a beautiful way to connect and experience the spirit of the the people in Rishikesh and the devotion they have for the Ganga. You might just feel spiritually elevated yourself

title: Peaceful 🙏🏻
review: This place is really peaceful the surrounding the people with different colours,different dress, I just feel calm and relax whenever I visit this place ...

title: Mesmerising experience of Ganga Aarti
review: It's ans awesome feeling when you stand near river Ganges for aarti..You suddenly feel shrine, so pure. Just close your eyes and you will feel this world is full of happiness. So, i must request please visit this place if you are planning to visit Rishikesh.

title: divine
review: it is well worth the experience.it commences at 6.30 so would advice getting there earlier to get seats. the live bhajans or devotional songs are great experience,while the aarti is performed by numerous priests next to the river. For Rs 20 one can buy flowers,diya to immerse in the GANGA,this ceremony is open for everyone irrespective of nationality

title: Devotion at its peak
review: With the prayer at its helm, it is an unforgettable event to be at Triveni Ghat, while doing Aarthi to River Ganges. Words are not sufficient / available to express once feeling.

title: Triveni Ghat experience
review: i happened to visit Triveni Ghat on my trip to Rishikesh. The first thing that hits you wen you reach this place is the spiritual vibe its got. You can find people performing the aarti along the banks of the river ganges and also people taking a dip in the holy waters. If you looking for such an experience in Rishikesh, its recomended.

title: Serene Ghat
review: This Ghat is one of the most famous ones in Rishikesh. One reaching here you can find loads of people doing various things like aarti and bathing in the river. This ghat offers a very good view of the mountains and the river. Want spiritual vibes? Go here.

title: Peaceful place
review: I went there last week during festive occasion in the evening. The approach to this place was a narrow street which was crowded and chaotic. There were plenty of shops selling flowers, puja materials etc. One can experience Ganga aarti during evening. Was a good experience being here. There are many temples around the ghat.

title: Nice experience
review: The Aarti hold every day evening start from 5:30 to 7:30pm and every evening full of visitors more than 150. So you can imagine it must be something or it won't attract so many ppl every day. Really a good experience at least once when you are in Rishikeh.

title: Divine Experience of floating candles / Diyas amidst the chants of Holy mantras.
review: What can I say about the Ganga Aarti @ Triveni Ghat.  The whole environment turns so much charges with positive energy. Before Arti, taking a dip in Holy Ganga and offering the "Donas" filled with praying materials, lighting up the Diyas and watching it going with the Ganga Waves amidst the mantrochchaar.  One has to see it to feel it.  I thank my stars for being witness to this scene many times..

title: Go only for the Aarti
review: The place is a meeting point of sorts for couples and young people to hang out. It only gains some character when the 6 p.m. aarti begins. The aarti is spectacular and completely non commercial. But my advice would be to reach by 5.50 and not before because there is nothing great in the view.

title: Must see...
review: Ganga Aarti happens on both sides of the river at two points. We went to the one near Ram Jhula. As it was evening, there wasn't too much of a crowd. We were able to soak in the whole thing without being pushed and pulled. Ganga Aarti happens around 6:30pm. Post this, you can take a stroll around to see the shops and get souvenirs. Pretty cheap and decent quality so don't hesitate.

title: Rafting in ganga
review: Few days back I went to rishikesh with my companions for 3 or 4 days . It was an incredible fun in the wake of observing every one of the sanctuaries or raam jhulaa and laxman jhula. We choose to do some enterprise sports like Such as stream rafting. Rishikesh which is celebrated for its rafting stream and for its enterprise, it is so delightful place. Individuals who cherish experience, needs to have a go at rafting at any rate once in their life. The stream may look quiet, yet once you go through fast, you will encounter the rushes and energy .

title: Cultural
review: The guide from my resort got me here. Although not the cleanest of places but then gave a good peek a boo into the local culture and traditions.

title: Best Ganga Aarti in compare to haridwar and varanasi
review: Best performed Ganga Aarti in India. Very organised aarti at triveni ghat. Less crowd in compare to haridwar and varanasi. I was with six German Clients of me and it was memorable.

title: Over commercialized!!
review: We had been to this place last year and were taken aback by forced   worship. The Ganges was decently clean however the stakeholders there only had one agenda in mind..to milk money. Not for the peace lovers!! Thats my experience...people may have had different experience!!

title: Divine & Peaceful
review: I visited Triveni Ghat 4 times in a span of 7 days. It was very close to where i stayed. The place is the meeting point of Ganga, Yamuna & Saraswati rivers. The views are very scenic & you get to interact with the locals too, especially religious gurus. The evening 6:15 pm 'aarti' is not to be missed. You get all the positive vibes while you are the Ghat.

title: Spiritual & Mesmerizing
review: The 'Aarti' started at 6:15 pm & it is one of the four unique style 'Aarti's' performed in India at Ganges. The spiritual vibes are very strong. it is relaxing as well as peaceful. Taking a dip after the 'Aarti' in the cold weather is a challenge, but if you can go for it. :)

title: Nice Place
review: Attended arti here during our last holiday and also sat on the steps near Ganga river. Such a peaceful and mesmerising experience and a clean ghat.

title: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
review: with cold winds heavy flow in ganga surrounded by thousands of peoples chanting and with family filling was awesome

title: Mesmerising.....
review: The maha aarti at this ghat on the banks of the Ganga is a wonderful experience. Get there early to just sit by the holy river and take in the peace. As the evening progresses and the sky begins to darken priests take their place on the platform. The aarti begins by lighting the lamps and proceeds with the chanting of the hymn in praise of the river.

title: The best arti in Rishikesh
review: This was the best aarti in Rishikesh. Had gone to the one at Parmarth also but that was not as good and was also washed away by the rain.

title: worth a visit
review: it was nice to see the ceremony right in front of the ganges river. It's peaceful and a beautiful ceremony.

title: highlight of our trip to Rishikesh
review: not overly crowded; well organized and managed; aarti itself left us wanting to return to Rishikesh again some day

title: Har Har Gange!
review: I personally like Triveni Ghat's Aarti over Haridwar's Aarti, reason being is obvious becuase of its serenity. The free flow of ganga water in its natural flow, the moutains, the air, the atmosphere is so very peacefully blissed!!

title: Arti
review: Went to observe the 6:30pm Arti. What an amazing experience. Organised, peaceful and humbling. We went to the Arti at Haridwar- would not recommend you go there

title: Food for the spirit!
review: A beautiful ghat with a mile long stretch along the river that offers a peaceful walk. The aarti with all the diyas and chanting of mantras is a beuatiful and surreal experience!

title: Good place in Rishikesh
review: Triveni Ghat is a good place to visit in Rishikesh. View is very nice specially during Sunrise. Good ghat to have Ganga bath.

title: Ganga Aarti : A heavenly and soul stirring experience
review: We reached the Triveni Ghat well in time...to get the best seats in the house. However it was a super experience. The show is well managed,everyone gets to be seated. They make ample announcements to call busy devotees wanting to be there for the Aarti before it commences.

title: Blissful experience
review: Ganga aarti at Triveni ghat is a special experience for any traveler. It leaves one with positive energy. Aarti is carried out by the local priests and the general people join them  in chorus towards the end. The lamps are moved in a synchronized manner and the chanting has vibrations which stir your soul. Must do in Rishikesh

title: Good sightseeing
review: Enjoyed taking dip in Ganga river here. Clean ghat and nice aarti. Very clean water and did not expect it to be so nice.

title: Go Rafting and participate in the evening aarti
