review: This ghat has rafting facility and Ganga Aarti is organised here every evening.  We went for rafting. It was quite thrilling and exciting experience.  We attended the aarti in the evening.  Several devotees had gathered to worship Mother Ganga. Bhajans were sung in her praise and diyas and flowers kept on leafs were floated in the river water.

title: Simply Amazing
review: What a spiritual experience of attending arti at Triveni Ghat Rishikesh. We were travelling in a family and friends group and everyone including children enjoyed the experience.

title: Amazing experience
review: Aarati at Triveni ghat is a must for visitors. It is serene. calm and bustling with mantras and shlokas so much so that u transcend to spirituality.

title: Maha Aarti at Triveni Ghat
review: Ganga Aarti is organised at Triveni Ghat every evening.  Several devotees had gathered to worship Mother Ganga. Bhajans were sung amidst beating of drums and chanting of mantras and diyas and flowers kept on leafs were floated in the river water.

title: A wonderful experience
review: The Ganga Aarti at the Triveni ghat is really wonderful, this is one of the must see things if you visit Rishikesh. The professionalism with which the pandits performed this act was really wonderful and I enjoyed everr minute of the same.

title: Mesmerising experience
review: This aarti is conducted on the main side of the river Ganges (where the city is situated)  in the evening on Triveni ghat of Maa Ganga. It is a wonderful experience to see and participate in the aarti. The aarti is conducted in loud voice with the sound of instruments. I would request all Indians to at least once visit Rishikesh and enjoy the aarti.

title: Grand Aarti
review: The grand Aarti takes place on Triveni Ghat everyday in evening at 6 pm. The pujari' performing the Aarti are dressed in red kurta and stand on a stool 1 ft above ground and face Ganga. There is a set of singers and musicians who sing the Aarti. The whole process is quite elaborate and amazing.

review: The Aarti is the most important at Triveni, Ghat. Before that having a bath at the ghat is

title: wash all your sins.....
review: i dont think any person would not want to wash his or sins, and every person visiting rishikesh definitely comes here and takes a dip in the holy ganges

title: Nice experience
review: The Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat in Rishikesh is a very nice experience with the music and the co-ordinated aarti done by numerous priests.

title: HarHar Gange
review: Excellent and photogenic experience. Very spiritual environment. We all enjoyed attending his arti and would like to come again.

title: spritual experience
review: i had attended artis at haridwr and banaras as well but was totally mesmerised by the experience here. must visit.

title: Serene dive to soul
review: this is what rishikesh is famous for..holy Ganga ghat with a chance to see evening aarti..must visit for a trip to rishikesh..spend some time along the ghat, have a dip and you would feel punds lighter inside..peace to soul and serenity to mind..

title: Beautiful spot for a walk and Ganga arti
review: I found Triveni ghat extremely charming with a beautiful location for a long stroll along the Ganges. The chaotic bazaar that leads you to the ghat is a great place for just witnessing the local culture and tradition - full of temple shops selling religious wares and street style cafes. The ghat is a long and well laid out with steps and a nice path way to walk. It has lots of ashrams one one side and the river flowing on the other side. The soothing breeze from the river is very healing and the steps make for a nice place to sit and meditate or just contemplate on our life. The Ganga Arti at 7pm is a dramatic event and it could be a nice experience as it is done with proper mantras in a traditional way. After the Arti, when you come out of the market lane on to the main road, you can find several tuk tuks that take you to other places. There is also Rajasthan Mishtan Bhandar, a nice traditional restaurants that serves delicious Indian meals and sweets. A must try!

title: Dont miss this experience
review: totally stunning and captivating experience. if you are spiritual and seek peace do attend this experience at Rishikesh.

title: Perfect spiritual experience
review: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is a perfect spiritual experience where you can feel peace of mind and show your regards to the nature. It is relaxing your mind. Superb Experience

title: Spiritual and mesmerising
review: A spiritual way to connect with yourself along with god at the same while standing at the ghat and witnessing the aarti. A soul-ful experience.

title: Serene worship of the river Ganges
review: We attended it from afar this time. From across the river actually. The lovely sound travelled to us on the Fast rushing water of the river which was in full spate after torrential rains. Peaceful and powerful.

title: Ganga Aarti by night
review: A must try experience. We went there at exactly 7 pm to witness their festive as per our guide instruction. Prepare yourself to squeeze yourself in the crowd.

title: Interesting to watch if you have not been to one before
review: Good fire ceremony if. It seen one before. View of the Ganges is great. Get to be with the localsand make,offerings to the Ganges.

title: A divine experience
review: This is a must-do thing if you are Rishikesh. The aarti here is so peaceful and so connecting that it leaves a lasting impression in your mind and soul forever. The chanting of the aarti and prayers on banks of river ganga with sun setting down is an experience to remember.

title: Great experience
review: Interesting to watch the ceremony, lots of locals go for a dip in the Ganges and the ceremony. They have them by the Ganges and in the temples.

title: Real India
review: Amazing Ganga Aarti, real & very colorful! Quite busy, mostly visited by local people. There are less tourists.

title: अपनी संस्कृती
review: I had come with my daughter to show aarti if gangaji.its much needed one must bring their children at ganga ghat to show aarti

title: Do not miss this!
review: A stunning, spiritual and beautiful ceremony near by the Ganges. Mostly local people, just a few tourists. A very memorable experience with the song and the fire. I got a seat on a mat together with the locals, I really recommend that. Do not forget your camera!

title: A peaceful journey
review: This ghat is famous for its astonishing view of the ganges. The ghat is huge and has amole parking space. The flow of ganges here is not too fast and the river is also not very deep. So a nice bath here is very soothing.

title: Nice!
review: I preferred the triveni arti over the parmarth ashram..it was more traditional however both are equally nice..

title: Holy holy
review: Must visit in Rishikesh, the time of Aarti is around 7 pm. so whenver you visit Rishikesh dont forget to go for Aarti at Triveni Ghat

title: mesmerizing experience
review: Just the pious Ganges and the rhythms would take your soul to a different level.

title: soul lifting experience.........
review: it was a superb soul lifting experience, the crowd was deeply engrossed in devotion.

title: must visit for hindu religion enthusiasts
review: ​It is one of the most sacred places for Hindus in Rishikesh for taking a holy dip in the River Ganga. Triveni Ghat is famous for the evening aarti where devotees offer their prayers. As a part of aarti, illuminated earthen lamps are floated in the ganga river water. Those chantings and music will definitely mesmerize you.There are many temples also along the Triveni ghat. Here you will people from all walks of life offering prayers and taking holy dip in the river.

title: Divine and peaceful ...
review: Such an awesome experience....so divine so peaceful.

title: Ganga Aarthi at its best!
review: People start assembling near Triveni Ghat by 6-6.30 pm...and we did the same...you can buy flowers and other offerings from the people sitting on the steps near the Ganga...

title: Peace and comfort.
review: visited Laxman jhula, arti at triveni ghat, shivpuri restaurant &

title: Serene and beautiful
review: I loved the concept of the Ganga artee, especially the way it was performed in complete synchronization. Their is also an option where you can offer a personal puja and ofcourse it all comes at a cost. But the whole visual created during the artee is beautiful.

title: Awesome Experience!
review: If you are in Rishikesh or Haridwar, this is something you can't miss..worshiping Ganga matha.In Rishikesh the Ganga Aarti happens near Ram Jhula, and it starts around 6.30 PM.

title: Pious atmosphere
review: Very beautiful and natural scene

title: Spiritual Awakening
review: Watching Ganga Aarti from up close turned me from an atheist into a proud hindu. The synchronized movement of aartis, the melody of chants and the brightness of the flames is a sure shot medicine for spiritual awakening.

title: Good peaceful place
review: Triveni ghat is wonderful place to spend peaceful time in lap of Ganga. The ghat is long and farther you go, less the crowd. The water is very cold normally and a quick dip may be taken. You can spend wonderful time on steps besides the river, sitting with feet dipped in water. The approach lanes to the ghat are crowded with a lot of shops and restaurants.

title: A divine experience
review: We had seen the Ganga Arti in Banaras but this one in Rishikesh is more inclusive. If you stay in one of the good hotels here like Ganga Kinare, you have a VIP seat and chance to do a bit of the Arti yourself. What I liked most is that it makes all the viewing public participate in the entire event. A truly mesmerising event very well conducted.

title: Divine
review: Ganga arti is one of the attraction to visit rishikesh. In this month of savan thare is lot of kavadias. We spend good time at ganga arti. Well managed and clean place. Arti followed by bhajan is creating good atmosphere for indians and foreigners as well. Must attend arti if you visit rishikesh.

title: Scintillating..
review: Awesome feeling. Watching Aarti (at the Paramartha Niketan near Ram Jhula) sitting on the banks of the River Ganga is really mesmerising.

title: Triveni Ghat
review: This is the most important and sacred place for the Hindu. A sacred bathing spot on the banks of Ganga, where devotees take a holy bath and offer prayer. Believed to be the confluence of three holy rivers Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati. If you there for a visit don’t miss the Ganga Arti at evening, it’s really beautiful and surely gives, you peace of mind.

title: Feel the God
review: The aarati at Tiveni ghat is not that grand as it is at Parmarth Niketan, Laxmanjhula or at Hardwar. Yet you feel the GOD at the time of aarati on the banks of the mighty Ganga especially in the monsoon months when the river is flowing with all its might.

title: Feel Spiritual
review: Rishikesh Ganga Aarti is an experience, Firstly it is clean, less commercialism hence more organised and feel want to spend time along the banks of ganges .. compare to Haridwar this is heavenly.

title: A cultural experience
review: Every single night an aarti (ceremony) is performed on the banks of the Ganges. Make a wish and float a candle on the flowing water. Singing and chanting and clapping. I enjoyed participating and was spiritually moved. Be prepared to make a small donation.

title: Soulful and serene
review: The Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat is the most soulful and peaceful activity that you will do when you visit Rishikesh. The serenity of the river and the ringing bells help you calm your mind and think if the divine being. People take a small diya themselves and once aarti is over, it is left to float on the water with the flow of the River Ganga.

title: Its Meditative!
review: The aarti on this ghat is very meditative and deep. After aarti do take a walk along ganga ghat to just repose in self.

title: Unique Spectacles
review: We visited  Riskikesh to see ,among other places , Ashrams ,Yoga and Meditation cantres ,the  Trivenighat for  evening arti.Over the times this ritual has attracted attention of the people.This ghat is nearer to famous Geeta Bhaban and Parmarth Ashram.Huge crowd fill the Triveni ghat before the arti time.Priests light up  the arti  stand and perform arti of River Ganga  gracefully amidst chanting of mantras/hyms and blowing of conches for 5-10 minutes. A memorable experience.

title: haridwar the holy place
review: this place is crowded like hell. what else you c an expect in the holiest place.? .There are many AArti groups.  be aware of fake pundits.

title: Awsum experience
review: This experience is not to be missed. Evening time makes it more mesmerizing. It is at the start of city only and offers best arti experience from all other Ghats.

title: The Best in Rishikesh
review: I visited for the wisdom prayesr recently. There were 20/21 priests standing by the river Ganga doing the Arti. It starts by 7:30 pm and one has to see the arti for sure.

title: Awesome is not enough!
review: It's the glare of the running water of Ganges , that whistling sound of water and lights of buildings along the rivers making it a colorful delight.

title: Auspicious
review: I felt very peaceful there. I was nice spiritual experience there. But needs more cleaning at the place.

title: Must experience when in Rishikesh
review: Very well done and quite a spiritual experience with the chanting and fire. The place can get quite crowded, so go early and find a good spot.

title: A must in Rishikesh
review: Make time on a Sunday evening to view the Ganga Aarti, Rishikesh is one of the few places after Varanasi where you can be apart of this special ceremony in its most spectacular form.

title: Spiritually uplifting
review: The aarti at triveni ghat is a very well organised event n at dusk when all the pandits do the aarti in a synchronised manner...it is a treat to see...It is somewhat like the aarti in varanasi only on a smaller scale....really very mesmerising .....

title: Lesser known but truly mesmerising!
review: If you have visited Rishikesh I'm sure you must have had a chance to witness arti at Geeta Ashram or Parmarth Ashram - it has been an emotional experience, well sometimes! But move over to the other side of mighty Ganga and you there is this lesser known ghat - the Triveni Ghat.

title: peaceful and not too crowded
review: If you are religious its one must do in Rishikesh, not very crowded. I went their with zostel  activity  coordinator. however i am not that religious.

title: Not too much rush
review: Not too much rush..better than the Haridwar aarti...

title: beautiful ceremony at the banks of Ganga
review: Ganga Aarti takes place every evening at sunset at several places and Triveni Ghat is one of the bigger and impressive ones - it is beautiful and full of good energy.

title: Peaceful Aarti on the bank of ganges
review: Aarti at Triveni ghat is well organised. One can pay Rs 300 and get personalised Pooja and seats in front rows for the family. It was a truly memorable experience for my family. I also attended Aarti a har ki Pauri...there is a lot more crowd there and the scale is grand. But one may find it difficult to attend if you are travelling with young kids or elderly parents.

title: Divine!
review: The most divining experience one can have. The Puja is very well organized and made sure everyone gets the blessings from GANGA MA.

title: Amazing and spiritual
review: Amazing ghat specially if u r able to take a dip in the holy ganges. Amazing aarti. Feels very spiritual and beautiful. Though varanasi ganaga aarti is best i feel the view in totality ie the cold river with a bavkdrop of mountains and reserve forest gives it a superior feel

title: Gange jai gange jai
review: Calm serene and beautiful, river ganga flows by as you hear priest kids sing hymns in praise of Ganges. It's very soothing and relaxes your mind. Makes your mind flow like the river , giving it a flow.

title: Ancient rites in the heart of Rishikesh
review: This is the sacred site where the Yamuna, Saraswati and Ganga are said to meet before leaving the Himalayas. The Ganga is the only river that is visible, but the ancient rites lend some magic to the site. Unfortunately the blaring loudspeakers tend to detract from the charm.

title: Worth Visiting
review: One of the most beautiful Aarti ever seen in Rishikesh. Must visit for everyone specially old age people.

title: Mr
review: A heart touching moment.. it happens at 6 pm & don't miss event on the banks of our ganga maa..I saw this at triveni ghat which is at center of rishikesh.

title: Surreal Experience.
review: To get to this place is a small trek in itself! The walk down from Lakshman Jhula to the Triveni Ghat is along the riverbank of The Ganges. The Triveni Ghat is the confluence f three sacred rivers Ganga, Yamuna and Saraswati. When you finally reach, take a dip in the holy water or just stand there with your feet dipped in the cold water. According to the beliefs, a dip in water at this ghat washes away all the sins and purifies the soul.

title: Life time experience
review: Perfect place to attend once in your lifetime. I am sure u will certainly turn up again, if you do it once.

title: A beautiful experience the aarti is
review: Although am not a very religious person, going to attend the aarti was a great decision I made. The music, the mantras chanted, the lovely breeze that flows from the mountains, the people gathered to offer prayers to the holy river and the lamps lit up by the priests and the whole aarti is a wonderful experience to take in. It touched me in ways I did not expect it to. It was a beautiful spiritual experience worth going for. Leave your cyncism behind if you are not religious and just go for a beautiful evening by the river!

title: Not to be missed
review: One of the best aarti i have attended in Rishikesh. Not to be missed if you are in Rishikesh. You can see many diyas floating on the river which makes the river even more attractive at night.

title: Delightful ceremony at sunset
review: Triveni ghat, where three rivers meet, is the place to go for evening ceremony along Ganga river. A dozen of brahmins - more than elsewhere - are offering fire to the river, after having blessed families on request. Westerners are kindly welcome by local people who are happy to discuss with them.

title: Very Crowded...
review: for devotees its amazing. but if u just want to visit hari ki powri, dnt visit at d time of ganga aarti. coz its very crowded n trusttes have appointed a team to collect money from drvotess n they keep asking for donations which is quite irritating.

title: Rishkesh Visit
review: Best Place in Rishikesh for Ganga Arati. Very Peace full place. Best for Family. easily accessible by road transport.

title: Good Experience
review: Triveni Ghat is situated near Mayakund,Rishikesh on the Rishikesh-Haridwar road.

title: The aarti at triveni ghat
review: A memorable visual experience, laced with spirituality. Everyone should go and enjoy it once at least in the lifetime

title: A memorable spiritual experience
review: Our first experience of the Ganga Aarti - and what a pleasant & memorable one!! It started with a long, peaceful walk along the quietly flowing Ganga - and when we arrived at the Triveni Ghat, we were guided by helpful staff to vantage seats from where the entire Ganga Aarti ritual was visible.

title: Not be missed
review: Harmonious and spectacular. Can participate from a distance and dose not cost much.

title: Devine Experience
review: I stayed in Rishikesh for three days and you can see it every day.

title: not so great
review: atleast where we saw, the arati was very much filmi style. orchested. However Ganga river is superb. it is great pleasure to sit along the bank just watching river flow.

title: Beautiful place where you can take a bath
review: One of the main attractions of Rishikesh. It is quite close to the ISBT Terminus. I rented a bike to reach here. Bikes are the best mode of transport here especially around Laxman Jhula because there are long traffic jams. There is ample parking space near the ghat. Water is cold even in summer. The water flows with quite some force so be careful. There are chains attached to the stairs which you can grab while taking a bath so you are not swept away.

title: The most serene experience!
review: It will fill you with so much of positive energy and hope. I recommend everyone to definitely attend Ganga Aarti here and have an experience of a lifetime.

title: In completion
review: A visual treat not just for sacred reasons but it's the overall ambience created by sunset and its reflection at sunset which enticed me to it..

title: Serene and Spiritual
review: Visited for the Ganga Arti with my colleagues visiting from abroad, was such a serene and spiritual experience for all, that it's worth a visit to any one travelling on the area,

title: Nice place to bath
review: The flow of the water was not very speed and the depth was upto the stomach. Kids were also bathing. Ramayan path was going on in the bank.

title: Good one
review: Nice set up done by team recently becoming the center of attraction at rishikesh. Good job! Sound quality and artist need to work on rest is fine. Have a ample space for people to sit out and enjiy evening.

title: Serene Experience
review: A soulful serene experience, the surrounding just bring inner peace in you, sitting out there & just see the ganga flow & the aarti being performed, The singes & musicians performing out there are just outstanding.

title: Ganga Arti
review: A must watch thing if you are visiting Rishikesh. Evening time is aroud 7pm. Try to reach atleast 1 hr prior. Enjoy bathing at ghat which is quite peaceful and clean and then join Arti. Parking issues are there because of space.

title: Ganga Arti
review: Good and peaceful ghat, not crowded. Should be visited at least once. And don't miss Ganga Arti at 7pm. There are parking issues near the ghat, not much space.

title: No to be missed
review: Amazing sights and sounds to behold.  The evening Aarti was beyond amazing and so beautiful.  We took advantage of a boat ride for the evening Aarti and it was a great way to see the ceremony.

title: Amazing!
review: From rishikesh we took a tuc tuc till Triveni Market (ask before to someone in your hotel/ashram for the right price or they will charge you at least double...). The cerimony was stunning... beautiful! Dont miss it

title: Ganga Aarti
review: This is the best place to relax in Rishikesh. You feel very peaceful and can spend hours sitting here quietly. This is one of the few Ganga Ghat which are still not commercialized.

title: Wonderful  Experience
review: We reached around 6.50 pm at Triveni Ghat.Already many people were assembled for aarti.The whole event was memerising with ganga flowing next to you,vedic mantra chanting followed by aarti.A must see attraction for all.

title: Must do in Rishikesh
review: Even if you are not spiritual inclined, try and attend the ganga aarti at Triveni Ghat. Just sitting on the ghat stairs and listening to the chants gives a sense of peace. Also walk on the promenade by the side of the ghat. An important thing is that trust asks for donation for the arti and they may say that give 500 or 1000 Rs. however it is completely upto you how much you want to donate, you can give lesser amount 50/100 also

title: good but full of beggers
review: This is the place where one will love to visit but beggars and crowed will demotivate you. govt should take some steps

title: Littering spoils the beauty
review: Although this place is very beautiful and calm, the littering caused by the people spoils one's mood. Although I personally find Rishikesh far cleaner than Haridwar, still there is a lot of scope for improvement. No littering should be strictly followed at places like these.

title: A Must Visit while in Rishikesh
review: A Must Visit while you visit Rishikesh . This Place is very well maintained . Its Neat and clean . The Aarti Happens daily during sun set so dont miss the Aarti . If you are lucky you can spot Deers and Elephants in the other side of River

title: Best Ghat in Rishikesh for Ganga bath
review: Our hotel recommended to go to Triveni Ghat for Ganga bath in the morning. The ghat was clean and not crowded at all. I found parking too at the ghat itself. Overall enjoyed taking bath here.

title: Peaceful
review: The best part is it is not crowded. You get your own time and space to perform the aarti with a Punditji.

title: Disappointment
review: The aarti was good & in time, not too many people around, gradually there was few hundreds only. Mostly locals & few tourists, the sad part is that the ghat has so much filth around & Ganga has gone far from the cemented ghat, we need to divert the flow of water towards the ghat because of so many elderly people find difficulty in reaching the spot.

title: DO NOT MISS THIS!
review: If you are in Rishikesh - DO NOT MISS THIS! We had the opportunity to actually perform a pooja (for only 300 rupees) before the Aarti. Such a beautiful ceremony and one that will be forever memorable in our minds and hearts.

title: Satisfying and peaceful Ganga Aarati
review: Triveni Ghat is an excellent place to visit in the evening. You have to leave your car in the main road and the Ghat is just 5-6 minutes walk from there. Its a very spacious an dclean place with several temples and wonderful statues of Krishnarjun and Harparvati. There is a nice statue of G D Birla who made this ghat. Normally in any Ganga ghat you are scared of getting lost in a huge crowd and not getting a suitable place to sit or stand. Triveni ghat is a pleasant surprise. There are many rows of long staircases and they arrange carpets to put on alternate stairs, on which a huge number of people can comfortably sit for hours and witness and take photos of Aarti. Part of the place is also well covered for rains, and those who are taking bath, why should they be bothered of rains ?

title: Ganga Arti
review: Ganga Arti was very well managed. Ghat was not overcrowded. You should have your own vehicle to reach the place. One should must visit.

title: Divine
review: just one word describes the aarti experience at Shatrughan Ghat at Rishikesh. "DIVINE"  the priest were so systematic in the entire aarti, that it becomes one of the most memorable event in my life

title: Serene
review: We attended evening Arti. The combination of river and hills forming the backdrop is serene. One can actually perform puja and Arti along with priests on donating Rs 300. The glow of lamps reflecting on river during dusk looks beautiful.. it's moderately crowded on weekends which is when we attended.

title: REALLY SPECTABLE
review: I visited the place for the first time and joined the Aarti.We really go deep there and find ourself very near to MAA GANGA and God.The arrangements were fine.Think to visit & join  again.

title: Nice place for evening hangout
review: This ghat is near to the Rishikesh bust stand, situated right after the market. One can go there to spend evening or for a divine bath in The Gannga. In evening there is daily aarti at 7 pm which is a pleasure to watch.Also, there is marine drive alongside the Ganga river where you can walk and refresh yourself.

title: very nive experience
review: Ganga arti at Triveni ghat is a must watch thing. Clean ghat to spend your time. Lightings are good..Have dinner in the market once coming back...Good place

title: Beautiful experience
review: This was our first experience to witness Ganga Aarti. It's a unique experience . Since Triveni Ghat is close to Hotel Ganga Kinara, we got an opportunity to be part of this holy event. The whole experience was very nice.

title: Enjoy the Well Practiced Arti Show
review: I gone their in evening as I heard a lot about Triveni Ghat Arti and I was not Disappointed. It was really Good 15 Min Arti. One thing I found really bad here ( Which is not the case in Parmarth where we feel Involvement) is the Paid Arti arrangement. You pay more and you get the privilege to do Arti with main Pundits. There was a proper announcements of those who were paying and announcer was Saying "Inki dab manatee Ganga made poori karein" What about others who didn't Paid :)

title: Amazing experience
review: A religious activity performed every day I the evenings attracts lots of pilgrims actually it's a holy experience to participate

title: Nice view
review: Its look very pleasant in evening time at triveni ghat at time of aarti.

title: Mesmerising, beautiful and rich cultural experience
review: This has to be one of the highlights of traveling in India. I could go back all the way to watch it once more. From the looks of it, its a concerted show, but nevertheless it brings out a lot of joy just to see the priests perform on the banks of the holy river. Something that needs to be seen to be believed.

title: Fascinating as ever
review: It is fascinating to watch a less crowded version of the haridwar arti.

title: where nature meets religion
review: One can enjoy Ganga Aarti in morning and evening at very peaceful environment. Less crowded, beautiful scenery,

title: Amazing experience
review: Amazing view of ganga aarti for the travelers. you feel pure and so much postive energy comes by just standing at that place. Must go place.

title: Its quite different from Parmarth
review: It seems that the Ganga Aarti at Triveni ghat is more ancient as compared to other aartis which happen in Rishikesh. The look and feel is pretty vintage and more like the Benares aarti if you have witnessed one. Seems more collective in spirit than other options in Rishikesh.

title: Soul experience
review: This Aarti is a very meditative and spiritual experience. and being by the side of the ganga river and seeing the sunset there is priceless

title: Peace of Mind Divine
review: It is absolutely a different experience to be present at Ganga Aarti. The authentic sounds love performance of Aarti really makes you feel next to God

title: Great place for a walk by the river
review: Nice views, beautiful Hindu statues and great shops - it is a little paradise in Rishikesh suitable for a hassle free stroll.

title: Great experience
review: A must visit place. The evening was really great with all the puja and arti going on. If it is possible be there before sunset. It is one of the great time to enjoy the natural beauty (as I am not a early riser, so sun rise was not a option for me :P).

title: spiritual .........
review: we have been there one time very good place  near to market side this is more batter then haridwar ganga aarti.....

title: Awesome experience
review: One must ensure that they don not miss this experience while visiting rishikesh. One of the most beautiful experience.

title: Wonderful expereince
review: I attended the Gana aarti with family. It was wonderful experience. Best view comes from the opposite side of the river from stairs. We attended full aarti of 1.5 hours starting 6:30 pm. If you want to get good seat gather there at 5:30 pm

title: Nice experience
review: Be at the ghat by 600 pm if you want to have a good seating spot. Aarti goes on until 730 pm and is a nice event to watch...

title: Awesome peaceful place in Rishikesh, One must visit.
review: Great place with peaceful environment and great holy River Ganga . A great place to hang out with friends.

title: nice time in the evening
review: it;s extremely different if we compare rishikesh's aartri and varanasi, but it's one more interesting experience to share

title: awesome experience
review: what an experience. had only heard or aarti at haridwar but this one was so photogenic and spiritual. simply loved it.

title: Nice place for inner peace
review: Good place divine inner peace.... Mantra chanting make u so peaceful I been to Varanasi Ganga aarti but at rishikesh it's totally different...

title: The mystical rivers
review: The Triveni Ghat where the mystical rivers of Yamuna and Saraswati flow along with the mighty Ganges. A dip on this Triveni Ghat is considered very holy for the Hindus in particular but we find the foreigners also having a dip here on the hold Ganga.

title: Re-juvenated
review: The aarti was inspiring and participatory. Very inspirational setting with tranquil surroundings. Back to our roots!

title: best place to take snaan at ganga ghat
review: we were here early morning...there were only few people taking bath.No crowded place even in ardhkumbh. Changing room were available.

title: Ganga Aarti on new year
review: Visited Triveni Ghat on April 13, 2016 and had the good fortune of participating in Ganga Aarti followed by offering flowers and lamps to Ganga at no extra cost.

title: Enjoy Suhawani and Mantramugdh aarti at Gath
review: I had heard a lot about Ganga Aartis but I never lived it. Due to traffic chaos, we reached to the ghat 4-5 minutes before Aarti ended, and these 5 minutes were the spell of black magic. It spellbounded me for those 5 minutes and I was lost in the world.

title: Soulful local aarti
review: Very beautifully performed aarti by a long row of priests along the river. Only downside is there is an island just infront of the ghat which makes the view a bit less beautiful than other spots to see the aarti like Paramarth Shanti Niketan etc.

title: Great feeling but prepare for large crowds.
review: Amazing spiritual surroundings when there during Aarti (7pm) and great feeling to be present during this time. Just be warned it gets very crowded and you need to get there by 6pm to get yourself a good spot. The chants and prayers are melodic and blissful and the sights are wonderful to witness up close and personal.

title: Divine and Heavenly Atmosphere
review: The Aarti happens on the steps of Parmarth Ashram. That day when we were there, it was lead and conducted by Shri  Swami Chidanand himself.It starts around 6.30 in the evening. Prior to that there is singing of a lot of hymns and bhajans, including Hanuman Chalisa, led by the Swami, his disciples and students. The whole atmosphere is really divine. One needs to experience it to be able to understand what is divinity. This is followed by the Ganga Aarti where small and big Diyas are lit by many disciples along with the singing of the Aarti. All present on the ghats can also participate in and do the actual Aarti. Some divas are also flowed down in the Ganga river, truly a heavenly and memorable event of my life. Be on the steps around 6pm to participate in the bhajan singing, even if you do not know them, as also to get a good place.,

title: A life dream fulfilled
review: This is a wonderful place where one can experience the peace and spirituality of the Mother Ganga. The evening aarti was amazing, allowing the participation of the devotees. Would highly recommend attendance to this aarti.

title: Great spiritual experience!
review: A must for everyone visiting Rishikesh. Community worship on the banks of river Ganges was truly a spiritual experience.

title: Spectular event
review: An unforgettable and spectacular event. I rate this better than the Haridwar Aarti where crowds spoilt the personal experience.

title: Awesome
review: Fantastic experience, very sureal and peaceful, the vibrations make this an unforgettable experience, definitely a must do when visiting Rishikesh

title: Since Haridwar is so vastly populated, Triveni Ghat is a better bet to watch the Aarti
review: Most of us travel to Haridwar to watch the Ganga Aarti. But the main Haridwar Ghat is mostly so densely populated that it is a good option to visit the Triveni Ghat which gives us an amazing view of the entire experience, in a nutshell

title: best way to enjoy the sunset
review: Some crowd, good athmospere, friendy people. Quite different from the Gangar aarti at Haridwar. You should experience both!

title: Visit to Triveni Ghat for Ganga Aarti with the family
review: Mesmerizing experience!! Must visit. Very peaceful and soulful. Shinning diyas and chanting transform you into a different world which is pure, pristine.

title: Must visit
review: Ganga Aarti at Rishikesh is an experience not to be missed. It is as magical as the famous aarti of Varanasi, only the surroundings being more clean here at Rishikesh.

title: A Heavenly Experience.
review: Witnessed the Maha Aarthi on 14 April, ashtami day. It was truly amazing. Well coordinated, well conducted, with utmost divinity. Helpful and supportive volunteers, added more charm to the occasion.

title: Excellent, mesmerizing aarti
review: You will love this aarti. The ambiance here is mesmerizing. You will feel relaxing and pious at this place. I am just speechless about this place.

title: Its good but Haridwar one is better
review: Its good but the place is small and can't hold many people. Otherwise a good attraction place. Experience it to feel delighted.

title: aarti darshan and great  music concert during ganga aarti.
review: I visited this place few days back in march 2016. good gathering. nice music concert. only problem is car parking. the way to triveni ghat is crowded.

title: GREAT PLACE TO DO EVENING PRAYERS
review: Very nice experience sitting there for evening arathi(prayers)every night at around 6pm, you will find many folks gather at the banks of the ganges for the prayer services. beautiful

title: So beautiful
review: Yes it's the place for Rishis . And it's full of western yoga heads . That's not why we came . It was to be in a peZceful place . Apart from the noise of those maddening scooters on the laxman jula it was truly peaceful.  Evenings spent sitting by the Ganga watching the sun go down . Pretty beautiful and uplifting .

title: NIce
review: One of the best place & location. Activity is so awesome to have joy of chants with family & friends.

title: Excellent Our Holy River
review: very much peaceful environment when ever you visit there don't miss to watch ganga aarti near to Ram Jhula if i got a chance to spend a whole day near to ganga ghat i would love to do that

title: Holy Ganga Aarti
review: It was a nice experience while being part of Holy Ganga Aarti.  Before the Ganga Aarti, Pravachanas can be enjoyed here. One can also take a dip in holy Ganga.

title: Its a blessing
review: Its a feeling that cant be described in words,but it requires that you a some sort of belief in god else its a reduced experiences.

title: Different experience
review: Am not a great fan of aartis and temples. Went to triveni ghat just for experience. It's good orchestra feeling with flamboyance. If you are religious, you should love it more. Overall nice experience as I had not seen such massive organized aarti before. Parmarth aarti is relatively smaller and triveni aarti can be given preference over Parmarth aarti.

title: Beautiful!
review: Free (or by donation) and beautiful- a joy to watch and be apart of. Definitely join in by watching the locals and step into the river for a blessing.

title: Experience is must
review: There are some places which will be under rated if we express with words.

title: Religious and Relaxing place
review: Triveni ghat is the place where ghats are firmly made and is the safest public place to take bath in rishikesh. Also aarti of Maa Ganga is done every evening which is worth watching.

title: Don't miss it!
review: The Aarti is a lovely experience. I defy you not to join in with the singing and get caught up in the atmosphere. The ceremony was joyous and evocative with chanting, fire, flowers and everything you would expect. The friendly locals insisted with join in and we had a wonderful time. Do go along.

title: Divine & Relaxing place !!
review: The Triveni ghat is famous for the Ganga Aarti conducted every evening. The view of the diyas reflecting from the river Ganga and the sound of the mantras being chanted creates an amazing experience. It is located just opposite the Pramarth Niketan Ashram.

title: Pure divinity!
review: I agree with fellow Tripadvisors who said the experience of attending the Ganga Aarti at the Triveni Ghat can not be expressed justifiably in words! Mesmerizing and up-lifiting is how I would sum up my experience of attending the spectacle on the evening of 05th March'16 with my parents, wife, and kids.

title: Must attend
review: Attended ganga aarti when I was the part of international yoga festival just 2 days back. Divine and the best. Must visit. It is the best thing u can attend in rishikesh. Be d part of it.

title: not as grand as Varanasi but lovely
review: it is lovely to take part in it, it is smaller than Haridwar or Varanasi but still lovely to be in it.. try to get seated with the crowd and hold the Aarti flame.. amazing

title: Divine!
review: You can go there around 5pm to enjoy the beginning of the ceremonies and to get a great spot at the front of the Ganga. It is a really relaxing and mind blowing experience to assist at such a big aarti while the sunset. Don't miss it!

title: Mesmerising experience
review: Ganga Aarti depends on the time of sunset. Anywhere between 5.30p.m to 6.30 p.m . The aarti preparations are done by the Brahmins an hour before it starts and u can see people flocking around the bank of river Ganga . The Aarti goes on for around an hour or so but it is with an experience . The river Ganga is lit with thousands of Diyas ,it is simply beautiful to watch it.

title: Superb
review: Divine! Excellent Bhajan! Please do not miss the Haarathi at Triveni Ghat! Om Namashivaya! Staying in Rishikesh for a week. Will attend Haarathi everyday.

title: Amazing Arti
review: The Arti at triveni ghat has moved up top notches now ,in an affect  it's a more perfectly choreographed than it was  a few years back ,the ghats are more clean and well lighted ,the perfect time to visit is in the evening between 5.30 pm - 6.30 pm .

title: Age Old River Worship Each Evening
review: This is the most traditional river worship each evening in the old part of town. The loudspeakers are defining, and brightly lit fountains add to the festivities. The pandits can be a bit aggressive. Elephants from the National Forest across the river occasionally appear for the event.

title: Divine
review: Ganga is the most important river in our culture and ganga aarti is very important ritual. In evening the place is filled with devotees and it gives excellent experience.

title: amazing experiences
review: the ceremony taking place very day at sunset, the ghat located near the first bridge, you will hear the chanting...

title: Peaceful expereince
review: Ganga aarti of main Rishikesh town is an experience not to be missed. When we visited last year, it was a humble small affair but I believe now they have a full fledged massive ceremony each evening.

title: Amazing
review: Spent an awesome evening watching the Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat.

title: nice one
review: nice place ,must see if you in rishikesh, it start on season on feb it is started on eve 6pm . lightinig is good , good arrangments here for handle rush.

title: Serene and beautiful Ganges
review: Enjoy beautiful Ganges..unpolluted bluish green. Enjoy aarti with less crowds than Haridwar and a host of adventure sports like River rafting etc. Also enjoy temples and religious palaces dotted here and there

title: Beautiful.
review: Such a lovely experience that happens every night at the edge of the Ganga.  No matter where you are from, it is amazing to be a part of the spirituality that is woven into the fabric of the culture here.  It is a beautiful ceremony with great music.  I returned to this 3 times during my visits to Rishikesh.

title: beautiful and serene
review: a must visit for anybody going to rishikesh.The arti starts at 6 pm sharp. Even for semi believers like me, it was a delightful experience due the combination of chanting by the banks of the river and the entire atmosphere

title: Must do
review: All who pray every morning have to go for ganga arti at triveni ghat. it starts sharp at 6 & ends at 6:30.

title: Enthralling experience !!
review: A group of young priests stand up to chant the mantras for 15-20 minutes. Lovely lamps, lights & reverberations of the Vedic Chants. You can buy some floating lamps from the kids on the ghat (river banks) & see the camphor lit lamps float in ganges...

title: mesmerizing
review: Haridwar is a holy place. i always find peace whenever i sit on the ghat's. Ganga at triveni ghat was awesome.

title: Holy & Serene view of Ganga
review: I had been there a couple of times... Also went on the anv of my late cat..to pay condolence! one feels connected with the souls!

title: They shouldn't destroy Ganga on the name of Arti
review: It is indeed a divine experience by all standards, but they shouldn't really do that everyday and pollute the river.

title: Not to be missed
review: Let's face it, if you are going to Rishikesh you must have some interest in yoga and spiritual things. The nightly Aarti Puja to Lord Shiva is beautiful.

title: Ecstatic!!
review: we did the aarti ourselves which needs a booking worth Rs 300 done half hour prior. it was an experience worth everything. truly mesmerising

title: Great place
review: Although i didn't have the chance for the arti in this place, but i did go for a visit to this place. Its really peaceful and soothing over here. Some drivers would say you that there is nothing special in this place to visit, but actually there is some clash between the local drivers in Rishikesh, so they say so. So, its up to you to choose a local driver who can take you to visit all the places of prominence when you are in Rishikesh. My hotel staff arranged for me the car with a local driver.

title: Beautiful experience
review: One of the most beautiful experiences in rishikesh.

title: nice place and good crowd in evening
review: Triveni ghat is near rishikesh city, it is a very good place to see aarti in the evening and their is also a market to purchase nice household items and clothes and famous sweet stores also their

title: Magical moment
review: Every day evening, they traditionally perform it. Not yet commercialized. Lot of bhajan/keertan are sung during this time. Every body is given aarti at free of cost to perform this pooja.

title: Holy place
review: We saw Ganga aarti at this place in the evening, a magical moment of my life. Very traditional, not yet commercialized.

title: Mesmerizing Evening
review: A long fully devotional aarti at Triveni .One must surely visit in the evening, take holy dip in the Ganges and witness the long prayers and aarti. Carry cloths and use the changing rooms available if you want. Very clean ghat overall

title: devotive to god
review: felling good after pooja & aarti & there after enjoy the shopping on the triveni ghat very best & chesp cost

title: great!!
review: great place to visit. visited with my family.. food nearby is cheap but not hygienic..amzaing especially in evening.

title: Magical experience
review: For me it was a highly spiritual experience. It felt elated and emotional. The Bhajan sang  by Chidanand swamiji touched my heart. I didn't realise that I was crying. I felt so good that even after several hours I was immersed in my experience of being at the place.

title: Magnificent.. One Should reach here by 5 PM for evening aarti...
review: Must see for 2-3 times before understanding a part of it... For people with no knowledge of this practise must speak to the head priest well before the aarti..

title: Sights and sound of India
review: A mind blowing experience of the spiritual Hindu Aarti ,salutations to the Lord, performed between 5.30-6 pm.Be there ahead of time to see this amazing ritual being performed.You can simply shut your eyes and feel the magic of this place carry your mind to a different level.Mid/month of January is an excellent time to visit Rishikesh, less crowded.

title: Mesmerizing Experience
review: Rishikesh is a beautiful place with amazing views. It feels so close to nature and if you love hills and mountains you will love this place.

title: Ganges! Aarti at Rishikesh
review: Pravachans are always on at this site before the Ganges aarti in the evening. one can take a holy dip also.

title: Arti on the first day of the year 2016
review: It was a peaceful experience and also was unique one.... The year has started with this experience and it actually strengthened the faith and the bond between the giver (god) and the receiver (me).

title: Good view of river Ganga under Aarti
review: Very exciting to see the all the foreigners also equally offering prayers during the Ganga Aarti. A must event to watch when you are visiting Rishikesh or Haridwar.

title: Homage to the Ganges
review: The Ganges can be experienced in all its serenity at Rishikesh, so this is an experience not to be missed, The guides here are honest and will guide you to less crowed spots, where you can be relatively on your own, sinking in the tranquility of the flowing waters.

title: A Divine location for Aarti
review: We offered Aarti at Triveni ghat on 29 December 2015 in a serene surrounding .Triveni Ghat is very spacious, clean and well maintained and managed and comparatively much less crowded than Haridwar.One can offer prayers and Aarti at peace.

title: peaceful
review: very peaceful.  u will love this place during aarti.  u can go to aarti one by one and u will love the location.

title: Great Experience
review: It was a great experience. Ideal time to reach there is before sunset to see the complete rituals and aarti. You can check the timing from anyone. It is part of life in Rishikesh and every one knows all details.

title: Blissful Sojourn
review: It was such a peaceful yet an energetic experience to be there for Ganga Aarti @Triveni Ghat-Rishikesh. Far more soulful than Ganga Aarti @Harki Paudi-Haridwar, which is crowded with fleecing pandits at your neck always.

title: Beautiful ceremony on the Ganga
review: A very inspirational ceremony performed nightly on the river.  Everyone has the opportunity to see well as sitting down is mandatory and enforced.  Many venders selling flowers for the Aart.

title: Spiritual experience
review: It was a highly spiritual experience to attend Ganga arti. The bhajans and Hanuman Chalisa before arti were nice. Overall, a divine experience.

title: beautiful experience, though it could be better
review: Maybe I visited at the wrong time, someone had booked the place for a private aarti. There were many tourists there but it wasnt as grand as expected. Anyhow, the river, hills, flames and the chanting all added up to a wonderful experience.

title: Amazing Aarti Experience
review: Triveni Ghat is a sacred ghat where three holy rivers the Ganga, the Yamuna and the Saraswathy confluence. The main attraction is the evening "Maha Aarti" which performs every day. Compared to Haridwar this place is calm and not much crowded.

title: Peaceful...
review: Probably one of my reasons to visit rishikesh was to see the ganga Aarti.. Performed everyday at 5 in the evening it echoes all throughout the valley...

title: Very good Aarti.
review: When visiting Rishikesh, you must not miss the Aarti at Triveni Ghat. Here you can experience the Aarti peacefully, unlike Haridwar where the crowd is tooooo much & that place has become very commercial.

title: Amazing view
review: it was very unique to see 3 rivers meet .. i have traveled across 3 continents... but such unique view is only possible at triveni ghat ... i was luck to be in this combo water ...

title: very good
review: you feel it you injoy it eveing time 6 pm arti time just go and injoy it realy you feel peace and greatful exprincss

title: Place to see best Ganga Aarti in India
review: I have Ganga Aarti at various places in India  -   Varanasi, Allahabad & Haridwar and I have to see that what we see here was the best one can see. It was a joy to see young Pandas takinging part in the Aarti, use of Electronic techlogy & sound system, special arrangement for visitors from abroad and in general, very disciplined, well organised event. My family were seated with foreign visitors and we had the best view of the Aarti. There was no Panda trying to hassel us, which I found a great change. There was a sponsore Havan before the Aarti and the music was as if we were watching a Bollywood film. My whole family enjoyed it, my sister insisted that my grand daughters floated a Diva in the river and also wash their fett and face with holy Ganga water from the river. It was one of the best expereince of Hindu rituals that I loved, normally greedy Pandas ruin everything.

title: Blissful experience
review: Though I am not religious type,but arti at triveni ghat  is a very good experience better than at har ki pauri which I saw next day.no pandas to disturb you ,nobody forces u for donations ,the arti leaves u mesmerized.all 5 elements of nature in there most beautiful form viz space ,water earth,air and fire

title: Authentic Ganga Aarti
review: Visit Triveni Ghat to see an authentic aarti rather than the very touristy one at Parmarth Niketan (although I liked that one also).

title: divine feeling of ganga aarti at triveni ghat
review: the aarti starts around 5:45pm in winters..the total experience beautiful and one gets soaked in the aarti which is performed by pandits standing on elevated tables with custom attire and holding the divine flame..

title: a very different musical aarti
review: unlike other ganaga aarti, this aarti is with music and you can sit on the steps of ganga and watch it close by. should not miss this one

title: An amazing experience!
review: This was an incredible ceremony to witness!  Take the boat across and head over to the temple for the start of the ceremony at dusk.

title: Serene
review: An Aarti, is an Arti! however what differentiates one place from the other is the local flavor. This beauty of this place is the background that its offered by the flowing water of the river(which one may get to see but not enough to experience at other places). The way people come together also adds to the grace that the place offers. I would recommend thisplace to all travelers

title: Ganga-Yamuna-Saraswati Sangham
review: This point id sangham of three important rivers namely Ganga, Yamuna and Saraswati. People do perform pooja on the ghat and give a spiritual feel altogether.

title: Neat & Clean
review: neat & clean ghat makes the aarti and surroundings picturesque. the organizers also make it a point to remind people to keep the ghat clean. Hope we get more sensible tourists here so that the ghat stays clean forever.

title: Blessed experience
review: This blessed aarti is highly recommended to get an feel for what a smaller, local aarti is like. Beautiful energy I won't soon forget.

title: Great experience at triveni ghat
review: Great to sit and listen to bhajans and absorb the evening ceremony with a cup of chai, watching flower and flames float down the Ganga.

title: evening arati is a must
review: the most beautiful evening arati at the ghat - 5 youngsters perform the main arati - it is perfectly co-ordinated and magical

title: Such a serene place to visit.
review: I super love the place, so divine and so reverberating! This is a must visit for anyone traveling up north!

title: Organized Aarti at Sunset attracts Tourists to this place
review: The priests or the Ganga Trust as they call have made a structured process for the aarti at the time of sunset every evening. I could witness some good chanting of the mantras and several foreigners gathered for the show. While the chief priest made everybody present there, take a wow that we won't pollute the Ganga, what astonished me was the fact that minutes later, they were seen emptying cans of milk and flower garlands into the river as part of their prayer! Several devotees light up lamps and let them float on the river as part of some ritual...wonder if all this is required.

title: must see
review: its a great experience and whenever I visit Rishikesh, I make it a point to attend Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat

title: Ganga aarti at 6 PM
review: Awsome experience of ganga aarti at rishikesh.

title: Uninspiring
review: Having seen other river Aratis, this Arati paled in comparison. No proper seating. Ganga was just a small stream at Trivent Ghat

title: Must to attend once in lifetime..
review: Amazing early morning experience... Just stay away from the pundits there trying to lure you to perform some Puja, unless you need one.. :-)

title: Very good when in rishikesh
review: Triveni ghat aarti is one of the major attractions in Rishikesh. The Ghat is less crowded as compared to the ones in Haridwar. But one way to reach the Ghat is tougher than the other. So I will suggest to take the other route through which one can reach the Ghat through their vehicles. The other route is through a long stairs way which can be difficult for elders. The flow in the holy river Ganges is very little in winters. Best time to come in the months of summer. A great market near the Ghat gives ample opportunity to shop. As it is less crowded, one can sit here and relax after the aarti and feel the divine.

title: Soothing & Peaceful !!!!!!!!!!!
review: As i am born and bought here, AArti at triveni ghat is one place here is rishikesh where mind attend peace, by chanting words from priests everyday .

title: Spiritual experience
review: This was something I've had no experience in, as a foreigner, but my friend took me and showed me what to do. We listened to speeches and songs and passed around a prayer candle , then lit a bowl of flowers( Diya) to place in the Ganga to worship. Then another ritual of placing flowers on the shiva statue. We both had such an emotional experience. It's such a sense of belonging , and community. I was touched

title: A much smaller crowd & hence you get to truly experience the Arti in it's pure form !
review: The Triveni ghat was very close to the Elbee Ganga view & hence experienced it twice in 2 years. The first time was in Dec 2014 and it was my first ever Ganga arti. The beautiful experience can't be described it in words. Later we went to the much bigger one near the Laxman Jhula but it was nothing like this. Too much crowds & just too much noise there !!

title: real aarti experience
review: triveni ghat is the best place where anybody can feel real spirit of ganga aarti. this is a very less crowded place than haridwar and can have a real Indian spiritual experience.

title: great experience
review: triveni sangam ghat is the best place where anybody can feel real spirit of ganga aarti. this is a very less crowded place than haridwar and can have a real Indian spiritual experience.

title: Triveni ghat
review: This is supposed to be a very important point like sangam where 3 holy  rivers meet .ganga , jamuna and saraswati.  So it is called  triveni ghat . Most of the people want to take a dip at this point in Ganga to wash away all their sins .but after sunset  the aarti which which takes place here is a sight to behold .

title: Ganga aarti
review: This is very pleasant to see the Ganga aarti at thrive ghat .i had only seen in movies . But when I saw in real I really liked it . It is beautiful to see so many divas floating in the Ganges . A must . Plan your tripe in such a way that u get to see this aarti.

title: Best traditional Aarti
review: I have attended several Aartis in Rishikesh including the one at Parmath Niketan, but if you want to attend a beautiful authentic Aarti, then the Aarti at Triveni is the best one to go to. The river is less crowded at this location and the evening puja is beautiful

title: Calm and rhythmic
review: The music and lighting will let u flow like water with the cold and peaceful environment. If u want to hear the sanskrit shlokas and god songs this is a right place to make a visit.

title: Arti
review: Wow what an awesome experience . Will definetly be back soon..

title: Best aarti of ganges
review: Nice place specially for elderly ppl believing in god. Nice view claen and maintained. A must visit in rishikesh.

title: Triveni Ghat aarti

title: Incredible Haridwar Visit
review: Rishikesh - also known as the 'place of sages', at the confluence of the Chandrabhaga and Ganga. It is believed that God by the name of 'Hrishikesh' had appeared as an answer to the hard penances by Rabhiya Rishi and henceforth the place derived its name. It is the starting point for the Char dham pilgrims but also for the people who are interested in meditation, yoga and other aspects of Hinduism. In Rishikesh visit Laxman Jhula- a hanging bridge on the river Ganga is one of the most famous spot in Rishikesh. According to Indian mythology, Lakshman, the younger brother of Lord Rama crossed the Ganga with the help of hanging bridge made of Jute. The bridge offers a scenic view of the river Ganga as it tumbles down to Haridwar. Also visit Bharat Mandir - the oldest temple in Rishikesh, near the Triveni Ghat. This temple is dedicated to Bharat, the younger brother of Lord Ram. Optional activities -White water rafting.
