review: This place is a like a mini version of Ganga Arti that happens at Haridwar. Not as crowded (or commercial) as Haridwar one, this place has a feel good factor.

title: Enchanting
review: I was expecting to a see a Filmy sequence of aarti at the ganga ghat. Like the ones they show in the movie 'Devdas'. But I was fortunate that it was not that way. I was fortunate to be here at the Triveni Ghat. I was at peace at the banks of river ganga.

title: Excellent Place to take a holy dip
review: Ganges at full speed there. Not deep, so u can have a holy dip peacefully. Have a heavenly experience taking a holy bath there

title: Most nonspiritual
review: An obnoxious person Dikshit was leading the prayers here and made this a most nonspiritual and upsetting experience.  The general conduct was also very commercialized and mediocre.

title: Aarti at  Parmarth niketan
review: I had the opportunity to witness the Grand Aarti of Ganga at Parmarth Niketan premises.  I am not sure whether this Triveni ghat is the same.  The premises is brilliantly maintained and is very scenic.Go for it.

title: Great ambience
review: Triveni Ghat is a holy place in Rishikesh which is located at the confluence of Ganga, Yamuna and mythical Saraswati rivers. The ghat is well maintained and ambience is great. Nice place to walk around enjoying the cool breeze and surroundings. The ghat is very popular for ganga aarti in evening. The lane leading to the ghat is narrow though and market area.

title: Memorable Experience
review: Evening aarti ar famous Triveni Ghat in Rishikesh is a memorable experience. The Ghat is spacious where we sat and enjoyed the aarti before river Ganges. One can buy flower diyas and light them after the aarti and release them in river Ganges. Ambience was very nice.

title: venerable and authentic Hindu India
review: Easily accessible from old Rishikesh town....long walks along well paved Ganges ghat areas.....a bit too  hot during day so bring hat...amazing huge painted statuary of the Hindu pantheon of gods and goddesses..huge market nearby

title: It was interesting..
review: It was interesting to see and hear Ganga Aarti. Music, vibe, people. We are not hindus so we were just enjoying and experiencing something different, which was cool because you could see the happiness of other people, you could feel it in the air. In the end we even touched the fire and "washed" our face with it... Surely, this was something really nice and we liked it.

title: Triveni ghat
review: Triveni ghat of Rishikesh is very popular for ganga aarti in evening.This place is always crowded because of the markets nearby.Cleaningness is the only problem.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: It is really new experience to see so many people offering aarthi to Ganga, if you wish you can also participate. With synchronized bell sounds, veda mantras and synchronized aarthi plated movement, you really forget all your tensions for that duration.

title: Just about ...
review: Though the scenery is great the aarti is average. The music could be far better. Triveni Ghat is a nice walk - though still a bit dirty.

title: A tribute to maa Ganga!
review: It happens everyday. And it is magical everyday! The entire atmosphere - of people dressed in white / saffron, indians, foreigners- all together singing and praising maa Ganga- taking an oath to keep her clean! Listening to the aarti, with my feet immersed in the cold waters of the Ganga, I was literally in a trance- such is the effect of the aarti. It is a must attend if in Rishikesh! Please do not miss it.

title: Ganga Aarti at Rishikesh...less crowd than Haridwar.
review: During winters pl make yourselves avaiable at 16:30 to witness the Ganga Aarti in peace and tranquility.

title: A colourful and enchanting experience
review: We were present on ghat for Aarti on a chilly december 2014 evening and were delighted to see head priest coming forward that day for the aarti. Devotional songs(Bhajans) with melodious music played for half an hour with every one singing along. Monks or young students of the Gurukul adorning single colour (Saffron) clothes were making the atmosphere more pious. An experience which left us warm with cultural heritage on a chilly winter evening.

title: Jai Gange Mata....
review: A feeling of heaven in earth. The ambience,  the chanting of hymns, the colourful crowd, the lighted lamps floating on the Ganges river.....everything is just awesome. An experience of a lifetime indeed !

title: a very soothing & a divine experience in the ghat
review: We went in the evening .Very Peaceful Divine &  experience in the ghat during the aarti.  It is much better than the Ganga  Aarti  at Haridwar  which is  very commercial .

title: Aarti not to miss
review: Lovely to watch all the people and sit at the rivers edge as many candles and flowers floated by. Music was playing and the sunset was fantastic.

title: Overwhelming experience with a beautiful sunset
review: What an amazing experience, us set over the Ganges, with the beautiful voices during the Arthi. Highly recommend a visit to this lovely, holy city. A melting pot of spirituality, youths searching side by side with the wisdom of age. And of course, a dinner at The Budda Cafe on the water.

title: Not as spectacular
review: I had read that the evening Aarti at Benares and Haridwar are the spectacular ones, and felt the info to be absolutely true after seeing the small-scale affair here.

title: Mesmerizing
review: This is the main attraction of Rishikesh, do not miss the Aarti. It starts at around 5pm and lasts for an hour. Ganga Arti is the last part of the 1-1.5 hrs of programme.

title: Goose Bumps
review: This place is an experience, the whole setup in natures arms, the blend of earth, water, sun, sky, fire at about sunset with chants of aarti echoing. This is closest one can be to nature and god.

title: Amazing
review: great aarti experience.. A little small affair though. The feel of the whole place was mesmerising .....................

title: Too commercialised for me.
review: Beautiful setting as the sun goes down and lovely chanting/singing but for me it was just too commercial with western novices being allowed to partake in very holy hindu services. Good photo opportunity but not spiritually uplifting.

title: Amazing experience!
review: I attended the Aarti while staying at the Tree of Life Himalayan Hideaway outside of Rishikesh. It was an incredible experience and worth seeing if you are staying in the area.

title: Aarati at sunset:
review: A rare, beautiful experience of the spiritual kind, take the boat over to the other side for the open air evening service.

title: Mystic experience
review: The prayers offered to river Ganges created spiritual environment. The evening arti made us feel very elated and lifted up our spirits.

title: WoW
review: Experience is just out of world.

title: puja
review: triveni ghat is the bst place to walk.there is a marine drive on shore of the the ganga.its a long path starts fron ganga bairaj to ram jhula.and on the path u will also get eatable like papad,chana, corn etc.

title: divine place
review: This place is some 5 km from laxman jhulla, here you can attain aarti in the morning and evening, this place is huge and can accommodate many people comfortably, here the flow of ganga water is quite heavy, the water flows from three different directions hence the name triveni ghat, in the evening lots of people attain this aarti before sunset, and near to this place you can do shopping for cloths as there is a very big market in this area..

title: Bliss and full of energy
review: Its full of energu and a gret place to be in. one musy go . u can c a good croup praying in the eveng when its dark around.u can only c a yello light wishing and praying with manjira and dhol. I was simply amazzised with the it

title: Fabulous atmosphere
review: Loved the atmosphere at a holy time.

title: peaceful
review: Unlike other religious places, rishikesh a class apart. No touts or agents or seller to harass you at the doorstep of any temple. Of course there are sellers and guides but their approach is unobtrusive. Evening puja st triveni ghat is a soothing experience simply sit on the ghat and watch ganga flowing. From triveni ghat there is a about 2 kms pedestrian road along the ganga. Strolling on this road is quite amazing particularly in the morning or evening.

title: A spiritual experience
review: Rishikesh Ganga Aarti is not as famous as the Haridwar one but a good experience. They sing very good bhajans and on the whole the Aarti leaves us feeling peaceful. It's interesting to see people from across the world participating in it with full devotion. Good way to spend the evening.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: Ganga aarti is similar to what it is being done at Varanasi Ganga  Ghat . But is is much different in totality as other side of ganges is clean and the place is some what separate from the city.

title: Aarthi at Ganga
review: The Aarthi was good but didnt expect that a recorded song would be played. We have been there for ealry morning aarthi. It was peaceful without any rush. Heard the aarthis in the evening are very rush. so plan accordingly!

title: Spiritual Experince
review: Ganges Aarti in my one of the Best Experience of my tour ... Calm , Not very Crowed like Haridwar Aarti as more comfortable and more place to stand .....

title: fantastic
review: Huge and it was karva chauth... So the crowd was astounding and beautiful. The ganga banks are very well made up and a walkway is beaitiful.

title: ritualistic
review: something beautiful, mesmerising and enchanting. Just that u must take ur seat in advance if u really wanna soak in the show

title: Lovely group aarti
review: These evening aartis at the banks of the Ganga shouldn't be missed. My body and mind are becoming quieted as I recall the images of the pandits performing these sacred rites in this very holy place. So deep and special. Ann G.

title: Aarti celebration gifts
review: Participating in the aarti on the very banks of the Ganga, I bliss out with the memories, visions of the crowds, familiar and not familiar, absorbed in the ceremony, wafts of smoke and incense, the sound of the river flowing in the background, reminder of the ever-flow of time seeming to pass us by like the river current, we, untouched, witnessing the ancient ceremony giving gratitude to God.  Ann G.

title: Peaceful & pure
review: A must for all the travellers, you get involved in such a way that you hardly know when the Aarti is over, serene, pure and peaceful

title: SERINE AND SPIRITUAL
review: It is a must for all visitors to participate in this daily prayer held on the bank of the Ganga river It does not matter to which religion you belong to .... as this is something beyond religious beliefs. We were very lucky to get seated right in front on the lowest steps of the Ghat on the river bank. The hyms being chanted and sung gets to you and you become mesmerised and completely overcome with emotions of serene calm and peace. We were also blessed when we were handed the lighted Aarti to perform the ritual to Ma Ganga for her blessings at the end of the singing of the hyms. An awesome experience which I will never forget for the rest of my life.

title: Beautiful and mind soothing
review: Roads nearby are not so clean and surrounded by cows and street dogs.But, otherwise, the environment at the time of Ganga Aarti is just too good.

title: Just had a Visit
review: 1. We just had a Visit,

title: LONG GHAT-GOOD FOR BATHING
review: Aarti here is good,not as great as compares to the other famous aartis(HAR KI PAUDI AND PARMARTH AARTI).

title: Must See
review: It was not like what I have seen 23 years back but it has got the same feel and respect amongst the people who visit for ganga aarti, the best thing is the lady lead singer and other two key singers along with dozens of people who join them, creates a different world, I wish that they can chant the mantras and bhajans longer what normally the time they spent doing the Aarti.

title: An unbelievable spiritual experience
review: To be one with HOM, for a short while. Please attend the Ganga Aarti at 6.00 PM. Conducted with great discipline and vigour, what you witness transforms your mind and senses into different world altogether. It's unforgettable. Do not miss it for anything in this world.

title: Mental Peace..!!
review: Went with my friends in the  month of august. Its a beautifull long ghat. The water was not vibrant and the view of the evening aarti was mesmerising. The lights of diyas in the darkness of clouds will make you feel blessed.

title: Ganga Aarti
review: Ganga Aarti occur twice daily. Morning and evening. I like evening aarti most as you can see so many floating diyas on holy river ganga. Har ki pauri in haridwar is famous for ganga aarti.

title: Good Aarti
review: Parmarth Niketan conducts the aarti every evening at 6:30 pm. Be there at least an hour before, if you want to witness it, as the venue gets too crowded.

title: A must visit
review: Very well laid out with beautiful statues of Krishna & Arjun on a chariot and Shivji accepting Ganga in his hair.

title: Incomplete trip of rishikesh without visiting Triveni Ghat
review: Triveni Ghat provides a beautiful view of river Ganga and mountains. Sculpture of Lord Shiva with Ma Parwati is one of the best sculpture on Ghat. If fountain is working of the sculpture then you can see the water coming out from hair of Lord Shiva. Ghat has another sculpture of “Krishan and Arun” on chariot and a sculpture of ‘Ma Ganga’. There is also a Marine Drive on Triveni Gath which is good for walking. You can sit on the chairs on Marine Drive in the evening and can enjoy the view.

title: ganga aarti by patanjali aashram
review: The best Ganga aarti i have seen was at the patanjali aashram in rishikesh. situated at the ram jhula you can reach the ashram by crossing the ganges in a motor boat till 7 pm or walk across the ram jhula and then to the aashram. The aarti begins at 6.30pm with chanting of bhajans and hanuman chalisa followwed by the aaarti itself where diyas are lit and aarti is performed. Being there surrounded by the lower himalayan mountains and flowing ganga makes the experience all the more fruitfull. we reached early to take a dip in the ganges. The flow is fast and caution while bathing is recomended. The water is cold but refreshing the moment you start taking dips.

title: Simply Superb !!!!
review: Lots of people flock to Triveni Ghat for evening Aarti..Whole atmosphere infuse new energy...a must visit for everyone

title: Great view, charged atmosphere
review: Huge crowd & foreigners & thier tourist assistants are what i disliked

title: bliss
review: We sat very near to the arati premises, place is called paramarth niketan ashram. We will get to see great view of mountains and the river flowing. Governor visited on that day, there were bhajans sung by 30 people in chorus, it was a great treat to the senses and soulful experience. The aarti lasts for one hour.

title: Divine experience
review: Its a very nice experience to be On Ganga Aarti, it begins at a fix time, and at a nominal price, you can book an Aarti and will perform small pooja and Aarti afterwards

title: aweome !
review: Please go to Triveni ghat for the arti . Your rishikesh trip is incomplete without this. Very organized - there is payment system if you want a special prayer in the enclosed area near the river. It is not commercial at all and very serene !

title: Wnoderful experience of the divine Aarti
review: One must see the Aarti which gives inner peace and makes soul feel light.

title: Enjoy the holy bath in shallow water.
review: You can enjoy the holy bath in the Triveni Ghat as it is not much deep but the speed of the stream is quite high.

title: Very nice
review: You feel like in a different world while at Aarti. Really nice and memorable experience. A must visit and cant miss attending this event.

title: holey Ganga
review: its a traditional indian belive they make fire to take care of Ganga,i t was nice, when the weather is getting dark ariund 7 oclock yiu can see arti near Ganga

title: Enchanting
review: Close up is too cluttered though religious.Difficult to get close during weekends evening.However,visit to other ghats also pays Dividends.Surpised to see LAKSHMAN jHULA suspended bridge.Actually shakes when u walk & gives scare factor.but bikes crossing & pushing tourists creates mess..this is India

title: indulge in pure ganga fever
review: amazing experience sitting on the banks of ganga during aarti at parmarth ashram..the bhajans and hanuman chalisa will make u feel in love with the surroundings..Go around 4:30 to get place in front for the best experience..

title: Brilliant Clean Water
review: Clean water and ghat. Not much of crowd too. If you are planning to take a dive, this is an idle place

title: Good place to visit in rishikesh
review: i use to go there often and i swim there as and when get time. it is good place to visit and have some quality time sun set is beautiful.

title: invoke the god's .  do your bit for peace.
review: if you visit rishikesh , must attend the aarti and feel the strong human emotion of collective spirituality and call for peace . go for the  experience, whether a believer or not.

title: Calming your spirits
review: I am not a very hardcore religious kind of a person, I was basically in rishikesh for the rafting experience; my friend asked around regarding what else is a must do in the area and people suggested Ganga Aarti so we went there post our rafting. The aarti starts around 7ish in the evening near Ram Jhoola. We reached there right at the start of the procession.

title: so much color and life
review: took a boat ride to explore the place. There is so much going on these banks that you need your own pace and share of able guide to understand and learn what goes around as custom here. The place is good enough to be visited in the early morning hours to see it with less chaos and crowd. Lots of sages, animals, bathers and cremation all on one platform

title: Light festival in the Eve
review: The Arti is traditional worship in the evening, people put little earthen lamps in the river, the look very beautiful floating in a row. You have to be their before six PM to enjoy the sight.

title: Sans Words
review: I've been living in Rishikesh from past 12 years and this is one thing which I like the most about this place. We used to go to ghat everynow and then buying the flowers and diyas to offer too Maa Ganga :)

title: An absolutely serene ghat that gives me out of world pleasure
review: This is a regular ghat at Rishikesh, but I feel very good while sitting here and watching clear waters of Ganga. I can sit here for long in the morning hours and would also wish that this place always remains the same. .. .

title: serene
review: it was crowded but still was nice,...the aarti began around 6.30 7...it was amazing to see so many people gathering for the praise of the holy Ganges. It is truly one of the most amazing Ganga ghats. although the disappointment was the lack of restrooms in the area.

title: Divine
review: There are times in your hectic lifestyle to stop and think , where you are going. Just felt this way sitting on the banks of Ganga listening to the bhajans and experiencing the Ganga Aarthi

title: A PLACE WORTH SEEING
review: I went with my family many times on this Ghat . This Ghat is at the banks of river Ganga. One can bath in the natural river and even meditate as the Ghat is surrounded by Natural beauty like Hills and you can see the Raja Ji NAtional Park on the other side of the River Ganga.

title: Divine experience
review: The Ganga Aarti is a must to attend, when we visit rishikesh. It just become a very divine experience.

title: Very good
review: The "Arti" done here is less crowded and does not have the pomp and grandeur of Har-ki-Pauri, Hardwar, but is clean and simple.

title: Large wide Bank of river Ganges---great evening prayers !
review: The place is designed for a large number of pilgrims to sit and pray/watch the evening prayers to the Mother Ganges--the "Ganga Harathi pooja"---in the monsoon months when the water flow is copious, this place could be heavenly in the evening---the mountain,s the river, the thousands of lamps and the prayers !

title: Fabulous setting!
review: Disappointing after the Parmarth Ashram arti. However,  oil lamps lit by the faithful and  floated downstream at sunset are  breathtaking.

title: Riverside Marina
review: While attending a camp at Swami Dayanand Ashram, we walked to the Triveni Ghat to see the sun set. En route while walking along the broad walkway by the riverside -- which would be called a Marina -- we were surprised to see an elephant come down from the forest on the opposite bank of the Ganga. It drank water and soon was joined by two more elephants. All entered the water perhaps, for cool bath in the Ganga. After a while it grew too dark to see them.

title: too good...a must to do when you are in Rishikesh
review: I recommend that one should attend this aarti. It was a great experience to watch the whole event. If you are a spiritual person then you are going to enjoy this.

title: Mesmerising Experience
review: Must visit if you are in Rishikesh. I just sat there for hours, and seemed as if could sit for days altogether. Spiritual and peaceful.

title: Nice
review: Nice to see bit obviously a little touristy...more interesting to see the aarti in hardware, but this one is much more convenient if u don't have long

title: Spiritual Experience
review: The Aarti at Triveni Ghat was a spiritual experience. Although the numbers at the gathering was good, it was not crowded. We could really take some time and immerse in the overall experience of the ganga aarti.

title: Great Divine
review: Divine experience of this Ghat, had heard so much from my family and my parents asked me to visit. Have been living in Haridwar since last two years but could not visit earlier. This time I did and loved it.

title: Lovely atmosphere
review: Attended the Ganga aarti which started at 7 pm. was a appealing sight and the whole atmosphere is ceremoniously charged up. A good feeling to attend this world famous event. But I found the Narmada aarti at Jabalpur more attractive.

title: Superb
review: I love it

title: Decent daily local event
review: if you want to lose yourself within the local crowds of the city while being a part of a spiritually uplifting sight..visit the Triveni ghat aarti and soak in the view and take a dip in the river with the locals. It overlooks the forest and if you dont mind jostling through the crowded lanes to get there, it could be a nice evening jaunt.

title: Aarti @ Triveni Ghat
review: A bit disappointing . Very little ceremony. perhaps there are other evenings with greater ceremony. We sat up on top of the steps and had a good view of the activity down at the Ganga

title: must see for once
review: it requires a little patience as it takes time for the initial arrangements to be done and slowly and steadily a crowd builds around - so you'd be better to choose a place to sit towards the front i.e. facing and closer to the river. Once the aarti starts the chants drown all the anxiety and take you to the next world.

title: Too commercial
review: I love Ganga arti.. I like the sounds, the hymns, the diyas, the setting sun and the overall energy but I dont like it when such experiences get commercialized. Having attended the amazing evening arti at Ganga Kinare hotel and then at Parmarth ashram, Triveni Ghat was below my expectations.

title: magnificent time
review: This is really a magnificent time, Aarti on the Ganges is spectacular. it leaves a special atmosphere created.

title: Great Experience...
review: We went down to the Ghat in the early evening just before sunset. This is the best time to go as many people make their way down to the river for prayer and meditation. The atmosphere is surreal and as an outsider it was an incredible look into a different culture. A magical experience!

title: Spiritual Experience!
review: Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat was a superb experience. It should be a must do thing in your itinerary if you are visiting Rishikesh.

title: A Spiritual experience to kill for
review: The best and the holiest way to experience the Hindu culture and the importance of the River Ganga in the Hindu culture. Must for all !!!!

title: Wonderful
review: Wonderful location to observe or participate in an arti - evening celebration where fire is used for worship and candles are floated down the Ganges at sunset.  Not so crowded as to be distracting, it was quite lovely.

title: A Spiritual Experience
review: You have to experience it yourself to believe it. There is the Aarti being played over the loud speaker and scores of people on the Ghat chanting along...

title: Magical experience
review: This is my second time here, and I must say, the ceremony had a total different impact this time as compared to my other visit, which took place in 2007. This time, it did not impress me at all, as it did before: I asked myself why, but have no answer. Something had changed....but, I have to mention we went to the Arti Ceremony in Haridwar, which is 30 kmts. from Rishikesh, and must say this was breathtaking!! I highly recommend going there and live this experience.

title: wonderful experience
review: visiting Gang Ghat at the time of aarti was one of the most wonderful  experience that I ever had, the holy chants holy people all are superb

title: Excellent place.
review: Best time to visit triveni ghat is early in the morning. Sit there for at least 30 minutwes and you will feel the power of divinity.

title: Children of the Sun
review: The sacred music played and sung by the Brahmin boys of Parmath Niketan was possibly one of the most unforgettable experiences as the sun set over the Ganga

title: Triveni v. Ram Jhula v. Haridwar
review: After seeing all three, here's what I think of the basic difference in the evening Ganga prayers.

title: A Very Quaint Affair
review: We went to Aarti at Varanasi, Haridwar and Rishikesh. The Rishikesh version is by far the smallest and most local. Our favorite was Haridwar which was electric and authentic whereas the one at Varanasi is more theatrical and tourist oriented.

title: Must experience
review: One of the must have experiences of rishikesh. it makes a life time memory. standing there and watching the aarti go on, with everybody around you reverberating at the same frequency with all the minds focused at the aarti, this can be literally felt!

title: Most authentic Aarti in Rishikesh
review: The Aarti at Parmarth Niketan is nice but if you want a truly authentic experience of Aarti head down to the Triveni Ghat about a half hour before sunset. Celebrate with the local people (not the tourists up river) and experience the power of Aarti. Moved to tears every time. JGD

title: simple and sweet
review: This is the ancient aarti site where worship has continued for hundreds of years. Unfortunately the addition of bad loud speakers detracts.

title: crowded yet serene
review: the ice cold water is divine. everyone is having fun in the water. its crowded usually though parking is okay. only one changing room for women here. long queue. lines of trinket shops. loads of eateries nearby.

title: Clear the sediments
review: They are working hard to remove the deposits the overflowing ganges has left behind. The debri is almost 4 feet in height

title: Holy river!!
review: Loved the ritual and the view of the holy river of India Ganges. Although it was immensely crowded but was a wonderful experience.

title: Backdrop of mother Ganga makes it worth
review: Very bad sound system. No harmony within the singers. But, the view is amazing. The beggars who are mostly children are quite annoying. Difficult to get rid of them in a polite way. Be firm and say NO. In summers there is a chance to see the wild elephants on the other side of mother Ganga. Don't worry they are far off.

title: Deeply moving
review: Triveni Ghat is the heart off Rishikesh and attending the arti there is a deeply moving experience. It is a must visit for anyone in Rishikesh.

title: The grand arti
review: A beautiful place where ganges flows in full swing it is a pleasure to take a bath in the holy water and arti is one of the best in the evening where you will never find in India the godess is beautiful on the banks of the river you should see the place once in your life .

title: The Divine Experience as ever
review: Its the evening Aarti organised by Parmarth Niketan which is the foremost experience I plan my visit to Rishikesh for, every time. The Group of children singing in harmony, melodious bhajans, the environment, all makes one experience the divinness of the Great Ganga. One must attend when visiting Rishikesh.

title: very nice place
review: nice place, The arti ceremony at Trivani Ghat takes place daily at dusk. An Awe-inspiring sight, when flame of belief illuminates the entire environment and the mind and body rejuvenated by the hymns recited in praise of the Ganges. Devotees release flower-filled leaf boats carrying tiny oil lamps and let them float out on the river, which is the ceremony of worship, rememberance and hope.

title: Divine Experience
review: The Ganga Aari experience is something that can't be described in words as much as it can be felt. Despite the over-crowdde place at the time, you can easily isolate yourself and feel a connection with the divinity thats flowing - thats Ganga.

title: Soulful Place
review: While in Rishikesh, you can go to the Triveni Ghat...

title: Modern Ganga Aarti
review: This place had a more organised and modern Ganga aarti.Everything was done in an orderly manner.Very good message were being announced to make people aware of not polluting the Ganga.

title: pleased
review: riveni Ghat is a nice place to take a stroll in the evening and witness its famous ganga aarti. Though not very clean and with lots of beggars around yet it is a pleasant experience especially the river front and 6 km long marine drive walkway. Prachin Shani dev temple and the main market near the triveni ghat are worth visit

title: excellent
review: liked the ganga river view and the grand aarti the whole area of ghat was gr8 and it gives mental peace when u sit silently on the banks of ganga

title: Very few visitor around even when Yatra season had started.
review: One can get very close view but not a very colorful affair. The organizers allow anyone willing to participate in the Arati to pay a nominal amount for puja.

title: Ganga kinare
review: There is much better aarti than that at Haridwar. lMuch less crowded and better cleanliness. Feel the calm sitting at the banks of ganga seeing her flow.

title: A Holy Experience
review: Its a long walk to the Triveni Ghat from the drop off point for vehicles, so keep that in mind when planning to go for a puja there.The Ganges is at its best in Rishikesh and the whole experience of watching the Ganga aarti at the Ghat is amazing. They management manage the crowd quite well  inspite of the large nos. We didnt have any issues being there inspite of having a 5 year old and a 60 year old in the group.

title: Amazing
review: Wish I could be back there now to experience the deep devotion of Ganga Aarti and the beautiful presence of Mother Ganga.  We experienced Aarti at several places and they are all truly wonderful.  Not to be missed.

title: soulful peaceful , mindful

title: Colourful Ceremony

title: Mesmerizing experience again and again
review: Triveni Ghat is located near the main market of Rishikesh. 3 kms far from Ram Jhula & 5 kms far from Lakshman Jhula. Auto Rickshaw (Vikram) charges are Rs. 5 from Ram Jhula & Rs.10 from Lakshman Jhula (Tapovan) for sharing basis. The best thing i like about this place is atmosphere. Ghat is a ahindi word which means steps where people can take a holy bath at river. Triveni Ghat has a beautiful view of hills with River Ganga. Evening time it is full of local people and tourists. The best time to visit here is evening. Every evening there is small prayer for the holy river Ganges. So many people join this prayer. Pundit chants vedic mantras & use diyas (Oil Lights) for the prayer.  Its not about the religion but its about river or water which gives life to the people. Must visit place if you come to rishikesh.

title: Heavily staged managed: stick to Haridwar
review: Visited Rishikesh whilst staying in Haridwar.  Fortunately, we had seen Aarti there so had a comparison.  This was heavily stage managed to secure a dramatic and fawning entrance for the Guru.  The interminable chanting, with many westerners doing the Ashram thing, was followed by yet more chanting as the crowd split and the Guru entered, looking like a fugitive from the sixties.  His acolytes joined him as 'Hari Krishna' etc started.  Finally, a female American voice began an  infant school style assembly on falling leaves and Autumn to help us relate to Shiva.  I gave up and left.  It was lifeless and, I felt, with few genuine Hindus present.  Haridwar had been vital, alive and full of genuine Hindus expressing their faith through purification. This was for the tourists.

title: The grand Aarti
review: Aarti at river Ganga is very famous. Ganga is holy river and worshiped all over (mainly) north India. The Ganga Aarti at Banaras (UP), at Garh Ganga, at Haridwar and at Rishkesh are widly known for their grandness. At Triveni Ghat (Rishkesh) is specially enjoyable. To see one has to cross the Ganga through Laxan Jhula. There is sufficient space to sit for over 500 to 700 devotees. The small lighted Deepak moving of the river looks very beautiful. The Aarti is done by the Mahantji and the sound of band/ instruments echoe for about 1/2 hour. Tourist visiting Rishikesh should make it a point to see the Aarti.

title: Worth taking a stroll in the evening
review: Triveni Ghat is a nice place to take a stroll in the evening and witness its famous ganga aarti. Though not very clean and with lots of beggars around yet it is a pleasant experience especially the river front and 6 km long marine drive walkway. Prachin Shani dev temple and the main market near the triveni ghat are worth exploring.

title: Aarti by the Ganga
review: Aarti takes place during sunset next to the stunning aquamarine of the Ganges at Rishikesh.  It was a privilege to be able to witness this ritual; to be lost in the chants of the acolytes in their maroon and saffron robes (and even join in with one!). The fire which is central to the ceremony is passed around in lamps for everyone to rotate and pass on.  It was a very inclusive experience, with everyone making me feel very welcome.

title: Felt like a performance, not a puja
review: I most disliked the recorded bollywood style kirtans with orchestral accompaniment. I attended for 6 nights as I had a room just behind the ghat.

title: If you can get there, congratulate yourself?
review: Well Rishikesh was supposed to be this quiet little town when we were growing up and hardly anyone except the vagabond and hippie firangis and those of us who seeked to erase third eye blindness, were those who found a destination in Rishikesh. Well gone are those days. Now, it is FULL. Rishikesh is as crowded now as Chandni Chowk or Bhendi Bazaar or 5th Avenue. But it tops all other destinations, but it does NOT have roads, nor any traffic enforcement. So lo behold...if you want to get to Triveni Ghat, you can forget it. You just wont reach there, till everyone who is in Triveni Ghat before you, starts to come back...and then all of them will be reciprocal to you anyway, so its better to turn back and go to your hotel. Triveni Ghat used to be magical once. Rishikesh just happened to it.

title: Interesting must-have experience
review: This is a must-have experience in almost every location along the Ganga. Each location, the practice and experience is different. Here, there are Hanuman bhajans (songs) sung by the local Swamiji in accompaniment by many in the audience. The spontaneous response of so many in the audience (irrespective of nationality, ethnicity, background, etc) is very moving.

title: Nice river view
review: Rishikesh has many temples to visit. But I liked river Ganga view the most. Its fast and has nice views to grab. Triveni ghat has also some nice views in store. After getting out from rickshaw, you have to travel little for river view. Some more temples are also nearby but walking is must. I liked Lord Shiva's statue showcasing river Ganga getting out from his hairs typically known as "Ganga avataran". The background is just scenic. Another statue of Lord Krishna giving message of Geeta to Arjun is excellent. We viewed at evening time hence it was looking very nice and giving us peace of mind remembering Lord Krishna and his Geeta. We observed many saints and sadhus sitting there peacefully. Local people tell that river Ganga, Yamuna and Saraswati meet here. Instead of challenging it, I liked the sacredness behind it. I must admire that in Rishikesh nobody chases you for any cause; neither rickshaw, beggars, priests, nobody. I felt quite peaceful here.

title: Money minded visits.
review: Triveni ghat has a segregation based on who pays extra for a pooja at the ghat. Those availing these services and paying extra get to sit at the front. If you try to go and sit at the front, the goons present will misbehave with you and ask for some money to sit there. In short completely money minded management who are not at all interested in managing the place better without any discrimination or biasness.

title: Aarti
review: Aarti at the Ghaat starts just as the sun sets, so there is no fixed time for it. It is advisable to get there a bit earlier. We were told that it starts around 6.30 pm, however, when we got there just after 6.15 it had already started.

title: Money minded visits.
review: Triveni ghat has a segregation based on who pays extra for a pooja at the ghat. Those availing these services and paying extra get to sit at the front. If you try to go and sit at the front, the goons present will misbehave with you and ask for some money to sit there. In short completely money minded management who are not at all interested in managing the place better without any discrimination or biasness.
